product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
TWO

Not a go-to for me; this is a report after finishing a 2 ml decant. I picked it up to compare with my all-time summer favorite (Dior Homme Cologne) and a shoulder-season staple (Bergamote 22).

BdC smells great, especially if you like citrus (I do). It is less “iced lemonade” than Dior Homme Cologne and more like the whole fruit.

TL;DR: A photoreal take on an Italian citrus most of us have not smelled in person. Bright citrus-green opening that settles into a light woody-musky hush. Polite, easy, pleasant, but likely to underwhelm on performance, especially projection.

Rating:
Opening: 4.1/5
Drydown: 2.8/5
Overall: 3.5/5

Opening
Fresh-cut bergamot on a board. Knife through peel and pith, oils mist up with a green-bitter spritz. The interior is ripe enough to read a touch sweet. Sweet, acidic, and green at once. The blend is seamless; I do not see edges between the citrus, ginger, and bergamot. Together they paint a convincing bergamot portrait.

The issue: despite smelling fantastic, it lies flat on my skin. Detectable at about two feet, but it does not seem to want to be smelled. Where Dior Homme Cologne leaps off my skin, this is reticent and almost apologetic.

Heart
No distinct heart notes on me; it stays linear. At about 90 minutes I am still getting that beautiful bergamot, just closer to skin.

For a fresh scent, it is oddly dense, like the aroma is bound up in the fruit’s oil and cannot quite escape.

Drydown
The opening thins to skin level around 3-4 hours. By about 4.5 hours it is a soft, slightly creamy (benzoin?) skin-musk.

A faint musk trace sticks around 6-8 hours, but only with your nose on skin. Nice to wake up to, but no one else will notice.

Performance on me
This gets dunked on online for atrocious longevity. On me it is not atrocious, just not great. About 60-90 minutes of a modest aura, then close to skin. 3-4 hours of practical wear on skin. It is a liberal respray fragrance, and because the musky base is light, you can reapply a few times a day without issue.

Versatility
Wearable anywhere because it is so understated. That same understatement means I will not reach for it often, and it will not justify a full bottle. Too flat, too little projection.

Use cases
Patio brunch where you want to smell nice on the first hug. Business meetings where you want to be pleasant but not noticed as the cologne person. Around home when you want a quiet scent for yourself.

Vibe
Crisp white tee, rolled-sleeve linen, top down on a windy coastal road in a posh red roadster. Polished, sunny, approachable.

Blind-buy safe?
If you like citrus, yes. If you crave projection, no. This is about scent quality, not horsepower.

Comparisons
- **Dior Homme Cologne (2020):** More acidic up top, the famous iced lemonade vibe. BdC smells more like an actual fruit. DHC projects better in the first hour; BdC sits closer but can linger longer as a skin trace.
- **Bergamote 22:** Similar green-bergamot aura, but B22 is brighter from grapefruit and offers a proper second chapter with its vetiver-forward drydown.

Overall take
Bergamotto di Calabria smells wonderful up front, juicy citrus that reads like the whole fruit: bitter skin and sweet juice. It is sheer, not a statement. You will smell pleasant; people around you may not notice. The rub is not just longevity, which is average for a citrus, but the flat projection while it is there.

I like the scent, but with Bergamote 22 and Dior Homme Cologne on my shelf, it is redundant. I would love a cheaper replacement for B22, given it begs liberal resprays.

Context: Four sprays on a warm day (two wrists). Indoors in a warm room, likely less projection and a slightly longer tail. Sprayed on moisturized skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Divine lemon opening. More floral and unisex drydown but still beautiful scent. Longevity and projection are not notoriously bad as some people say but the truth is you have to overspray which is not a very big problem as you can get a big bottle relatively cheap. The only downside is that you can get some whiffs of synthetic cleaning product smell from time to time but it is not offensive. Other than that quality is great. My first aqua di Parma and given that is not the most popular i can’t wait to try more. 8/10 easy !

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Can AdP make a mediocre scent? I think not. So far Mandorlo di Sicilia is the least liked AdP I have smelled, and that is a pretty nice scent. Coming to this scent, bergamot is such a common note yet there's a lot different smelling notes. Anyway, BdC (Bergamotto di Calabria in this review, not Bleu de Chanel) is a scent I really liked. It is quite similar to Mancera Lemon Line, which too I like. The big difference is that Mancera lists lemon but no bergamot, yet smells suspiciously similar initially. The Mancera lasts longer, but the BdC smells nicer, more natual.

Now there's a host of products from insect repellents/bug sprays to floor disinfectants to room freshers that have a similar smelling perfume component so many might be put off by those less "luxury" oriented products having similar odor - but if you're willing to see, or smell, past that, this BdC is a beautiful scent.

Longevity is okayish being an EDT concentration scent. Projects well initially, but seems like a skin scent in 2 hrs or less, nothing unusual as that's the case with most EDTs/EDPs from the past 20 years or so.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Today, I'm diving into the final sample I possess from Acqua di Parma's Blu Mediterraneo collection: Bergamotto di Calabria. Based purely on its name, I'm anticipating that bergamot will be the undeniable star of this olfactory journey. While I certainly appreciate bergamot—it's a widely utilized note for very good reason—it's not typically a note I actively seek out in fragrances I ultimately acquire. However, with it poised as the focal point here, I'm hoping for a truly exceptional representation of the note. Will this offering surpass my experience with yesterday's Arancia di Capri? Let's get into it and find out.


Opening:
The opening is a luminous burst of radiant citrus, crisp spiciness, and invigorating freshness. The primary notes that immediately greet my senses are bergamot, citron, ginger, and musk. Bergamot and citron are the undeniable protagonists. The bergamot, as one might instinctively imagine, is the commanding presence in this initial accord. It delivers a citrus vibrancy, underscored by that hallmark aromatic spiciness one expects from a bergamot note, though perhaps not quite as pronounced as some other iterations I've encountered. Following closely is the citron, which amplifies the citrus with a distinctly brighter and zestier character, also carrying with it a subtle hint of rindiness. Next, ginger and musk join the composition. The ginger presents itself as a fresh and invigorating spicy accord, artfully counterbalancing the abundance of citrus-forward notes. Lastly, a whisper of musk lingers in the background, offering a fresh, almost fuzzy tonality, reminiscent of that clean "fresh laundry" essence musk can sometimes possess.


Dry Down:
The dry down continues the journey, evolving into a composition that is still predominantly citrusy, distinctly aromatic, and gently woody. The primary notes I discern are bergamot, citron, vetiver, and musk. Bergamot and citron remain the highlights in the dry down. The bergamot still commands attention, retaining its core citrusy accord, but it has become noticeably more aromatic and spicy than it was in the opening. The citron continues its supportive role to the bergamot, offering the same bright and zesty citrus quality, though it now feels rounder and smoother than in its initial presentation. This enduring citrus heart is then joined by vetiver and musk. The vetiver subtly emerges in the dry down, providing a delicate woodiness, beautifully accentuated by a hint of that "fresh grass" accord that vetiver notes sometimes carry. Lastly, the musk continues to provide a touch of clean freshness in the background, echoing its presence from the opening.


Performance:
The initial projection is moderate to strong, extending its aura approximately three to four feet. Sillage mirrors this, leaving a scent trail that is certainly noticeable but never overpowering. However, by the three-hour mark, the fragrance had largely receded to a mere whisper on the skin. There was a faint, almost ethereal projection and scent trail, but not enough to truly register.


When to Wear:
Bergamotto di Calabria, as its character suggests, is undeniably a spring and summer fragrance, ideally suited for daytime wear. It possesses an effortless, easy-going vibe, making it a perfect companion for casual outings, any activity enjoyed under the sun, or even a refreshing choice for the gym. Due to that casual nature, I wouldn't consider it appropriate for anything formal or for typical office wear, where a more refined presence might be desired.


Blind Buy:
If you are a devoted admirer of bergamot or simply appreciate bright and invigorating fresh fragrances in general, Bergamotto di Calabria would certainly be worth exploring. Just bear in mind that its fleeting nature means you'll likely need to reapply it if you wish to enjoy its charms throughout the day.


Final Verdict:
What can I truly say about Bergamotto di Calabria? It was, without a doubt, a fresh and vibrant fragrance, with an emphasis on its namesake note. As I've expressed before, bergamot isn't a note that consistently sends me into raptures, and I honestly don't feel that the bergamot in this particular fragrance did anything radically different or groundbreaking compared to other iterations I've encountered. It smells undeniably pleasant, yet it offers nothing particularly special or memorable. My significant disappointment, however, stems from the fact that this fragrance suffers from the exact same Achilles' heel that plagued Arancia di Capri: its performance is notably lackluster. By the time I truly settled in to appreciate the nuances of its dry down, it had already receded to a mere whisper on the skin, making it challenging to discern the individual notes. At least Arancia di Capri, despite its brevity, left me with a truly captivating opening. Needless to say, this is not a fragrance I will be considering for a full bottle purchase. Next on my agenda is the celebrated Colonia line from Acqua Di Parma. It's a collection that enjoys considerable recognition and discussion, and I am earnestly hoping it leaves a more impactful and lasting impression than my experiences with the Blu Mediterraneo line have.


Scent: 7/10
Longevity: 5/10
Sillage: 5/10
Mass Appeal: High
Versatility: Average
Gender: Unisex, leaning masculine
Value: Way overpriced

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Seems like it was some kind of funny green scent…

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Holy F*** I love this fragrance to death. It’s my top 5 for sure. I like lemon fragrances a lot.

Aqua di parma blew this one out of the park. I’m overspraying this everyday for summer.

It may not have longevity or protection so BEWARE. there are other better lemon freshies.

Better projections Citruses would be Eros Energy or Light blue Forever. Or Terre D’Herme. Roja Burlington 1819.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gorgeous and very realistic aroma of lemon and bergamot with a slight note of cedar and musk. Truly a summer masterpiece.
Stays on the skin for about five minutes tho.
This could have been my favourite summer fragrance if not the terrible performance. The first perfume in my memory for which a half litre capacity would be justified.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has been my most used fragrance by far this summer. The scent itself is quite simple and linear, however that is just as much of an upside as it is a downside - you can apply this mindlessly in nearly any summer setting and you'll be fine. My only 2 issues with the fragrance are the high retail price and terribly weak performance, however ADP bottles are regularly available for significantly under retail (I bought my 150ml bottle for 95 CAD, or ~70 USD), which makes any qualms I have easily forgivable.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a 1oz bottle if anyone’s interested. I bought it by mistake and it can’t be returned

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I once wished i could smell like lemon sherbet. The dream came true

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely love the opening as it is an incredibly well done citrus/bergomot opening. If it could just stay that way it would be phenominal. As it starts drying down, those wonderful notes give way to a flowery bouquet and ginger and gets incredibly weaker fast. I don't know if my skin hates this or what but all but disappears within an hour or two.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One of the best smelling fragrances and best bergamot scent ever. There is always a trade off with natural smelling notes and performance. Being the best smelling scent in its category will have the obvious trade off of non-beast performance.

That said I believe most people go nose blind to fragrances early on, it doesnt last "30 minutes". I get 6 hours of a soft projecting heavenly scent.

Generally speaking natural notes have weak performance, it has to be enhanced by synthetics which will change the scent so its a compromising battle between the 2.

I own many ADP frags (more than any other house) and I do so for their scents (which I think is the best smell to cost ratio)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opening is glorious .
Who loves citrus in fragrances this is for you .
The only problem for me is that it transforms later to a very sweet orange smell wich i dont like so prominent. I like it but not enough to get another bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: It smells amazing. I love this scent because of it’s fresh and happy character. For me based on smell it’s a 10/10. But its biggest problem is the longevity , the amazing opening smell lasts for like 40 minutes. I’d describe this scent as a bergamot sorbet but in a good way. The longetivity is a shame.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: quite a nice sharp citron opening, really addictive but poor underwhelming longevity, nice enough to get a small decant and just reapply during the day though

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So this is an interesting scent
I tried it and fell in love with the scent
Its a nice citrusy clean fresh fragrance
Safe blind buy i reccomend it
9.5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells fresh and expensive.
Ideal day time summer scent.
I'm on my third bottle, so one could say I like it a lot. 😊

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: 10 minutes of heavenly citrus experience which somehow I find to be zingy, fizzy, almost boozy tonic-like! Which is surprisingly pleasant... only to fade rather quick and turn to become more fresh-spicy, ginger-focused average cologne, that is somewhat uninspiring. I'd probably keep spraying for the opening though, it's to die for.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my go-to summer scent! It's so fresh and bright thanks to the bergamot and citron. The ginger adds a subtle kick that makes it really interesting.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have such an ambivalent feeling about this one it's even hard to explain. Lemon and bergamot are in my top 5 notes as I simply love citrus smell, with this one in the opening you get a Mike Tyson KO, jaw-breaking punch of both, it's beautiful.

It starts to dry down and that's where it disappoints a little, the citrus is barely there, flowers kick in with a hint of cedar and ginger. It goes from mascilune/unisex to unisex/female fragrance at this point.

My problem is, you put a bergamot in a name of the fragrance and you get a minute of it, I think the more fitting name would be 'Fiori di Calabresi'. The second thing I noticed, at one point between citrus punch turning into flowery base it smelled like lemon diswashing gel, I think this is why people say it smells 'generic' and 'chemical', it's just a brief moment but you notice it.

It's weak with intimate sillage, it's overpriced, I could get better ones for less value...



...but somehow, I still like it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nice, but underwhelming. I’m surprised at how simplistic this is, given the complexity of Fico di Almalfi. I was expecting the same sort of brilliance in blending.

Opening is a bright citrus with a touch of ginger; it reminds me of this lemongrass soap I have. Very pleasant, but as a personal fragrance, kind of “meh.” The citrus disappears quickly, and I’m left with a fresh, woody floral. Again, lovely, but nothing really unique to set it apart from similar fragrances. Eventually the fragrance dries down to a skin scent.

Performance is abysmal. Stays very close to the skin, and lasts no more than a couple of hours.

This is something I’d gladly wear if I received it as a gift, but definitely wouldn’t spend money on an FB myself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Perfect vacay scent, love the smell and the ginger note is the star of the show imo (makes it “spritzy”). People are complaining about the longevity, but I couldn’t be boterhed less, the perfect blend between green fresh and sweet fresh and it reminds of the vacays on Sardinia (Italy). This is the best from the blue line imo because it’s actually a freshie and not to sweet like fico di Amalfi and the orange one (forgot the name).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
the whole house does italian citrus style like no other. the bergamot here is so lovely.

i agree with the longevity however this is misunderstood as pointed out. stop calling things ''generic''. just a dumb lazy buzz word at this point. like what exactly is generic about it? its a citrus scent, we know. but after you go thru 100 fragrances you might just end up with 3 to 4 with a take on bergamot exactly like this. the note was always a top note. but you are able to enjoy that top note for longer than you usually would albeit it doesn't have any complexity or longevity. it does what it does in the name. try to look past that. fragrances like this have a place in the world. they're meant to give this feeling of refreshment that heavier compositions cannot offer you. even if it was slightly based out more. it wouldn't give you that ultra fresh feeling. these southern italian's know their climate.

it's for when the sun is trying to burn you alive. it cools you down. the heat will give a scent bubble that will come to life and soothe you like angels flapping their wings on you!

but no i 100% get it. it's not worth the money just for that. the blu line are perfect gym scents tho. because of the poor longevity and scent profile. it will make you stand out in that environment like nothing else. and it'll be so comfortable to wear for you and those around during your 1-2 hour work out. the right tool for the job!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Bergamotto di Calabria is all about bright, fresh citrus. You get vibrant bergamot and citron upfront, with a bit of ginger to keep it lively. It's clean, easygoing, and classic Acqua di Parma.

If you've smelled other scents in the Blu Mediterraneo line, it might feel familiar. There’s some cedarwood, vetiver, and musk for warmth, but it sticks to the usual citrus vibe.

If you're into bergamot, you'll like it—high-quality and simple. But if you're looking for something different, it’s just another solid, everyday citrus fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Performance wise this isn't even an EDT, it's like a cologne that you splash on after a shower and it's gone by the time you're fully dressed. The scent itself is pretty classy but lacking character, the base notes don't go deep enough. I bought this to wear as a tourist in Italy and it suited the occasion perfectly, it worked in high heat.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Update after one year: This one is really misunderstood! Yes, citruses are volatile by nature so don't expect nuclear projection, but if I spray it on my neck around 9AM in the summer, I still get traces of it around 7PM, sweating in the gym, unlike Creed GIT which is twice the price of this.

It works wonders in the scorching heat, where it projects moderately for the first two hours, and then settles down as a long lasting skin scent. Tart, green, fresh and unisex, leaning masculine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this... I found a little sample in a thrift store and just finished it- it's so fresh and delightful. I am starting to really crave that tart/sweet citrusy blast- particularly when it's hot and humid, like it was today. I saw reviews saying the longevity is not great, and while it doesn't project for long, the citrus does remain detectable on my skin for quite awhile, as a citrusty skin scent... then mellows down even more to a sweet musk. It's really lovely.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ugh. This entire line. Brief, 15 minute citrus burst. Lovely if a bit generic. Minimal sillage or projection. After 15 minutes it is a skin scent. After 45 minutes, on my skin and to my nose, it is gone.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Useful update/
Spray it on your clothes for max longetivity up to +4hrs.
It's the first EDT i have brought from this collection, when i was in Doha airport trying to find something suitable for every day fresh scent and i got two suggestions from the counter lady: Fico & Bergamatto then my journey started with the top notes: citron and bergamote then ginger.
This combination gives the fresheness and the zest with a slight sweetness required from happily starting your day for 20-30 minutes- i really hoped if it can stay more longer than this on clothes- then it becomes a skin scent due to Musk and disappering.
scent: 9/10
longetivity: weak 2/10, but despite of this, i will buy another bottle for the 20 minutes morning happiness :)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is lovely and bright but was genuinely gone off my skin in within 30 minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: My go-to bergamot summer scent with Bergamote by The Different Company (greener, sweeter, muskier). I treat it as an eau de cologne, I do not overspray but reapply frequently. It still leaves a noticeable (and delicious) trace on clothes the day after. I much prefer this kind of transparent and wide spectrum scent compared to citrus artificially stretched over hours by overdoses of white musks (looking at you Vuitton)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is my all time favorite smelling summer freshie. It's so pleasant and satisfying but as everyone else says it doesn't last long. But since you can get a huge 5oz bottle for under $100 I'll always keep buying it and spraying heavily. It just smells so damned good. It's the smell of Italian summer happiness.

Pro Tip: for better performance and longevity spray a layer and let it dry. Then spray another layer on top of the dried layer. This makes it las longer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very well crafted citrus smell, but the longevity can be measured in seconds, it's not even funny.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: It is the best across Blu Mediterraneo line unfortunately the performance is weak however you can still smell it after few hours because of the ambroxan.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This a beautiful fresh scent, but it's the shortest performing fragrance I've tried yet. Not all citrus fragrances are *this* short. It almost completely vanished after 2 hours, and during that time I was at home sitting down, not sweating in the heat.

edit: after testing it in warm weather, the actually perceptible part, where you don't have to put your nose on your skin and concentrate to notice it, lasts shorter than the 4711 cologne.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very refreshing and bright, I love this so much. It feels invigorating, and is good for scorching hot weather.

It dries down more aquatic, this aquatic vibe reminds me of an indoor swimming pool. The bergamot nuances…

This is cologne-style, so obviously it doesn’t last all day or anything… but a nice spritz gives you that refreshing “buzz”, which is exactly what I want from colognes.

Unisex/Masculine. The price you can get this for is awesome. 8/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very yummy. Reccomend

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like the green sour patch kid

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: green and fresh, but first orangey 💚 i love bergamot

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After having this on my wishlist for a VERY long time, I finally bought this but unfortunately am somewhat disappointed.
First off, I got a 30ml bottle and I hate it. Instead if having the proportions of the larger bottle, it is kindof tall and narrow and abit disappointing. Even the small samples in the discovery kit are the same kindof wider proportion so I don't get it. Anyway, not that important if the fragrance actually performed.
So the fragrance is really nice, I mostly get the bergamot and ginger notes on my skin. It is PERFECT for summer, so refreshing, I tested it out on a hot day in Sicily. However, the performance is where this falls short. It has near to zero projection, pretty much turns into a skin scent after 10 minutes, and I cannot smell it any more after pretty much 1 hour. How they charge such extortionate prices for such disappointing performance is beyond me. It's a pity as I really really REALLY think that if this has more sillage and better lasting power, it would be my go to summer scent. Worth the money? No, I don't think so.
I currently have Mirto di Panarea from the same collection as a tester and will be testing it out soon as apparently it has better staying power, will have to see, but for now I am surely done buying from this range. My next freshie to try shall be Pomelo Riviera from Atelier des Ors.

EDIT: I am trying this again on a hot day (I believe it's like 30degC) and I OVERSPRAYED a little. I am about 1 hour in and I still smell it on me and do not feel the need to reapply. If this can do at least 3 hours I will be much happier, I am ok with reapplying especially since citrus fragrances in general do not last.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: great smell, shitty performance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very realistic and sour lemon opening but longevity seems to be the issue here as other have said it seems to be gone after 30 minutes

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I fell in love with the opening, which is the reason I bought it. I didn't wait for the dry down when I first smelled it in the store I found it in, and that is the reason I am sending it right back. The opening is lovely; a super realitistic lemon, but not sour or acidic smelling, but rather sllightly sweet, just enough sweet to tone down the acidity of the lemon. The dry down though, just smells like lemon scented massage oil. The longevity isn't as bad as the other reviews say, It's strong for around 1,5 hours, but last signs of any smells is around 3,5 hours after applying.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely love this fragrance. It's bright, beautiful and smooth. I love the bergamot. I just can't justify re-applying it every hour-especially for the price. But even if money were no object I still couldn't do it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very realistic smell of leaves and nature; green and crisp, resinous and sweet. Like a freshly-trimmed tree. Sits close to the skin but lasts for a good 12 hours. A beautiful unisex green citrus. Can't get enough of it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love this fragrance so much, the scent is in my opinion 10/10. Its really close to dior homme cologne but this stuff is better but here comes the big problem

Longevity is max 30 minutes its gone before you can get to work/school/event and its so sad

Scent 9,8/10

sillage 2,3/10

longevity 1,2/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sits extremely close to skin, barely discernible within 30-45 minutes. Pleasing smell, unfortunately not able to withstand the humid climate I live in.

Would have considered buying otherwise.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's the first EDT i have brought from this collection, when i was in Doha airport trying to find something suitable for every day fresh scent and i got two suggestions from the counter lady: Fico & Bergamatto then my journey started with the top notes: citron and bergamote then ginger.
This combination gives the fresheness and the zest with a slight sweetness required from happily starting your day for 20-30 minutes- i really hoped if it can stay more longer than this on clothes- then it becomes a skin scent due to Musk and disappering.
scent: 9/10
longetivity: weak 2/10, but despite of this, i will buy another bottle for the 20 minutes morning happiness :)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance really does citrus so well. This was a blind buy for me, and I’m very satisfied. For me, some citrus’s can come off really screechy and headache inducing, but this is blended very smoothly. I probably wouldn’t wear this unless it’s the summer, but that’s why I bought it, to take with me on vacation and to deal with the high heat.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pleasant fragrance indeed but not my cup of tea, too fresh for my taste. But surely a pleasant fragrance to wear on a hot summer day, gives you an elegant holiday vibe.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Worst perfume I've ever bought. Never seen a perfume which doesn't last more than 10 minutes with zero sillage. I need to reload every 10 to 15 minutes. I barely smell it. Don't buy and waste your money. Shame on this brand.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent has an amazing je ne sais quois that reminds me of a cozy summer morning, when you wake up in fresh, pillowy linens. If anything needed a concentration boost, it’s this one. I would have this in constant rotation if it had that MFK strength.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: beautiful, pure lemon but disappeared after literally 30 minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sharp, invigorating and realistic citrus at the opening (as I expect from Acqua de Parma) that turns into nothing after 30 or 40 minutes. I am not someone who complains about longevity, specially in citrus fragrances like this, but the performance in this case is absolute abysmal for the price point.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Good summer scent. Fresh citrus and bergamot, mixed with flowers. Feminine take on a citrus scent.

The flowers become more prominent after an hour or two. Easy reach on a warm day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
We are in the midst of a heatwave here in Ireland, so I sprayed this at a department store on a hot day. There is a wide range in the Blu Mediterraneo collection, and I suspect that they are all freshies of some description. I picked this one up at random. Bergamotto di Calabria is a straightforward citrus cologne with a woody-spicy base. It is simple and traditional in structure, perfectly unisex and serves its purpose well - it is very refreshing. However, it is also very fleeting.

BMBdC opens with a radiant citrus accord, zesty and fresh. It is aptly named - bergamot is the dominant note, but there is a hint of lemon. I get a hint of spice, and a soft woodiness emerges as it fades. It develops and fades to nothing extremely quickly though - it is one of the most ephemeral scents I've come across. Sillage is intimate and longevity is very weak.

Pleasant but pretty generic, this is let down by its abysmal performance, and is overpriced for what it is despite not being too expensive. Just buy a big bottle of 4711 EDC instead and be done with it. 2/5.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
#194 in my "Tour de Fragrance"

Fleeting, ephemeral, evanescent, fugitive, momentary, transient, transitory, passing so quickly as to make apprehending it difficult. Translation: The performance totally sucks. Seriously. It won't last long enough for you to tie your tie. I've long since learned reviewers on here really tend to overrate the fragrances. Everyone who gave this lemon water a higher rating than 2.00 would probably give five stars to a bottle of BODman. Are you kidding me? The performance here is "Yachtman" bad, but at least with those scents you're only out like $5.95. I have now tried every AdP "Blu Mediterraneo" scent and I'll save you time. "Blu Mediterraneo Mandorlo Di Sicilia" isn't a complete waste of money. But you can go on Gift Express, sort on price, buy any scent that's under $10, I guarantee the performance will be as good or better than this Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto. Adidas, Jaguar, Cuba Paris. Okay, maybe not every Cuba Paris, but "Copacabana" at least works as a bathroom deodorizer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Another slightly sour citrus!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice fresh zingy citrus and 'blue' opening. Drydown has a slightly piercing astringent-aromatic quality that I associate with classic men's fragrance, and I find too strong and severe on me. I think I would love smelling this on a dude.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Plain lemon/citrus smell with barely any other notes, longevity is zero and you really have to sniff the skin to feel it, and that is immediately after applying.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Summer Scent: 6,5/10. Pretty harsh citrus in the opening after that it smells a bit like cleaning soap. but it doesn't last at all. Sillage: 2/10 Longevity 1/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I must say, I've never come across a fragrance that smells as incredible as this one. It's hands down the best perfume I've ever encountered. However, I have to admit, I'm pretty bummed out by its performance. The scent vanishes within an hour, which is quite disappointing. I'm determined to find a similar perfume that has better staying power.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Probably one of the weakest perfomers out there even for Blu Mediteranneo standards. That said it's very clean, lemony and a no-brainer for summer if you don't mind the performance. Opens with sharp and almost alcholic bergamot, then it settles for ginger and vetiver. Can't detect florals or the cedar. Surprisingly, I get wafts of it during the day and in the gym, but it is as faint as it gets. Safe to overspray as it is so light and borderline undetectable, but in the end it settles for a nice lemon-candy-esque smell. I also get whiffs of lime every now and then.

Got mine from a discounter and the price for 150 ml was a steal, so I'll let it macerate a bit, perhaps it will improve with time.

The bottle though is really beautiful.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This may be the weakest performing fragrance from a major niche or designer house I've yet to smell in my years of reviewing.

If you go right down to the skin and sniff it, it's pretty, with bergamot and citron and ginger; but I could not recommend anyone buy this because it's so faint.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bright, zesty, zingy, slightly sweet, natural citrus fragrance. Not the first of its kind, pretty simple, but very well done. I detect a slight resemblance with Fico di Amalfi in the dry down that I suspect is benzoin. Sadly the worst performing fragrance out of this collection I have tried, and the collection is not exactly known for good longevity and performance. If you wanted to smell like this all day, you would have to reapply every 30 minutes for your fragrance to actually be detectible in the air and not only sit on the skin. I still like it a lot though. 7/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was expecting a bog standard citrus from this but that musky dry down is to die for, not what I expected at all. I'd be interested to see how this compares to Molecule 01+Mandarin because what I'm left with after the citrus fades is what I remember Molecule 01 to be like. It could possibly be a cheaper option that would satisfy me as this is not cheap, especially being an EDT - the bergamot sparkles but doesn't last. However, I'm considering splashing out on a bottle for that drydown alone.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: It does smell fresh and chic but as it is a bit too citrusy on me it ends up reminding me of insect repellent. Mostly a summer day fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: great blend, perfectly unisex. the main problem with this fragrance is the performance, for me it last 3 hours on a good day. The aroma brings me back to my childhood holiday trips to Italy. if i wanted to use this in the summer, am bringing the bottle with me and respraying after 4 hours or so.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think it smells like a gorgeous freshy that is very natural and pleasent smelling if you have tried the colonia this is similar but less complex and more youthfull

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells a lot like a sweeter version of Bergamote 22. It has the same sweet, citrusy DNA as Fico di Amalfi without the fig and soapy dry down. I unloaded an entire sample vial on my chest and it was all gone in about an hour. While it smells great, it's only for a brief moment, so I really can't justify paying any money for a scent this short-lived.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a beautiful, realistic citrus with a nice spicey edge. Unfortunately this does not last long at all, even on clothes, even the base notes. Sadly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Love it!
Perhaps a tad intense in the beginning but after 1 hour the smell that sets is very pleasant and long lasting

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Like it don’t love it, doesn’t smell as good as other aqua di Parma’s but has pretty solid performance, very fresh and citrusy could maybe use a touch of salinity to balance it out

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mediterranean Neroli
vorachooma few seconds ago

Opens with realistic bergamot, dries down becomes a very relaxing smooth vetiver with some flowers and the remaining the bitter juicyness of bergamot from top notes.

I got very weak performance. 1 hour of good projection with bright and clear notes then quickly transform into smooth super close skin scent and completely disappear in 3 hours.

To me, I see this fragrance as a personal relaxing experience rather than a fragrance that you wear to a particular place or see a particular person or for particular situation. Spray it, enjoy it, and repeat.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very classy cologne smell, really quite lovely, lightly spicy citrus perfect for summer. Perfectly unisex too. But, as other reviewers have pointed out, the performance is abysmal. For the price it is a hard pass!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I own, if not all, then almost all, the Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo line of fragrances and this one has become my favorite of the bunch. Reasonable projection (sillage) for a citrus, especially in the first 30-60 minutes––at least this seems to be the case for me in warm weather, as summer is the only season I've had the opportunity to wear it in so far. An invigorating citrus, though subtly, artfully tweaked by just the right balance of just the right selection of secondary, underlying scents (e.g., ginger, cedar, floral). To my mind, this arguably makes it something of a minor masterpiece. One way I enjoy it is applying it in the last couple hours of my late night work shift on top of almost anything I put on earlier that day, which, by that point, is pretty far into the drydown stage.

[Side note: When it comes to longevity, citrus scents are typically weak, and often very weak. It just comes with the territory. If you're buying a citrus fragrance––any citrus fragrance––don't do so for longevity. The easy solution, however, is just reapply every couple hours and enjoy that just-like-the-first-time application all over again.]

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like it, it’s fresh, great for the summer but the longevity and the silage is really disappointing. After about 30min you can barely smell it. Wouldn’t suggest buying a full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the most beautiful, elevated, complex citruses. The cedar gives it this lovely maturity and depth, while the bergamot stays fresh. This is such a lovely sparkly dry scent. There is something special about it that I can’t quite it my finger on. However, it is very short lived, so I recommend wearing it over an unscented lotion.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: FIRST IMPRESSION: I use some bergamot essential oils at the gym when I use the sauna, and to me this smells nothing like that. To me this was straight up sparkly lime juice. After about 20 minutes though the citrus does fade and you are left with a clean yet a very slight powdery dry down. I blind bought the 5fl oz bottle for only like 40 bucks because Max Aroma was running a deal. Not bad. But not a favorite. Will have to wear it more.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Extremely good smell.
EXTREMELY short lasting.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like this fragrance, I've now worn it multiple times to get a better sense of it: the opening is a strong citrus blast, it feels like someone just squeezed a lime into a cocktail, it's very pleasant though and not at all artificial feeling.

When it settles down the citrus smell remains but becomes more muted, after a few hours I'm left with a very fresh, clean smell. Almost like someone used some imaginary super-high-end laundry detergent that doesn't actually exist but I wish did. In the final stages it smells quite similar to Mirto di Panarea but just a bit lighter/fresher.

Really nice for a summer's day

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Dry pleasant and natural smelling citrus woody scent but the performance for me at least is terrible.
I like it but wouldn’t buy a full bottle based on performance alone. Would be respraying every hour.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like this one a lot, but definitely not for myself or any other males. I bought this as a blind purchase. Longevity is questionable. What turns me off most about this fragrance is that I definitely sense that it’s more feminine than unisex, most likely due to the heavy floral mid-base. It does remind me of one of my female friends in high school who would basically douse herself with heavily floral fragrances every morning before class, and her smell would make me gag once she was within a 10-foot radius from me. I wouldn’t recommend this to any of my male friends. Gave it away to one of my cousins, and she absolutely loved it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Which is the most NATURAL-smelling fragrance you have ever smelled?

ME:
Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria by the Niche Italian house ACQUA DI PARMA 🍋🧼💦

This is so special, it feels LEMONY, CLEAN and Vivid.

With one of the most tender dry out I've ever felt, always maintaining its FRESHNESS and a mouth watering SOAPY vibe.

Mood lifting, in fact I get a calming and peaceful effect.

The performance maybe is not the best, however this one is a Masterpiece to be wore during the high heat weather for any casual activity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this!!, light, clean, fresh. Bright and happy. My favorite from the Blu Mediterraneo line. True it doesn’t last long. I like layering Haze Black by ATH, or Moscow Mule by Juliette has a gun. Spray one of those as a base, let it dry a minute the cover with the Bergamotto, really helps it pop and linger. This is my “don’t have to think about it” summer day easy grab by itself. Spray away dear friend.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: My signature fragrance. Clean, fresh and airy, with a soapy elegant drydown. I usually layer it with Escentric Molecule 1 and it turns into pure bliss which lasts almost 6-7 hours. People keep asking me what a nice fragrance I am wearing. Absolutely safe / suitable for the office.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Really nice scent. Fresh, a tiny bit spicy from the ginger but not overpowering and a nice roundness at the bottom. Like others have said... It lacks a bit in performance. It's really intimate and you can really only smell it up close and its longevity is short. But I feel like the scent itself makes up for this.
Overall.. Great scent :)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Such a good, fresh, simple scent. I love wearing this while running errands, and I look forward to using this a bit more during the warmer months. The longevity is very lacking, although I have read other reviewers say it lasts longer on clothes. I only purchased a travel size rollerball, so I have yet to try out a full bottle with an atomizer at a store. But the scent is so good it's making me consider purchasing a full bottle of this. Just lovely.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lemon Lime flavored Vodka , Fun invigorating scent just maybe not for a cologne to wear all day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sour citrus at the top, skin scent after 15mins, nothing left after 30mins. Disappointing for a fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’ve been looking for more scents featuring citron and ginger, so I was very hopeful that I’d love this one. It’s enjoyable but nothing I’d reach for a second time. The top notes are strong - citrus and marine. It’s a clean smell and reminds me of some aftershave my father used in the 80s. I am not getting any ginger at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Regarding the issue of poor longevity I have noticed that if you spray on your clothes it actually lasts a long time, and with decent sillage (I think, I don't really understand how you're supposed to know that yourself, and with a lack of friends to ask I just have to guess). You have to spray around 5 times though, and have an undamaged sense of smell to get to enjoy this lovely smell for a long while.

I have read quite a lot of reviews of perfumes I own myself where people complain that it's gone in an hour when my experience is quite different, which makes me wonder; could it be that some people are so used to strong and in-your-face synthetic scents (like for example Invictus, the smell of that literally makes me sick) that their noses get damaged to the point where they simply can't smell softer and - in my view - lovelier scents like this one. Maybe if you try to avoid harsh scents for a month or so you can get more enjoyment from exquisite and discreet edT's like Bergamotto.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oddly enough, I'm picking up more flowers and wood than citrus with this-specifically violet and iris- I am also getting surprisingly decent longevity from this fragrance-- and it is working nicely as a winter scent, too, which is another surprise-

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very summery zesty citrus smell, really brings you to the coasts of Italy. On my skin I get average longevity which to be expected from a light summery fragrance made of natural ingredients. Do not get discouraged and try it how long it can last on your skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I can classify this perfume as refresher, peaceful & cozy for daily use ( day & night ), I think it will be good for those are doing meditation, yoga, praying, GYM sports … definitely when wear it, you will linked to nature, anyone interested, I will be glad to help

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent smells like Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri but with more layers. Same with arancia I smell a really strong lemon note. The differnce is that with this one I smell lemon and bergamott rather then just lemon. This scent is best described as a aromatic citrus that smells very strongly of lemon, bergamott and ginger. There are no gourmand scents or any kind of sweetness to it. Slightly woody from the cedar and vetiver though.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is such a nice and pleasant fragrance for warmer days. It is light, and has strong notes of bergamot and citrus, with some notes of ginger and hints of cedar and vetiver. It is quite fresh and slightly spicy. It's perfect for anyone who wants to freshen up!

The performance sucks a bit, however. It lasts for about 3 hours and the sillage is somewhere in between intimate and moderate for the first hour, then it becomes very intimate. This makes the perfume a little bit overpriced imo but if you don't care that much about the value, the scent is worth it.

7/10. I absolutely love the smell, it is a sweet citrus fragrance. However, the performance is okay at best.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A true smell of summer. It’s a light, refreshing, citrus hit but don’t get used to it because it’ll have disappeared before you’ve even left the house. The projection and longevity of it is really bad considering how pricey it is. It would be the ultimate daytime summer fragrance if it could perform. I love the smell of it and it smells as though it would be a delicious zesty beverage but it’s a skin scent at best and very unisex. I’d avoid buying it unless you have too much money.

Scent: 9/10
Projection: 3/10
Longevity: 1.5/10
Versatility: 2/10
Price: 2.5/10

Overall: 3.6/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The scent is close to Dior Homme Cologne and Chanel Allure Homme Sport Cologne imo. ADP being on the softer but fresher side, and Chanel on the stronger, but sharper side.

Beautiful. Refreshing. A scorching hot weather must have cologne!! Very unisex too if I may add.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s like bathing yourself in the freshest lime juice. Amazing!! Super hyperrealistic

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This Aqua Di Parma is a very natural great smelling summer fragrance. However, it has the worst performance I have seen in a fragrance. I spray it on my skin and it lasts 10min and it's gone. A real shame as it is very nice and natural smelling but its performance is shocking. Great for summer/ vacation and also gym wear. Very nice smell but shit performance. However still one of the best bergamot fragrances I have smelt.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
this is the most sophisticated scent I have ever worn. I don't know, it kinda smells like a muju store and reminds me of all that minimalistic stuff they sell there. but of good quality and useful.
it does not remind me of bergamot, but of citrus scents in general. like a bit Sicilian lemon- watered lemonade and then ginger, spices, maybe a hint of cypress far far away...but citrusy, above all.
very light, discrete, but above all, fresh and clean. it is the kind of scent I wear after a bath, on a hot day, to feel clean.
it is unissex and definitely not the type of fruity - sensuous type of fragrance that we smell everywhere these days.

it is the one to the crowd who loves to feel fresh through the day. I carry it in my purse, basically my to go fragrance.
(I would say that if you like thé blanc- bvlgari, light blue D&G, kenzo air... this is their sophisticated sibling.)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bergamotto di Calabria is probably the best bergamot fragrance I have ever smelled. The scent so natural and fresh. Like most people have pointed out though there is no longevity in this fragrance whatsoever. I can put on 10 sprays and it's gone within 1 hour, which is so sad. I mostly wear this fragrance at home because the smell makes me happy. The poor performance makes it hard to find a proper usage for this fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: this is a staple in my collection! i love to layer this with anything. the bergamot blends so well with any other bergamot scent, or any other notes really. this is incredibly zesty fresh. it performs terribly, so i would not purchase it at full price, but it is beautiful & i will continue to layer as long as i can find it <$100

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The fragrance is very refreshing, I wish it lasted more than 6 minutes in my skin. It does what it’s meant to do, which is to refresh you for a few minutes. A spray bottle with water in it can do the same. And this is why it is way overpriced. I had other colognes that lasted a lot longer than this.
An update two years later. I love the scent, citrusy, fresh, self explanatory. It doesn't claim to be something it isn't. Perhaps the longevity. It leaves a powdery skin scent after the top notes have gone. As I kept using it, it grew on me and it's one of my summer staples. Just looking at the bottle makes me happy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Alright let's talk about the elephant in the room first. As you can see from votes and reviews, the longevity on this sucks. But I bought a 5 oz bottle anyway because I think it's the best bergamot frags along with le labo bergamote 22, which is expensive and also doesn't last. I own and have smelled lots of citrus fragrances, and this is one of the best and most natural I've ever smelled.

The only way this makes sense is if you get a BIG bottle and you get it for cheap. I paid 50$ for 5 ounces. You will need an atomizer to carry in your pocket or purse.

I think of this like an Italian Sports car.
It's not practical, it's got no room for groceries, it gets terrible gas mileage, and it breaks all the time.
However, it's beautiful, people love it, and when it's not broken, it's a blast to drive!

Smell 10/10. Bergamot Perfected.
Performance 1/10. I literally spray this on my face (facial hair and cheeks) so I can enjoy it longer

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely love the opening on this and I hate to write a negative review but the longevity is atrocious. It smells amazing for 1 minute then it's nearly gone. If you don't mind applying 20 sprays to start then another 10 every hour this is for you. I'm glad I got a great price on a 150ml tester but even then it's not worth it IMO. Such a shame...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very very weak, to the point of it becoming a waste of money.

The smell itself is, as mentioned here, nice - a fresh lemonade. But it dissapears as one too, in 15 minutes it's gone. Peeling a lemon and not washing your hands would be more effective as a fragrance.

#sad #40€downthedrain #why #stopblindbuyingthingsdenisa

Update: I was too harsh judging this. It's a great room and toilet freshener. Or when you feel like changing perfume 5 times a day, this does the job for an hour perfectly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love the cirtucy smell but its too weak.I barely could smell it after i smelled other fragrances of the blu line.I think its the weakest.Too expensive for what it is.I would buy it only for me to smell it for no reason when i am at home :P.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: My absolute favorite ADP. This one is all about the beautiful lemony, musky, powdery, soapy dry down that is so warm and clean. Although I wouldn't describe it as gourmand it does very much remind me of a creamy lemon sherbet. It’s the kind of smell that just feels soft and comfortable. Everyone complains about longevity but I find a few extra sprays gets the job done nicely. But yes, it's certainly not the best performance and I do wish it was stronger.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I live in Atlanta, and this is perfect for the VERY humid and sticky summer here. It does EXACTLY what I want, and while many others criticize it, what they find to be vices, I consider to be virtues.

I have moved almost exclusively to niche fragrances, and to my nose, this doesn't smell like ANY of the designer fragrances out there. It has the best, most NATURAL citrus scent I have EVER smelled (and I am 60 yrs old). Here in Atlanta in the summertime, the morning may start out cool to warm, but by afternoon the weather has changed to humid and hot. When the air itself feels like an extra layer of clothing, I want zero scent, it's just not needed. So with this, I spray on my neck and back of my head, then when I get dressed I spray more on my shirt (upper chest, shoulders), and yes it does move to a skin scent within a few hours, which is what I wanted as the day gets warmer, and what remains on my shirt hangs around and informs the rest of the day. So while others don't like the way it performs, I love it. The smell is very fresh and light, perfect for humid days.

If you're hesitant, get a sample, but honestly, this is a really great citrus scent for morning, office or casual environments.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like this but wish it had more backbone for better performance. It smells great and it will make you smile with that lemony lime pop! But..then it's gone, good thing I've got the 5oz bottle on a discount. I will be using this as a morning pick me up before I throw on my day scent this summer.

Bottle 8
Quality 7
Performance 4
Scent 8
Overall 7.25

Good to add to the collection but not a necessity

UPDATE: I used this after spraying Dior Homne Sport 2017 and it made the citrus opening last a few more hours! But, didn't help the overall longevity. I am considering using this also for layering with my summer citrus freshies!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An easy breezy citrusy juice that would smell divine on a gentleman yet is perfectly admirable on my feminine skin.
The complete drydown offers up a muskiness I quite like.
Close to the skin but lasts on me!
Smells sooo good!
I absolutely am enamored with the beautiful blue bottle.
✨

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely stunning scent. So fresh and natural smelling. Smells exactly like a lemon lime sorbet to me. It is a light fragrance but not so light it’s not worth purchasing. I managed to acquire the 150ml bottle for a great price and so don’t feel bad spraying heavy.

Also, got compliments from this a couple of hours after applying - so it has some longevity and projection.

Probably the easiest to love from the line - even though I am a fan of the blu mediterraneo line in general.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very bright and citrus heavy scent. Feels high quality. Perfect for summer and warmer weather.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was surprised how natural it smells. Opens with fizzy Citron and transforms quite quickly in Vetiver - Bergamot - Musk scent. Very true and beautiful. Sillage medium to weak. More a fragrance to self.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super natural lemon and bergamot smell without any of that synthetic background noise. Quite alcoholic and sharp in the first 10 seconds, but very pleasant overall. It's a real shame that while they use real bergamot in this, it does not project at all and is gone in i kid you not, 15 minutes. As someone who never has longevity issues it was honestly surprising given that ADP usually last 3 hours minimum on my skin. What a shame, I might need to overspray.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of my favorite fragrances of all time. I love citrusy fresh fragrances. The opening is bright, juicy, zesty. I don't feel it smells like lemon cleaning products at all. For me this is one of the longest lasting citrus fragrance I have ever tried (which is saying something because I have tried many, and citrus fragrances typically have poor staying power). I could get a probably 8 hours out of this one which was amazing. Unisex but does not smell "masculine" for you gals out there who haven't tried this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
-Opens with a dishwashing detergent citrusy scent.
-Lasting power is fleeting, as with all others in the Blu Mediterrano line.
-Not fbw. (-)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's a nice powdery style fragrance. Uplifting and joyful , opens with the radiant freshness of Citron and Italian bergamot , combined with the vibrant notes of ginger , cedarwood , the preciousness of vetiver , musk and benzoin. This perfume reminds me of Artisan Pure by John Varvatos. It is perfect for the spring and summer. I like Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria EDT.

Rating : 7 / 10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like it enough to finish the whole bottle but no matter how many spray or how close to my neck I apply it, I can barely smell anything after 2-3 hours. It is a refreshing but fleeting fragrance.

the opening as expected is citrusy bergamot with notes of woodiness and slightly herbaceous. If you like Aesop Tacit, you might like this for some days when you want something more breezy and easygoing. Wears well in hot climate, doesn't turn acidic on my skin. It's a no-brainer inoffensive fragrance, so I usually pack this for my business trips.

Personally I find it rather overpriced for its' performance. It lacks character and uniqueness. It's pleasant enough for one bottle commitment but honestly after finishing, I won't replace it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of my favorite smelling citruses ever. It's seriously amazing. However, it's one of the weakest fragrances I've ever tried. If you buy this, you have to understand that this is a true eau de cologne, meant only to be fleeting and subtle. It might leave a light, pleasant scent on your collar. It is not meant to be loud or to project or to leave a trail at the office. This one is for your enjoyment only.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this fragrance but it's so weak! When you first spray it onto the skin, it's a sparkling, uplifting citrus, like a cold lemonade on a hot summer day. It's brigh and sunny to the point where you want to bathe in the thing. :) It dries down quickly to something I can't put my finger on (maybe the cedar?). And then it just disappears. It's almost gone in less than an hour. So sad, I really want to buy this full size but can't justify the price as I will most probably finish a whole bottle in a week.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very boring and short lasting citrus fragrance and sorry this fragrance does not smell like bergamot. I can find far better options than this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: On my skin after about an hour or so, this literally smells like paper money 🤔 does anyone else get this impression while wearing it? With that said, I am enjoying my splash sample. Very citrusy, a little woody, and completely pleasant and easy to wear. I need to test it a little more to see if this is a love.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I remember testing this fragrance at Bloomingdales where the salesman took me on a tour of Italy by way of the Blu Mediterraneo line. This one is nice, but the real standout to me was Chinotto di Ligurio. I don't have a ton to say about this--it's soft and gentle, a bit like freshly washed clothes in lemon detergent. I applied at 8:00 am or so and now at 10:00 am it's little more than a wisp and I'm straining to pick up the notes. Seems like a good inoffensive fragrance for setting a sunny mood for some weekend household chores, but not enough of a knockout to convince me to buy a whole bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Squeezed bergamot

This is not just the oil from inside of a bergamot. It's the whole fruit plus it's leaves and even the tree itself. The sourness and bitterness from the green leaves and bergamot is obvious.
After an hour flowers, musk and cedar goes hand in hand to fill the place of bergamot and citron and make the perfume a bit sweet and deep.
Unfortunately (for me) it has a soapy cleanness which I think was not necessary and because of this feature I think there is an unnecessary pumped up sweetness to this fragrance which could be more toned down and it could lead to a more natural scented fragrance.

It's suitable for every and each occasion in summer and spring. It doesnt last long but it is enough and the sillage is normal and acceptable for such a fragrance.

scent: 8
longevity:7
sillage: 6
value for the price: 7

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Light, soft, etheral, floral Bergamot. Very, very nice. Not long lasting. First time I wore it, it was ok, not amazing. By my fourth wear...it's beautiful. Considering a full bottle now. Scent: 8.5, longevity: 7, Overall: 8.5

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It’s true. This isn’t a long lasting fragrance at all.
What’s it good for? A hot, dry day. You were this on those hot days when every other fragrance you have should be considered too strong.
It’s so refreshing and bright and glad to have this in my rotation for the overwhelmingly hot days. Bravo!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love this fragrance, Sandalo is the only fragrance I prefer over this from AdP.

However. Awful performance, a total waste of money. Dont buy if you actually want to wear and enjoy wearing, as yourself and others will not smell anything after 10mins.

I do love spraying my bottle from time to time, just to enjoy it for myself, but unfortunately that is all its good for.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance smells fantastic! The best-smelling bergamot fragrance I have come across. However, the longevity is DISMAL. This fragrance does not even last for one hour. I could just about justify the price when I first bought it 1 1/2 years ago. At that time, it cost $105. Since then, in less than 2 years time, the price has gone up by $15 to $120. No way is this fragrance worth $120 when it doesn't even last 1 hour. $105 was pushing it, but $120 is a ridiculous price for such a poor-performing fragrance. When I finish my bottle, I will not be repurchasing even though I adore the scent. The longevity just does not justify the price of $120.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received 5 Blu Med. bottles as gift and I swear they all smell like soap.
Very nice soap, very nice smell but so... safe?
This one is all Lemon, a nice sweet one, almost candied.
And then: the vague Blu Med. nice soap base.
Oh well...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Zero Performance

This is not a perfume, it lasts 15 minutes. Terrible release from Acqua Di parma.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely adore the smell of this fragrance for those hot summer months. A nice zing from the bergamot and citron with the ginger and woody notes peeking through. This is favorite type of citrus fragrance. However, like everyone else has stated, the last power is pretty abysmal. It lasts about an hour on me and that is with multiple sprays (six or seven). I was willing to pay $105 for the 50ml bottle but even that was a stretch since the fragrance is so short-lived. Well, the fragrance has apparently gone up $15 since I bought it two summers ago. No way in heck am I paying $120 for a fragrance that lasts one hour, no matter how awesome it smells. ADP needs to get their heads out of their rears. Yes, the fragrance smells superb but hardly anyone will buy it for that price considering the poor performance. They should either adjust prices accordingly or figure out how to make the fragrance last longer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Perfectly pleasant scent, however for me it smells like citrus candy and old ladies.

The Bergamot is front and center and does smell delicious, but reminds me a bit too much of candy. And then there are some notes in the background that for some reason immediately remind me of my dear old aunt - may her soul rest in peace.

Nothing wrong with any of this of course, but for me as a 39 year old man I really don't have any interest in wearing it and smelling like this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I keep searching for a great bergamot scent but this one won't be it.

I absolutely love bergamot and when I first smelled this I thought I had a winner. Kept smelling myself on my way out of the store... a few minutes later and it started to vanish. After 30 minutes it was gone.

The opening was so good that I decided to give it a second try. This time it was warmer outside. I got only slightly better performance - again less than an hour!

It's a shame but I can only see this working on really warm weather. At its pricetag it's definitely a pass.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Took this perfume with me on my holiday to the south of France as my only scent for 2 weeks.
Absolutely the most beautiful bergamot fragrance I've ever smelled. Such a shame that it doesn't last at all!

It does have some projection the first 15-30 minutes but after that, it gets really close to the skin.
You will have to overspray this before anyone else with notice you got anything on. Sprayed 10 times one day before a road trip and it didn't clog up the whole cabin. Actually had my family in the car and for any other fragrance they would have kicked me out for having to much on, but this time they didn't even say anything about it. And that should tell you more about the poor performance than the smell.

Won't be buying a new bottle after my 30ml runs out... and it will soon, as I need to use so goddamn many sprays every time, just for it to perform a little.

EDIT: Finished the bottle as we had some warm days here in the late spring. I can not stress enough how good I think the smell is. It also performs a little better when it's not super hot outside... But it still sits very close to the skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nice bergamot, realistic. As for the smell, this one is very unisex, round. Unfortunately I confirm it has poor performance, unacceptable for the price it retails. (a simple summer days eau de cologne shouldn't cost more than $50 for 100ml at online discounters)

For these reasons, I cannot recommend this one, and for a more masculine take on bergamot and a big step-up in terms of quality and performance, I would suggest to go for Zegna Italian Bergamot (the new EDP, not the discontinued EDT). Obviously, it's also a step up in terms of pricing, but with a bit of patience, it will show up in 1-2 years at discounters.

If you don't have patience, I would suggest to go for Zegna Acqua di Bergamotto or Guerlain AA Bergamote Calabria instead, which both do the same job (with similar poor performance) and both currently retails around $30-40 for a large bottle online.

For a more feminine take on Bergamot, I cannot recommend enough Atelier Cologne Bergamote Soleil.

In summary, AdP Bergamotto di Calabria: good, but overpriced compared to the competition given what it delivers. A pass for me.

Summer days, 20+

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opening with the most amazing bergamot note you will ever experience in your whole life, just to disappear 5 minutes later.

Huge longevity issues here and projection close to zero. No one is gonna notice you wear any scent - not even yourself.

Thanks Acqua di Parma but this feels like a joke.

Follow my scent journey on instagram
instagram.com/scentsexual
