*This review was written after several full wearings of the perfume and not just after smelling this on paper or on wrist.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is such a realistic Bergamot it's quite incredible. 100% for the hot weather when fragrances are amplified by the heat. The longevity issues are REAL with this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Treat this like an eau de cologne and you may not be as disappointed as you otherwise would have been. It is bright, happy and juicy. Quality is there but you have to weigh the pros and cons.

Pro: As a lover of bergamot it hits the spot. It's the only citrus scent I crave more of and want to repurchase a bottle of, nothing else delivers on the promise of fresh, happy, bright citrus like this.

Con: The bottle goes very fast as a result of poor projection and longevity. I used up a full 75 ml bottle in under a year, which is unheard of seeing as most of its play was seen during summer. It needs to be sprayed at least 6 times per use to be worth while. Reapplication is necessary throughout the day.

Pro: Quality ingredients and natural scent, it is such a pleasure to wear. It's not piercing or synthetic like other citruses can be. It's light enough and perfect for high heat. Love the bottles too.

I adore this fragrance. I wish it stuck around longer, but I trust Acqua Di Parma know what they're doing. Compared to other brands who push edc's for roughly the same price, Acqua Di Parma is winning in my books. They're a classy brand who don't rely on bells and whistles to sell their products, they just make good perfume on the basis of quality and simplicity. I'm a big fan.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not usually a fan of citrus-based scents but I absolutely love this fragrance. Heartbreaking that it doesn't last long at all. What a damn shame cause this is a happy day in a bottle!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a citrus bomb on my skin with a hint of ginger but no other notes. It lasts in cold weather (50 degrees) at least 6 hours on my extremely dry skin and has a nice scent trail for several hours. I live in the Arizona desert so it is hot most of the year here. I’m unsure how this fragrance does above 90 degrees but I bought it in November when we were still in 90s and it lasted about 4 hours as strong skin scent. I love it! I plan to buy the lotion and shower gel to increase time it lasts. Not sure why other reviewers had bad luck with it.

This is unisex and a safe blind buy. I receive compliments and zero complaints on scent. FragranceNet.com sells samples which is how I tested it first before buying it on sale.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria is a citrus aromatic. It projects with a stingy zesty citrus accord, between bergamot and citron. It's awakening, invigorating, and has a touch of candy-like sweetness to it. Not sure what the concentration here is, but the aroma dies down hard after the opening, and shortly after is very hard to pick up (unless presumably you have a virgin nose).

I think this one had so much more potential for greatness, but possibly Acqua di Parma is playing hard ball here, and doesn't wish to cater to the underlying problems of people. Instead, they might be taking a page out of Ralph Lauren's book, and are seeking to force people into finding a more effective solution for their problems (in the sense of some olfactory rejuvenation therapy). Although the formula here is a bit simple and linear, the fragrance is so good that it would probably be well worth the effort. That's just the classic style of Italian cologne.

You could always bathe in it I guess, but not sure how popular that's going to make you with all those sensitive noses out there amongst the crowd. I really enjoy this one for its style and flare, and would suggest just wearing it on the skin, so that you can freshen up regularly without it becoming overbearing to anyone.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus fizzle. Looks like it's unanimous then - I smelled this without reading any of the reviews here and had exactly the same experience. Soaringly gorgeous, bright, zingy, tingly, sunny, fresh-air bergamot, exactly that delicious tang that makes good Earl Grey tea so refreshing. Just beautiful. Puts a smile on your face and makes you think of clear blue skies. Perfectly unisex, utterly charming. And this after I've had a string of failures with other AdPs which looked great on paper but turned too cheap / butch / aftershave-y to work on my female skin.

Drawback: lasts for an hour, at most. Aaaargh! Che fiasco! In a perfect universe maybe I'd buy a one-litre bucket of this and spritz myself with it hourly. In this one, AdP have scored an own goal making Bergamotto di Calabria, because it's persuaded me I really need a bergamot perfume for summer 2019 and I want to explore the note further, but I know for sure I won't be paying out for AdP's take on it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes it smells good, Its a go if you like bright crispy scents..

Here is how it smells to me, Its like a an expensive lemon/ lime & citrus house hold cleaner.

The bad, the performance is just bad, doesn't last. Maybe a 30 minute blast of citrus, ginger and cedar, then nothing at all on the skin. You'll have to spray every hour .

From a Mans' perspective, ADP Ginepro, Cedro and Cipresso are the very best, classics at that.

More feminine

Perris Monte Carlos' Bergamotto is way better. Try it

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An effervescent bergamot opening leads to a rather non descriptive middle and end. It’s all about the top notes with this one. Fleeting as they may be, for those few glorious moments they do shine brighter than the sun, and take you away on a temperate summer vacation.

Sillage and projection are non existent

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bitter orange and lemon, citrus, Froot Loops, fades quickly. No.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very good scent, ruined by a poor performance. A pity, indeed.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nice scent and high quality citrus notes, like other Blu Mediterraneo line fragrances but always I have a problem with this line: weak performance on my skin :(
I love this line very much.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Apparently I wasn't born with the right pH to allow me to enjoy hours upon days of longevity that other Fragranticans report. I unfortunately don't get 24 hours after a gym workout and two showers with only a single spray which my wife delivered from the next room. It's a shame because a fragrance budget of about $150 could last a lifetime.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Gorgeous, gorgeous bergamot, lime, and lemon scent. Some floral undertones, but little in the way of base notes to lend it longevity. Even used in layering, it only lasts an hour or two, at most. Sillage and longevity are both quite poor, but it smells BRILLIANT when still on the skin. "Good-to-very good," 85/100.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very high quality lemon citrus scent, perfect for summer. But as others have said, very poor longevity. So poor in fact, that I cannot detect this after just 20 mins. Such a shame as the scent is so good.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have to agree with Thee Maestro and say I don't have any problem with the longevity either. 2 or 3 sprays and I can smell this all day. It's a great bergamot scent, the type I'd been seeking for a while, from a lovely line of fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh, pleasant, very short lived.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Crisp citrus scent that is so true to it's name. I thoroughly enjoyed it and I enjoyed it for a long time.
I don't get performance issues at all, it lasted a full work day. Sillage was effortless for this gem, projection was not bad either, I'm really confused by some reviews, it's like we're not reviewing the same scent at all.

Lovely summer scent, I recommend it, but having read the reviews here, I'd say beware the danger of counterfeit fragrances, especially with these niche fragrances!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: The most beautiful uplifting citrus scent I've ever smelled. Very pure and high quality bergamont and Italian lemon. The only drawback is the performance which is not the best in the world. I get 3-5 hrs of solid longevity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's a nice fragrance, but on my skin it's too acid and doesn't smell as good as it sprayed in the air.
Very poor longevity. There are better fragrances in Blu Mediterraneo in my opinion.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful fresh citrus opening which turns into Yardley's lemon verbena soap after five minutes (not a bad thing) and then lightens up a little and is joined by vetiver. As with a few of the other AdPs I'm finding I really enjoy the top notes but am left a little dissatisfied by what comes next. This is a beautiful fragrance, no doubt about it - if you're after the definitive soapy lemon fragrance, this could be your dream come true.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus opening, drying down to a sweet, woody set of middle notes. If there was vetiver in the mix then It was subtle to the point of being subliminal. That said, for something that's quite simple, this fragrance actually seemed to have a lot of character, for a couple of hours or so.

If I drew up a list of things I like about Bergamotto, it'd be a decently long list. But projection and value for money wouldn't feature. This stuff is expensive, and, for the price ADP are asking, it should last a lot longer and have far better sillage.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Whilst I agree that the initial zesty citrus fades in 20-30mins, what it leaves stays for a reasonable few hours. It is subtle though; but in a pleasing way that suggests it's gone deeper into the skin... like how chlorine does after a swim in a public pool, but with no similarities in fragrance!

It's sweet and floral, but believable. Some fragrances are strong enough to suggest they are masking something - this is not one of those.

Plus, I'm allergic to a lot of AdP fragrances, so far not this one!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Totally agree with Happyme2009 below. Smells great, then evaporates in less than 10 minutes. Looking into if I can return it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One of the biggest wastes of money thrown away in my entire life as a parfume collector.
I wanted this for the longest time . It's pricey and honestly, a mockery of a perfume.
Water with a few drops of bergamotte oil . Divine, zingy, sublime, for all the 30 seconds it lasts . After that it changes into a skin scent that lasts a little more, and then it vanishes without a trace . Even on clothes is gone in no time.
Absurd, and I was so expensive. I am really pissed off for wasting my birthday money on this . If I was the perfumerer who creates this , I'd be embarrassed . Seriously, not even worth $20, as for what I paid for it is simply obscene . $156 Ripoff. I am never buying another Blue Mediterraneo Edt, Never.
That being said, the smell, when you can actually smell it, it's the most natural lime and bergamotte you could dream of. I have a bottle of essential bergamotte oil next to me, they are very similar. Except that the oil was one tenth of the price of the perfume. So I guess I'll need to mix this edt with some essential oil and hope it becomes strong .... what a pity. It could have been the perfect summer fragrance . And keep in mind that I usually prefer not so strong fragrances.
My recommendation ? Don't buy . I did and I regret it. Swap anyone ? 150 ml bottle, with box, booklet, everything .

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Verry lemony..like you would pour some of those lemon cake extracts on your skin..not for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had a sample given to me at Holt Renfrew. I was very excited for this scent. I was like "maybe I'll find a nice summer scent". I'll be honest I did, for about 10 minutes. Then poof! Gone. Has a sprite smell kind of vibe. Or rather it smells like what it tastes like. Not sure if I applied it wrong, but it was just after my shower. I'll give it another go soon. But for now, not worthy of a purchase.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamot üzerine konumlanmış bir parfümün Türkiye de işi zor. Bizler limon kolonyası ile büyümüş bir nesiliz. Yani limon ve bergamot kokusunu aslında zihnen tüketmiş durumdayız. Tabiki halen keyif alıyorum ama ilk başta zihnime hücum eden o küçüklüğün kolonya hissi, ballandıra ballandıra anlatılan parfümleri bir anda 3. Lige gönderiyor. ADP nin bergamotu da aynı kaderi paylaşıyor malesef. İlk dakikalar zaten tam bir limon kolonyası bir y dakika sonra biraz ama biraz odunsu hava oluşuyor ve kolunuza sıkıp burnunuzu dayadıysanız bunu alabiliyorsunuz. Yoksa o da mümkün değil. Kalıcılık ve koku dağılımı oldukça zayıf. Keyifli mi ? Evet, eğer bergamot istiyorsanız keyifli. Zaten bergamot için sadece ADP ve Zegna alıyorum. Zegna biraz daha taze duruyor ve biraz daha kalıcılık konusunda iyi. Ancak her ikisi de sadece kendiniz için keyifli. Etrafınız muhtemelen yeni limon kolonyası kullandığınızı sanacaktır.
ADP keyifli bir iş çıkarmış ama dediğim gibi bu coğrafyada büyüyen birisi için bu bir parfüm değil. Sadece kaliteli bir kolonya havasında.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm glad I didn't get the full size bottle. I put this on... a lot of it and barely could smell anything. I don't even know what it really smells like. They must know their fragrances are weak (this one esp.) I guess as long as we buy it they don't feel the need to address the issue. The lotion lasts MUCH longer so I wear that now and to heck with the EDT.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a sample and I am HOOKED.

a casual, easy-to-wear, classy 09:00AM summer time fragrance.

I promise you, this will put a smile on your face.

**UPDATE: I actually bought this at a great price! This is just heavenly!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fantastic smell. Fresh, tangy and sweet at the same time, it gives you a pleasant feeling of cleanliness and soapy freshness. I just love it!!!

P.S. I have read comments complaining about poor sillage and/or projection. This type of smell - as all the Βlu Μediterraneo series- is meant to be delicate and discreet in a classy way. In no way is this a powerhouse nor was it meant to be. This is European elegance. So , for those looking for class and european "chic" this is it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely fantastic throughout. The citrus top is so fresh and true. Pricey but well worth it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Love it! Great Fragrance for either summer or winter. Love the bergamot and lemon start with the soft Drydown, which is the best part. I keep smelling my wrist while wearing this one.

It also smells very natural.

Only wish the base would be stronger.

besides that the price is alright for 150ml.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's a nice and fresh citrus scent.
Easy to wear, most suitable for summer. Totally unisex in my opinion. Not very feminine, but not masculine either.
Basic lemony scent, a little too basic for that kind of price.
Quite fine, but for that price I would be able to find at least two bottles of good perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If only this (and many others from this house) worked on my skin, I'd be a very happy man.
I get very little from this beautiful fragrance. Very little at all. Spray, sniff - gone!

It's a recurring annoyance for me with the house of Acqua di Parma. Classy and wonderful as most of them that I've tried are, I am always left feeling somewhat disappointed.
I love the smells but the strength is wasted on me.

I have tried all the Blu Mediterraneo collection and (most of the) Colonia collection too and none of them last more than an hour on my skin giving me practically no projection / sillage. I mean, like nothing.

Sure, I get the amazing smells and adorable flavours they permit but they are nothing more than a skin scent on me. Maybe it's my DNA, although I have seen other similar comments.

It's for those reasons that I find them far too expensive and over-priced for what they offer you as a buyer. I've spent a small fortune buying some of these fragrances but sadly, I simply can't afford to justify making the same mistake again.

Yes, I know many people will strongly disagree with me and mention that we shouldn't expect all fragrances to be powerhouses, sending passers-by into an olfactory frenzy; but I definitely want something more to show for my money than what Acqua di Parma have offered me to date.
Damn!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Tried this with my mother when we went out on my birthday. She liked it and said "It smells lemony." "That's the bergamot and lemons then" I replied. It's nice but doesn't seem to warrant the huge price tag for just a fresh citrus with a fairly generic and fast dry down. I am often disappointed with high end stuff. We ended up buying Next Eau Nude, which is quite sophisticated and Next Paradise, which my husband loves and is only £4 for 10ml.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria is a beautiful fragrance, simple, elegant and just lovely. I find it quite intoxicating.

Yes the performance is certainly not the best, but this is one of those rare moments for me when the overall effect of the fragrance makes up for it's performance woes IMO.

It does remind me slightly of Sel de Vetiver but only briefly. It also reminds me of Dior Homme Cologne to some extent, but it is better to my nose than the Dior. It reminds me of many fragrances in part, however none capture the magic that this possesses for me.

This is what I might have imagined Grace Kelly to waft of in "To Catch a Thief", though I realize the movie was in Nice.

I realize there are a million versions of this type of fragrance, but this for me is very, very special. It is the best of summer in a bottle.

8.5 overall while taking it's lacking performance into account.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells great. but out of all the acdp blue line. This is by far the weakest. Gone after 1 hour. Too bad.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bergamotto di Calabria has a pleasant citrusy opening that rapidly adds a spicy soapy component. The dry down, which develops quickly, is all about the ginger, bolstered by hints of cedar, musk, and benzoin. If you like ginger this fragrance might be for you, but be advised you're going to have to reapply it a lot: the longevity is very short. Very. I wanted to like BdC--I generally like all the notes that go into its formulation--but, at least on my skin, it really doesn't work. It seems thin, linear, uninteresting, and weak.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Such a nice juicy, bright opening. The bright opening of citrus tones stays for a good 20-30 minutes before the vetiver peeps through just barely.

Sitting on the beach, with a fruity drink in super hot weather is the picture this gives me. This definitely leans towards the masculine side.

The staying power is horrendous, which i am assuming is due to the bright opening which never really goes away. I'm not sure how anyone can justify paying the price of this fragrance for such lame longevity.

I will say if it lasted longer and has better performance, I would have to give in and buy it.

Scent: 7.5/10 (Nothing new, just smells really good)
Longevity: 3/10
Sillage: 3/10

Overall: Disappointing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria is my first fragrance from the AdP Blu Mediterraneo line. This is a very fresh and enjoyable citrus fragrance, but for my money, Tom Ford's Italian Cypress is a far better "mediterranean" fragrance. I'm sure I'll try a few other AdP fragrances from this line. Suggestions are welcome.

Update: I've tried this several times now and although the opening is quite nice, I'm down to barely a skin scent in 2 hours. I'm sure it's me but I'm not going to upgrade to a full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria is the best begamot fragrance I have ever had..
it opens with citrus(bergamot and citron) then it turns to with ginger, cedar and vetyver..
I have smelled bergamot and citron and vetyver in this magnificent product the most. benzoin and musk Notes are very weak..
This fragrance has too short of a staying power.
but I really enjoy this scent ..

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria is a very pleasant citron scent with some bergamot and lime which sits next to the skin. As the lemony notes mostly fade away after an hour or two, it becomes a very gentle woody musk. It's very delicate but it does last quite a long time, around 6 or 7 hours before it starts to vanish properly off the skin.

Bergamotto di Calabria is the nicest of the Blu Med range by far. It's flexible in that it works day or night and any time of year and for any occasion. I like the bottle and the packaging too. However, I do think it is overpriced. The Blu Med range feels more like a marketing gimmick by AdP to get the cash registers ringing. The revivification of the company in the last twenty years has led to lots of new lines but very little of genuine top class merit for the money. BdC is a genuine unisex perfume and you could use it straight out the shower, getting back from work, going to bed, just about anything you want that relies on subtlety and discretion. If you want to make an impression or just smell your perfume after an hour, then it's not the one.

I like it but I wish it was stronger and lasted longer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Green lime in a bottle .. That how I can describe it .

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very fresh and clean scent! The lemon/citrusy notes are definitely noticeable. Unfortunately, this fragrance fades way too quickly and only lasts less than 10 minutes on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very clean, very fresh, very ticklish on my nose. This scent is almost perfectly balanced on me. Perhaps it is a touch too ozonic, actually, but the lotion form of this scent rounds that out amazingly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria is a straightforward lemon and bergamot fragrance on me. The citrus is aromatic and gently sweetened. The presence of cedar renders the scent a powdery woody texture, while the ginger brings a subtle cool, crystalline feeling to the citrus.

The sillage is soft and the longevity is around 6 hours. Although I'm more drawn towards the tart, juicy, sparkling interpretation of lemon, I did enjoy the cool citrus breeze of Bergamotto di Calabria immensely. It would definitely make a refreshing experience on a sultry summer day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I believe it's unisex, so decided to try.
Very fresh, clean citrus with a dry understated woody finish. Didn't get any of the described spices, just the citrus and woody notes.
I wouldn't buy it for myself but would quite enjoy it on my man. Seems like a nice all-year round scent, mostly for daytime wear, but one would get away wearing it as a day-to-night fragrance too (might however need a top-up spritz towards the end of day).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Amazing..!! The Acqua di Parma line is incredible and a “best kept secret” for fragrance perfumers…

I was reminded this morning of the clean and fresh feeling of wearing Acqua di Parma’s, Bergamotto di Calabria. This juice is good..!! Out of the bottle, you get the initial blast of bergamot notes followed by the dry-down into an extraordinary blend of citrus, ginger, green, and a whisper of vetiver notes. Somehow, I have managed to accumulate nine (9) of the Acqua Di Parma fragrances – each unique and amazing in their own identity, but all share a common citrus DNA. While Bergamotto di Calabria (BdC) is geared toward Spring and Summer wear, it does offer great flexibility during this timeframe – from casual outings to more formal events. I find that BdC lingers close to the body and unfortunately, last only about four (4) hours on me and clothing. But during that 4 hour window – whoa, this juice is good stuff.. Given the brevity and low sillage of the fragrance, I would suggest that BdC is “office safe” and will add that based on the note composition, BdC is totally unisex.

My final tally for Bergamotto di Calabria is 4.0 stars out of 5.0 stars. It is classy, refined, and will leave the wearer feeling clean and fresh. If this fragrance only had greater staying power, definitely a Top 5 fragrance. Based on my increased confidence level while wearing today, BdC comes with a solid recommendation to add to your collection and is a definite “love” in the fragrance community…

Enjoy your day and happy fragrance hunting…

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria embraces the semi-bitterness of the eponymous bergamot note, which stands out above all else and is mainly paired with a musk base.

I haven't tried many fragrances that rely solely on bergamot, not coupling it with another citrus or top note, but this is almost a refreshlingy bitter take on a citrus-heavy fragrance. Its opening only is slightly saltier and more acidic than its dry down. Longevity and projection are on par with most other ADP fragrances, good but not great.

Most reviews cite similarities to Dior Homme so I'd have to try that to compare, but as it stands, this is a pleasant warm weather day fragrance. Still debatable if it merits the Acqua di Parma price, cheaper designer options notwithstanding, but something that I imagine most men and some women could pull off in the summer especially. I probably wouldn't opt to buy this as I get a similar-enough experience from the cheap, grapefruit-based Elixir White by C.O. Bigelow, but some may find ADP BdC more compelling.

7 out of 10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Overwhelming lemons. All I got was lemon. Not a deep or complex scent.

Edited to say after two hours of dry down I can't smell anything at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely scent but try Dior homme cologne which is half the price...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: In my opinion it's the weakest of the Blue Mediterraneo scents. It has a mild citric tone, so never sharp, harsh and even less strong. The citric notes never stands out alone, being for the begining to end always mixed with a sweet tone, not candy like, maybe more like a mild flowery note (I can't identify it more acurately), just a bit sweet, to give a balance to the composition. As the others Acqua di Parma Blue Mediterraneo scents, everthing feels natural and in place.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I didn't love or hate it. It opened smelling exactly like orange flavored Pez candy and settled into a pleasant enough citrus zest smell. Not a particularly complex fragrance. You get all citrus all the time, at least on my skin to my nose. It may still be a little too cold in the Midwestern US for this, but it was warmish and sunny and I really wanted to try one of my AdiP samplers.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
VERY similar to Atelier's Grand Neroli, except this one has a slight bit more of a tangerine type of scent. It opens with a citrus blast, rapidly becomes a skin scent and then dies.

As much as I like the fragrance, I can't spend this kind of cash on something that has so little longevity. Grand Neroli is a much better buy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume makes for a very pleasant hour. First there's a very nice blast of fresh citrus for ten minutes or so, and then the ginger begins to dominate on my skin and it starts to smell deliciously like cookies. Still some citrus in the background but mostly sweet ginger. This split personality makes it interesting and great for every season, and if it lasted more than an hour I think I might love it. As it is, I like it very much.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: A somewhat one note fragrance, this hesperidic offering from Acqua di Parma is definitely bright and cheerful. Intense citrus facets of bergamot are further amplified by citron, beautifully capturing both the sour and bitter notes found in the freshly peeled rind and pith of each. Unfortunately, this is all that one can appreciate, as the accompanying notes are so far relegated to the background as to be nonexistent. I am only able to note subtle nuances of ginger far into the dry down, which does pair nicely with the intense citrus. Rose and cedar are lost on me. Lastly, barely perceptible vetiver (here capturing its lemony and woody facets) is noted several minutes after applying. Like most other citrus based fragrances, its tenacity and sillage are weak. I prefer Creed's Neroli Sauvage over this. (147)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favourite of the Blu Mediterraneo iterations. It hits just the right tone for me in terms of freshness, with an intensely cool bergamot and lemon, but sadly lasts barely 30 minutes on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me, it smells like citrus, bergamot, soft pine and little ginger. Love it! It's so fresh, little sweet and yummy! Easy summer scent, but longevity is not great around 2 hours on my skin.

I prefer this version over the other citrusy fragrance from Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia di Capri . Arancia smels more masculine on me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Zesty lemon !
This one is my forth favourite out of the blue line. Mandorlo being the first then Mirto then Fico Amalfi and now this. I am not sure if I will purchase it though because its true , the lasting power is not as good as with the others. But I usually don't mind that and just take it along and respray every hour ;).
This one is like sweet lemon pie. Very good !!!! Its so lemony and the ginger and ceader with the tonka is quite gourmandish to my nose. I can't resist it.
A great choice for warm summer days !
I still prefer Mirto and Fico as well as Mandorlo but if I ever add onto my colection it will likely be Bergamotto

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Another great smell from Acqua Di Parma, which lasts for all of 20 - 30 min, shame, why do they do this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is best for spring and fall. This is a very good value. It smells high quality and natural. If you love evergreen fragrances or conifir, this is top notch.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not quite, but I don’t know whether it’s just a matter of the artificiality of the brand, or of cypress itself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not sure if this is a summer scent or a balmy fall scent. Why not both, I suppose. It sort of lacks the cooling effect one would want during the summer to balm the skin and soul of oppressive heat, but it is still very fresh and invigorating. Monsieur Duchaufour has done a masterful job of creating a cypress accord that lasts quite a long time, throughout most of the life of the fragrance - a tricky feat for sure since cypress and pine notes have a tendency to disappear quite quickly. He accomplishes this by showing the different facets of cypress through each evolutionary step of the perfume. In the opening notes there is a beautiful mélange of herbs - notably rosemary, basil, and sage - combined with grapefruit that together delivers the very green herbal and also somewhat astringent and sulfuric qualities of cypress. After these dry down, which happens quite quickly, we're onto a more floral and spicy heart of jasmine and white florals, lavender, and coriander and cardamom, which together deliver the softer and drier side of cypress; the indolic jasmine and white florals give a smooth and fragrant feel, the lavender an aromatic and herbaceous lift, and the coriander and cardamom the spicy and resinous qualities. Just superb. By the time you are able to pick out what is going on in the heart, the base ingredients pick up their instruments and begin playing their notes of real cypress and pine oils, spicy cedar, and bright and earthy patchouli, oakmoss, and vetiver - the real deals in what would and should be a cypress/pine-forward perfume. High quality materials in the deft hands of a technical master is very nearly always a sure thing for a great perfume, and CdT is no exception. It gives this tremendous and evocative feeling that I've spent an entire day in a Tuscan cypress forest condensed to a matter of a few hours. The beautiful, cool, and dew-soaked morning when the sun first starts to evaporate the water from the cypress trees and the air, the wet herbs and earth taking their last big drink of the day, and the light begins coaxing the trees to life; the warm afternoon when the growing heat of the day encourages the cypress trees and wildflowers to begin releasing their oils; and finally the beginning of the evening, after the heat has been its most oppressive, the aromatics of the hot trees and the warmed earth have given all that they have to give and all start winding down to the cool evening preparing to do it all again tomorrow. Maybe I'm aggrandizing this perfume a bit; I've always had a big soft spot for green perfumes centering around cypress, pine or the like - so a beautifully executed perfume like CdT is going to be an easy win for me. I can live with my bias, and I can certainly live the rest of my days with this perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The Acqua di Parma line is new to me, having only recently sampled some of the cologne and EDT/EDP offerings, and overall it does feel like the ingredients are natural and high quality. Cipresso di Toscana is probably my favorite in the AdP lineup (I've still to sample the entire range). I liked Mirto di Panarea as well, which was my top choice from this house until today when I sampled CdT. CdT to my nose, has a dark/smoky tinge probably from the pine or cypress (not sure which, some other pine scents don't have the same smokiness) that reminds me of Mon Vetiver by Essential Parfums.
Overall, the scent is a 9/10, but the longevity and projection do fall short, which being an EDC, might not surprise anyone but I do kind of expect better performance if the prices are more like EDTs and EDPs.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On my person:
Opens very generic typical fresh shave aroma 🪒. 20min in it resembles a deodorant. 1hr in & it’s turning perfume’y.
I get absolutely Zero cypress, maybe a dash of pine in the opening seconds. Lavender is the main player here.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Interesting opening.. initially I get hit with a blast of coriander seeds and cardamom.. this isn’t my favourite part of the scent journey. Get past this and the scent settles down to a stunning light summer fresh fragrance. Well blended and very natural smelling. I love this after about 20 min on the skin but my only issue is its performance. Definitely one for the wearer.. it’s sophisticated and will transport you to the Mediterranean coast. I imagine myself in an open shirt and linen shorts sipping on a Gin on Tonic whenever I wear it. One I’m glad to have in my collection even if I don’t gravitate to it as often as I should.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: the best of the line, and of course, that is why it is discontinued...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice woody scent, a bit citrusy and green also fresh. Very nice spring scent but not really for very hot weather it's more for 25° C. Great woody scent I like this but you have to let it macerate.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Polo MR lite

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent is absolutely divine! It's so fresh and herbal, with a really lovely woody undertone. I love the citrusy opening – it's bright and uplifting. It lasts all day on me too, which is a bonus.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is 90% Alfred Sung Homme.

I have both, sprayed one on my left and the other on my right wrist, you won't be able to tell a difference.

Alfred Sung might be a little bit more soapy and heavy in the drydown than Acqua di Parma Cipresso di Toscana, that's why Acqua di Parma can be worn in the summer as it's lighter than ASH.

For longevity and sillage, well, Acqua di Parma is weak and intimate, where Alfred Sung Homme is an old money powerhouse fragrance.

Price - unfrotunately AdP is overpriced as hell for what is provides, you can find ASH $20 for 100ml, go figure...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Green trees and Italian freshness. Not much needs to be said. If this sounds like your thing, give it a sample. I slightly agree with Polo Green and Halston Z14 comparisons.
7.9/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have to say, I am quite disappointed with this one. Not a bad smell per se, but reminds me of the pharmacy bargain shelf shower gels etc. It’s generic and synthetic smelling. It’s not as complex as the listed notes would have you believe. I am sure maestro Duchaufour had a plan but the execution is sub par. Possibly poor quality ingredients. Or perhaps it just doesn’t like my skin… 3/10

I would happily trade the bottle I have (60ml remaining) for Jaipur EDP or something vintage

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow, not what I was expecting at all. This was the last in the Blu Mediterraneo line I sampled. That patchouli combined with the woods and cypress is just heavenly. I don't think anyone will agree with me, but the first thing I thought of when I smelled it was: 'Wow, this smells like Tom Ford's Tobacco Oud!'.

I find this not a summer fragrance at all, but man is it good. I kind of understand why this was discontinued as it doesn't fit the line at all, but I've always loved fragrances like this. It's very rough and surprises you with that blast of woods and green notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: On a sun-drenched morning in Tuscany, you walk through a quiet, winding path lined with tall cypress trees. The air is crisp and fresh, filled with the bright scent of orange and star anise, as the sunlight filters through the leaves. As the day warms, the earthy aromas of lavender and cypress rise from the trees, mixing with the soft breeze. By evening, as you rest near a rustic wooden bench, the grounding scent of pine and cashmere wood fills the air, capturing the essence of the tranquil countryside around you.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Described in one word: Crispy. I'm a big fan of fresh, summer ready fragrances that achieve light, invigorating profiles without relying heavily on the usual notes. Think citrus, colone, ambroxan, aquatic notes etc.

Cipresso di Toscana achieves freshness using tricks from the past, while managing to stay current enough. Freshness in the classical sense. Herbs, conifers, flowers, a freshness that is inspired by nature. I think this almost certainly features aromachemicals, but the overall feel and impression is a natural one. Seems like Acqua di Parma pulls this off pretty well across their line.

While it opens up with a piercing barbershop sharpness similar to Cerruti 1881, it quickly settles into a crispy green and invigorating heart that smooths out quickly. The cypress is there along with some other snappy green nuances, a little spice, and very blended floral lightness that exists without my nose picking up any obvious jasmine, lavender, or lily of the valley that's listed. If you despise flowers in your fragrance, the floral notes here shouldn't be a problem. I think they just provide a little lift and give an impression of "fresh air through the trees".

As it further dries down Cipresso reveals some of the slightly warmer base notes which maintain the natural theme. It does have a very slight hint of shaving cream, barbershop vibe in the base as well, but nothing like Azzaro PH or Drakkar. Also much sharper, and lighter in feeling than something like Z-14, which I like but reminds me of wood panel office parks in the 70s/80s. My gripe with some of older classic is they can feel muddy or dark brown in color, but Cipresso maintains a uplifting green presence. It doesn't scream 80's or Dad's aftershave to me, but then again I am a dad to-be in my 30s. So, take that with a grain of salt.

The base is very long lasting and warms up and darkens slightly, and sticks around as a closer to skin scent for a good 12 hours. The heart notes stick around too if you get some on fabric or your shirt collar. I think performance gripes here are a bit overstated, if you can make peace with the low to medium projecting scent. This is one of those weird ones that seems to wax and wane throughout the day, and almost gain strength as it sits on skin. I'll lose the scent sitting in place, but catch whiffs as I move through spaces or get active. I think any addition of fixatives would change this scent, and I'd much rather have this light and crisp profile than to have it end up a chemical mess on dry down.

In summary, I highly recommend this for fans of classic men's fragrances with a more natural and (slightly) updated feel. Cipresso is a bit more sober and serious. Yet the coniferous, gently spicy, and green notes give it a casual side that lends to evening and weekend wear as well. More versatile than some purely summer fragrances for these notes and the warmer/darker base notes that mix in. I'll be mixing this one into rotation throughout the year for when I want something mature and crisp, but not too conservative.

Did I mention it's crisp?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Discontinued for a good reason. This is a much "lesser" interpretation of the Italian cypress, compared to Tom Ford's Italian Cypress. The approach is similar yet the notes here are much less smoothly blended, a rough mix of pine needles and bitter herbs on a soapy base. Somehow the whole thing feels old-fashioned freshie but not in a good way, unlike the rest of the Blu line.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cipresso di Parma by Acqua Di Parma was a fragrance I had to give a chance as I am a huge fan of the Blu Mediterraneo line and a discontinued fragrance from this collection piqued my interest. However, I feel like this fragrance while an odd one out from the line doesn't really smell as great as the others and I can understand why this fragrance was discontinued. This smells like walking through a forest and passing by different types of leaves and trees which some people may like but again I wouldn't prefer it to the others in the line. The lavender from this fragrance is what makes this fragrance stand out and is what makes this smell good overall but I feel as if the other notes feel artificial so it can be a 50/50 for some people when smelling it. You could also say that when you smell this fragrance it may smell like a grassy and empty field that reminds you of memories from visiting the park or garden from the instant combination of different greenery in this fragrance. Just like the other Blu Mediterraneo fragrance the price is pretty modest for a niche fragrance as I was able to get this for around $150 so it's a good intro to unique fragrances.

The longevity is a bit surprising as a summer EDT fragrance which usually doesn't last long however this fragrance lasts around 5 hours on my clothes and skin which is way more than what I expected from the start. The sillage is however very weak and I can only really smell this fragrance at a very close distance so nothing really surprising for its sillage. Overall this is an average fragrance with a hint of uniqueness with strong green notes and is a great introduction to new fragrance enthusiasts.

Scent: 6/10
Performance: 5/10
Longevity: 5/10
Sillage: 3/10
Price: 8/10
Blind Buy Safe: 6/10
Overall: 5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I recently discovered this lovely gem.

It reminds me of scents like Halston Z-14 and Ralph Lauren Polo (Green). To me, there's something very nostalgic about it. I guess, the men around me when I was a child, back in the early 80's, smelled similar. Thus, this is my perception of what a real man is supposed to smell like and I love it. I feel, I gravitate more and more towards these old school type of fragrances.

I don't understand the criticism about the longevity. I've worn it a couple of times now and it lasts, especially on clothes. I sprayed it around 19 hours ago now and I can still smell it prominently on my shirt. The other day I sprayed it on my arm and also got a good 8 hours of a nice whiff now and again.

Such a shame that it's discontinued. You can still find it, but it's going and soon it'll just be another memory of how men used to smell...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice, fresh green scent that is different. Unfortunately, the performance is very weak. Turned into a skin scent after about 15 minutes. Longevity was about 2 hours and it was gone. What's the point? I don't have any use for a perfume that's this weak. Perhaps useful as an aftershave, that's about it, or to freshen up your bed, pillow or linen closet. A shame because the scent itself is really nice.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This should be called Basílico di Toscana because the basil is really prominent in this fragrance. I love the smell of basil but if you don’t like that smell I would suggest you sample it first

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I bought this since it was on sale.

I feel this like a modern interpretation of a barber shop and I wish we had more similar to this, because this is really good.
Longevity is in the ball park of 6-7 hours for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Good for summertime casual wear, although the sillage is not so strong. I still love it though and always keep a bottle around.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Discontinued!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I remember when I first started collecting. I always liked cypress and pine as favorite notes. This was discontinued. Glad it's back!
It was a blind buy. I heard it had a lot of anise, which is often too sharp and bitter for my taste. I was glad at first impression, I got the anise, but it's perfectly blended with the citrus. It felt a bit peppery, like the Blenheim Bouquet structure of citrus, pepper, lavender, conifer.
A lot of cheepos have poor synthetic cypress. But the cypress and pine are quite good and recognizable. The cypress took some time to be really noticable, around the mid.
It's fresh and spicy in an Italian way perhaps.
Love the conifer base.
Will be best in Summer, but has good enough projection to be enjoyable in Winter.

Just a side note: Clive Christian Cypress, is the best quality, realistic cypress I have found.

PS: Just put it as my signature for Summer. It takes 15 minutes to settle to a harmonious fragrance of spicy, green, conifer fougere.
Fresh yet has warm spicy touches.

Rating: 8.25/10

God bless. John 3:16

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: @kristoferiskariot I'm guessing that the anisic note is the AdP basil. I love it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice and clean piney scent. Performance is solid for an EDT. I got three sprays about 6 hours ago and is still going strong. I don't really get why people whine so much about ADP's performance. I have 7 and only one of them I would consider it "weak".

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Big AdP fan normally, so was excited to get my sample in of this one, but someone in the comments here made the perfect association I couldn't quite put my finger on - there's strong Cool Water vibes from this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cipresso di Toscana is an aromatic fougère, masculine and barbershop-like, but underwhelming. The green woody goodness I was expecting fades fast, leaving in its wake a generic, soapy aftershave.

CdT has a promising green opening, with a realistic pine accord and a strong lavender note - so far, so fougère. It is quite herbal here, and as it develops, a peppery undertone becomes evident, complementing the greenness and keeping things aromatic. Woody notes follow, a natural progression from the green opening.

However, this all happens very quickly, and after about half an hour, it fades to a musky, soapy, barely-there skin scent that isn't even that pleasant. Sillage is intimate and longevity is weak.

An aromatic, masculine-leaning freshie for hot weather, CdT shows promise initially but ultimately falls flat. Disappointing and definitely overpriced. 2/5.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Because it is 1 hour of bliss bathing in natural ingredients.
GET CLOSER TO THIS COMPANY.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Why would you want to wear something like that when the longevity is 1 hour? It's a shame. STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful green scent!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful fresh, green fragrance - the cypress note is obviously dominant, but it's not one dimensional or piney. The florals and citruses balance it out a bit so it's not too mature or barbershop-like, but still leans heavily masculine. It's more alpine forest to my nose than Tuscany, and if oversprayed perhaps a bit too heavy for summer, but looks like my next spring/autumn choice.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have tested Acqua di Parma Cipresso di Toscana for a second time on paper, yesterday.
At the same time I tested Chanel Paris-Edimbourg, another Cipress based fragrance.

Curious thing: If I smell first Cipresso di Toscana and then Paris- Edimbourg, I am not able to smell the Chanel. If I smell
Paris- Edimbourg first, I still can smell the Acqua di Parma, which is stronger to my nose.
I have been on the fence with Cipresso di Toscana simply because the ratings on Fragrantica are lower but on paper it does pretty well. It's stronger than the Chanel and I also enjoy the scent more.
Furhermore the price for the Chanel has been increased this year from 83€ to 98€ for 50 ML.
Makes it an easy choice.

It will be my 15th Acqua di Parma. Just as many as I own from Chanel. Although I have finish and not replaced a 16th Chanel, being Bleu De Chanel EDP. So Chanel stays in pole position.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Highly disappointed. I was expecting a green/citrus freshie and what I got was soap, aftershave, old man DNA fougere. Not a bad fragrance, objectively, just definitely fits a certain demographic of man and that's not me.
The opening is sharp, piney, and VERY aftershavey; the dry down is more mellow oakmoss. The barbershop comparisons are apt; although "barbershop" can mean different things to different people. Bad blind buy unless you are an older gent and well acquainted with this type of genre. It's not a blue scent, and not something I think would have great sex appeal.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Different from the other ADP Blu lines...more woody, less citrusy. Instead of a refreshing citrus scent walking along the mediterranean coast, this is like that same area but further in walking amongst the cypress trees. Invigorating, brisk, and refreshing. I'd say it's more of a test before buy ADP Blu line than the others, but it's still very pleasant.

Very natural and high quality which is what i love about ADP Blu...ok longevity and modest sillage. A great pick me up before heading out for a nice walk through the woods.

Scent: 8 / Longevity: 7 / Sillage: 7

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Holy Star Anise!!! Why is this note not listed? This is the most dominate note, and it’s beautful with the cypress. Beautiful fragrance, very well blended and reminiscent of Tuscany.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a beautiful scent, but I think it is more appreciable if you've ever spent any time in Tuscany, and I say this for a reason. AdPs Blu Mediterraneo line first came out while I was living in a small town in Tuscany. As a fan of this house, I immediately investigated the new line at a local boutique, and Tuscan Cypress resonated with me greatly. It was EXACTLY the scent of the town I'd been living in and what I loved so much about the "air" and atmosphere around me. I purchased two bottles right away, and over the years, it became harder to find. I have a few from this collection, but CdT is my favorite. During my time in Italy, I traveled to many regions and towns throughout the country, and Blu Mediterraneo does an excellent job in capturing the "essence" and vibe of each of the locations in its lineup both through using extraits indigenous to those regions and in transporting you there, yourself. Magical.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: My fave blue bottle from AdP. Love this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I wasn’t a huge fan of this one. It reminded me a lot of Montblanc Presence actually. Presence smells good but not really my cup of tea (very shaving foam-like, nice smell but not as a frag) so I didn’t wear it much. Smelling side by side though, Presence actually smells better. They are quite similar but the Acqua di Parma was a little on the harsh side, and Presence more smooth. It lasted a very long time on clothes though, so if you like this ADP you’ll be happy with the performance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Cipresso di Toscana...


...is my journey from Salsomaggiore Terme to Firenze in scent form.
It reflects the hilly italian countryside perfectly with all it's herbal green and woody whafts of goodness with the mediterranean see poking through with some blue freshness every now and then.
It is a very natural interpretation of a good herbal and woody scent.
I personally don't understand how some people label this as dated because time and scents are impossible to combine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cypress is definitely a misrepresented note, fragrances like Encre Noire, Chanel Sycomore (both of which I love) have equated dry rooty earthy vetiver with cypress which it really doesn’t even remotely smell like.

Smelling the natural extract it smells intensely aromatic, not dark but rather dry, cold, and green, not even remotely similar to vetiver.
This is one of the few cypress fragrances which portray cypress spot on.
The base is distinctly barbershop though which may limit your enjoyment.
In terms of authenticity it is stellar, overall though it is a bit mature and old school. Nonetheless one of the good offerings from the house

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A fougere that drys down to a green coolwater. Strangely, also has Dior Elixir vibes (old school barber shop fougere).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I blind bought that one thinking it would be fresh and deep. Instead, the notes together make me sick. I tried few times on my skin and on my husband s skin and I feel nauseous anytime. Not for me at all. I have a full bottle to give away.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance and its name evoke the magnificence of the Sienese countryside that I love so much, with its gentle hills, the exterminating well-tended, very green countryside, its magnificent and luxuriant fragrant gardens. This masterful triumph of aromatic assonances of sage and rosemary, combined with the lively notes of petitgrain and star anise that the olfactory pyramid of fragrantica does not report, but is felt very well. The herbaceous freshness, the vivid citrus notes of grapefruit, the boise base, an intensely balsamic allure of cypress and pine. A fresh, restorative, balsamic, relaxing fragrance. Rightly unisex.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is a bit of a departure from most of the other ADP Blue offerings (almost all of which I have really enjoyed). I've worn it several times now and every time I spray it I have an initial blast of piney loveliness followed by a perfectly pleasant but very familiar lasting aromatic, sweet, woody smell which gives me strong flashbacks to teenage changing rooms in the '90s. To me this smells very similar indeed to a Lynx (or Axe for those outside the UK/Oz/NZ) body spray, it's been too long for me to put my finger on precisely which one, possibly Java? Tempest? Nevada? Mirage? Maybe Apollo? it's 100% one those old ones from the '90s. I searched to see if anyone else has made this connection but it seems to just be me so take all of this with a pinch of salt but I swear it's very similar.

This is not really a criticism, the smell is nice, especially after a few hours when it's settled down but the familiarity for me is so strong that it feels positively retro whenever I wear it and I worry that if I ran into an old school-friend they'd think I'd been hoarding discontinued Lynx products all these years.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Incarnation of cacharel pour homme. I paid 10e for cacharel pH, i don't think i overpaid. When i smelled the dry down of this ADP CDT i realized i got a bargain in cacharel.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: What a disappointment for me. That dreadful anise note combined with pine upsets my stomach to a point that makes me sick. Prefer the Bergamotto di Calabria much much better.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a small sample, rather old, 2011 or around. When I tested it then, I found it too strong, very piney and a bit harsh and put it away. I picked it up again now and the strong piney beginning is softer, topnotes softened or partly vanished because of age maybe? The drydown is fabulous and I know why I find it so. It is the oakmoss. Oh my, soo good. I wonder if it is still there in current wersion?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just another ADP scent that smells like barbershop.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: It would have been the perfect woody fresh scent, but the cardamom ruins it for me. Gave to my husband, and the cardamom doesn't bother me as much when I smell it on him. Lesson learnt though-don't buy anything with cardamom listed as a note.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My absolute favourite from entire AdP.
While im lying on hammock, the smells of thick pines and cypress comes thru the wind.
Deeply aromatic, powdery, clean and manly.
Somehow classic, but not in the old school way.
Perfect all arounder.
Hands down mr.Duchaufour.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Green herbs and pine, very masculine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like this one. I can't help but to compare this to Suavage Elixir--the dry down has a very similar vibe. I think it's the combination of the anise/anethole and the other green notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Most of this line are great value solely due to the quality of materials. Phot realistic and mouth watering. Not usually projectors or long lived, but if you got the dough, these are worth it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: i blind bought it because of the blue bottle. I thought it would be aquatic fresh perfume. Alas, it is a green, spicy perfume that is not to my taste. however, i give it to my man who suited this kind of scent and he love it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Cipress di Toscana has a very sharp and penetrating opening with a strong initial sillage. The opening gives you pine, cypress, petitgrain, a hint of lavender, a greenish tinge that feels close to sage, and something a little spicier as well as a hint of citrus that feels half way between orange and lemon and grapefruit. The petitgrain and pine combination can be a little headachy for me, but then petitgrain and I tend not to get on very well together. The licorice note (star anise) gradually comes through very gently but with increasing presence in the first hour. There's a sort of thin lemon incense feel in the first hour which I presume is the elemi in the background. In the opening hour Cipresso di Toscana feels like a much sharper, much more aggressive version of Tom Ford's Italian Cypress.

Two hours in and Cipresso di Toscana has settled down into a nicer blend, softer, more subtle, and with a correspondingly reduced sillage. There's not a massive development from this point onwards. By five and a half hours in the petitgrain headaches have gone and the scent is a little softer again but it feels more of an okay than a like to me. It's perfectly fine in that there's nothing wrong with it but it's just not good enough to dislodge the likes of similar perfumes (Tom Ford's Italian Cypress, Floris 1962, Acqua di Parma's Chinotto di Liguria) from my preferences among aromatic scents, especially those with leading themes of cypress or pine. By this stage it's just a skin scent but it really sticks to my shirt sleeves.

Six and half hours in the perfume has become a little sweeter. The lavender is more prominent and there's something else green and something a touch sweeter. The fading process is well underway but it really hangs in there - I get about twelve hours from it so if you want durability you certainly get it here by the bucket load!

I think Cipresso di Toscana is one of those perfumes that works at any time of the year but I'd favour it during the early autumn and spring with the cool morning air that warms up. Despite my disagreement with the petitgrain I can appreciate it's an elegant scent. But I think there are one or two which do the cypress - pine - aromatic better.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you crush cypress needles between your fingers and smell them, that's exactly what this smells like. You get no more and no less. Would work great as an everyday scent if you're just feeling casual and cool but won't be a compliment machine, IMO.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Brilliant stuff from ADP. A clean, piney top with the characteristic soapiness in the drydown.
I have no idea where fragrantica got their fictional note list from. According to ADP’s website, the notes for this fragrance are:

Top: orange, elemi, star anise
Mid: lavandin, clary sage, petit grain
Base: cypress, pine needles, fir balsam

The longevity is solid with this one, more so than others in the Blu Mediterrano line. Cipresso's piny qualities are quite different than other masculine pines like Polo, Quorum, One Man Show, etc. Do not be quick to dismiss it if you haven't cared for piney scents before-this is all done with debonair nonchalance, as if the fragrance is carried to you on the breeze rather than condensing thick in a murky miasma in a coniferous bog. A perfect summer woody scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Imagine being high in the Alps, in a pine forest surrounded by wildflowers. This is what it smells like! Pine, cypress, with notes of lavender and jasmine. It’s a little citrusy but it’s very light.

Like all other fragrances from the Blu Mediteraneo collection, the sillage is too intimate and the longevity is at most of 3 hours. It’s a much more masculine scent but I believe the flowers and citrus make it unisex.

7/10, that’s my rating for it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Have a tester/ sample of this. I tend to really like ADP and I also enjoy cypress and pine notes. I think this is classy and not attention seeking. Would definitely wear this in Summer

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a disappointment this is, smells like a cheap and mainstream aftershave that can be found at every supermarket. Or just imagine what a locker room would smell like.
I would say don't even bother trying it. Annoyingly mediocre and completely dull. There is also a headache inducing note.

5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mature, elegant, old-school classy.

Im Italian irl and this smells Italian, but not sure in the best way. This scent is before the 1970's boozy era of frags, so im getting a classy semi-wealthy enjoying life as a financially free man of the 1960's.

Its good, buuuuuut, it's not going to garner you any compliments in 2020, it smells like an older gents skin DNA, you know when a guy wears a cologne for decades and it just melds with his natural body scent (like my dad...lol may he rip). It gives off a light yet rich barbershop/soapy scent + a lil dry small florals in the mid notes.

I think you'd need to be in the right situation to wear this, im thinking while on vacation in Italy, driving a convertible from town to town with your sunglasses on and the wind blowing through your hair vibe. It's dated, yet, kindly beautiful. I'd recommend 'Sedley' from PDM as a superior frag in this genre.

*Edit: End Dry-off has a soft bugspray scent from one or some of the natural ingredients. Id say this is a 'no-buy!'

2/5 Woofs

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Currently making my way through my first batch of fragrance discovery sets and I also got Blu Mediterraneo samples intrigued by a couple of influencers... Safe to say I'll be bying a full size of at least three of the scents.

Cipresso Di Toscana was one of the first I tried and it was not an immediate love. The first time I sprayed it on it was on a very hot day and the scent simply didn't stick well with my skin. The next time it was a totally different story. While I couldn't smell much of the citrus, the cypress was obvious from the get-go. As time went by, a smoky note came through and stayed for the rest of the wear. This is one of the most long-lasting in the line, a good 3-4 hours.

It's a beautiful autumn-winter scent for me. Not too dark, but serious and deep.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: So, unfortunatly, I don't really get any cypress. I was hopping for a more mature Gucci Sport, but have received a less sharp Platinum Egoiste. Still a nice scent, but nothing to Dow ith cypress, at least on me :(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This unisex scent leans very masculine on me. It's spicy and sharp with conifer notes. This scent is dark green.

There is something very calming and serene about this fragrance that reminds me of cloud-soft over-sized hoodies, holding a cup of coffee or hot tea with both hands, and reading a book by the fireplace in winter (though I think this fragrance can work in any season).

I really like it a lot, but would like it so much more on a man. If I smelled a man wearing this, I would be very attracted to the fragrance and I might even start a conversation with him. It would definitely be catching for me.

Unfortunately, silage for me is very soft. I ended up spraying it on my shirt to correct this and it projected much better. Longevity is moderate.

Definitely a safe blind buy for men unless one wants to test the silage first. Try before you buy for women.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Went to buy Mirto Di Panarea (and I did), also sprayed Cipresso di Toscana on paper. It smelled nice, so got this one too. But after wearing it couple of times, I'm kinda disappointed. It's somehow very weak on my skin. I feel heavy liquid on the skin, the smell is there, but it's somehow subdued, faint. Doesn't seem to project at all. Or my nose is broken, one or the other.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Blind-bought a 30ml bottle after everything i've heard about it. It's a safe blind buy for men. It smells simple and green. Doesn't smell like a fragrance. Just green cypress plain and simple that doesn't develope at all. Is the type that you you don't need to like, but it's impossible to dislike it. Quite boring, but that's what i was after. Have a scent in Your Collection that is completely safe and just smells refreshing like the smell of a forrest breeze where you can smell the moss and leaves from the trees. That is exactly what this is. The refreshing, yet the dry, slightly powdery nature of the forrest.

A dumb reach that's easy to wear everywhere at any time.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful aromatic fougere-style fragrance that reminds me strongly of the sorely missed Insensé, maybe due to the deft marriage of citrus, floral and conifer notes. Great balance, performance and quality. Sb's mentioned similarity to Platinum Egoiste and I can definitely see it too, especially in the modern and slightly metallic barbershop opening, though Cipresso, to me, sits closer to nature. And I like it a lot.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have no idea why, but all I really got was soap, soap, and more soap. Had to wash this off after an hour, cuz it never really morphed into anything I could remotely like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best of the Blu line, ever. So happy to see it re-released!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I've had a bottle of the post-relaunch perfume for about 2 weeks now, and I'm very satisfied. It's still the same Cipresso di Toscana, and it's beautiful. Some friends of mine describe it as a barbershop fragrance, and there are certainly people who think it's nothing special; yes, it's an aromatic fougere and it smells like the 1980s. However, it's everything people wished they had back then. I think Bertrand Duchaufour took an old style and created something that would have been the envy of his colleagues back in 1985. When I smell Cool Water, it's dull, but Cipresso di Toscana is happiness. It has elements of the sea and the pines lining the coast. It's inspired by Italy, but it reminds me of the beaches of Virginia, where I'd go every summer as a boy. Pines grow on the barrier islands, so pine naturally goes with marine notes to create a seashore complex. This fragrance transports me back to that time in my life.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
They must have released this again. I have a cool little sample (1.2ml/0.04oz). I was only going to wear this during winter, as the smell is kind of dense. But after reading other reviews I think I'll save a bit to try in the summer. I'll add it to my review if I ever do that.

This is the description on the sample card:
An intense and aromatic scent. Fresh notes of sage and rosemary embrace the lively scents of star anise and petit-grain, together with a balsamic cypress and pine base.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So I hear they are re releasing the best of the line, with ADP ginepro right beside it. Im sorry this stuff blows the whole line out of the water as a man speaking. Its indescrible if your trying to compared this to another scent. Its that unique. A balance of every scent, Citrus-Flower-spice and woods.

What site is this on, as of 5/2019???

Straight masculine to my nose, not unisex. I remember where I first sprayed this scent on at Neiman Marcus back in the early 2000s, I then walk in Macys and Dillards an ask the sales women to sniff my arm. They look they had on there face was priceless. " Whoa What is that, we definately dont sale that kind of fragrance here"???!! The perfumer Bertand D was in a category of his on with this one. A Masterpiece. Try or buy it

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has been relaunched now... still smells like before and it's my favorite from the blue bottles line.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: One statement " CLASSIC, Cant stop sniffing it and Head turner", Man this stuff is awesome and intoxicating, forget it being unisex, this is MASCULINE at its best. even after 13 years since the release.
