review_content: I found this fragrance more conservative that the version Oud or Ambra. I would list these three in the following order: 1.Colonia Oud 2. Colonia Ambra 3. Colonia Mirra being the last one a more subtle and more quieter than the first two. I would give a final score: 3 of 5

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This stuff smells deep and rich almost like a cookie dough vibe, but manly. It will turn heads for a mature audience. I think people are sleeping on this one, modern and vintage. a casual and dress up fragrance that gets the job done.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma is such a classy brand.

From the moment you open the box you can feel the quality and the luxury. Colonia mirra delivers exactly what its name says. From the very start you are greeted with an ambery, sweet but steady myrrh note. This is for the elegant, dark haired gentleman over 30. Longevity is good but not excellent. If you genuinely like myrrh, give it a try. However, my myrrh obsession is already fulfilled by the 2012 version of Eau sauvage Parfum which has a bit more brightness IMO and better performance.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Spiritual, meditative, sensual, deep, elegant, masculine.

Perfectly matches its name as it's VERY resinous, which I find lovely.

However, the more it drys down the sweeter it gets and becomes a bit cloying. It's also not very easy to wear so although I fell in love with the scent at the beginning I won't be buying a bottle, I can't spend so much on something that's not 100% satisfactory.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma, my new favorite brand and a true master of blends.
All their perfumes are made of high quality ingredients and this one is no exception.

This perfume says: I enjoy being a man!

This creature is extraordinary, utterly admirable. Everything about this perfume is as it should be. Everything is in its place. Everything is balanced.
The notes come in, play their role in the light of a resinous myrrh and amber accord and slowly fade away with a goodbye kiss on your senses.

The opening is a little bit powerful, but just enough to grab your attention. Then the myrrh comes in and the beautiful, sweet, and boozy amber starts to play in the background. This is the main theme of the perfume and it will be like this until you can't smell the perfume anymore.
I've applied it 12 hours ago and I can still smell it on my arm. I actually sniffed my arm more than 100 times today.

Myrrh and amber are two of my beloved notes in perfumes and they always will be. So I have to say, this is one of the top 5 perfumes I've ever smelled in my life, maybe even the best.

Overall, a sweet lovely perfume, made of high quality ingredients, suitable for colder months with a not-so-casual vibe.

Thank you for making this gem!

Scent: A beautiful combination of myrrh and amber. 12/10
Uniqueness: 10/10
Longevity: 10/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mirra is the third one I have tried from the ADP Ingredient line after Oud and Leather and like those two, I love this one as well. This is a beautiful, powdery spice n Myrhh fragrance.

Top notes are a fleeting dash of citrus and the sharp spicy note of the nutmeg. This spicy nutmeg is joined by a very beautiful myrhh note. This heart phase is just lovely and then turns powdery when the patchouli comes into focus. The dry down is a blend of the myrhh, and powdery patchouli with hints of amber notes. All in all, very clean smelling for want of a better word. longevity is pretty decent, around the 6-7 hour range on me although projection dies down after the first hour into what I would call the "hugging" range. I get whiffs of it all through it's scent life so it does last.

In conclusion, I would say if you are a fan of the Myrhh note or of powdery frags in general, this is a good entry with the usual fantastic ADP quality in ingredients and blend. I would say this is Masculine mostly although a woman could easily pull this off too if she does not mind the spice. Definitely a large decant or Full bottle worthy for me. 8.5/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow this is amazing. If I was forced to compare it to something similar, I’d say TM Ultra Zest, but this ADP mirra is a much more refined + creative take on that basic idea. (for the sake of giving ppl an idea who haven’t smelled it yet).
This has a feel to it that feels like it is blooming when u wear it, with this extremely beautiful + lush + full, but at the same time fragile/nuanced + transparent,

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just a big myrrh coat. This just wraps ya up in a big, dusty, fuzzy, myrrhy blanket that’s perfectly warm, soothing, and sweet.

Mirra is long lasting, has very good projection, and is made from quality ingredients. Even though they don’t smell anything alike, this could be in the same family and of the same quality as TF Noir Extreme; if you like one, you would probably like the other one, too.

Mirra had me at first smell. 10/10.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Un parfum sophistiqué, rare comme composition, mérite bien d’être un parfum niche, il est très volupté, englobe un coté ambré majestueux, c'est un parfum pour homme virile et non pas pour jeune homme

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After investigation, the originality of this frag is probably due to a component which is not stated in the parfume pyramid above, myrrh oil, which gives rise to some confusion or questions in the reviews here (honey? creamy? amber? ...).
Myrrh is present here in two forms: myrrh resin (a middle note) and myrrh oil (a base note along with a discrete patchouli).
It's this oily base note which is really dominant and long lasting in this frag.
I should have read the small booklet which is included in the 150 ml box I bought ! It tells it all: no amber as erroneously stated in the pyramid above, just myrrh oil.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Applause, what a well balanced and interesting perfume.
I didn't expect otherwise by this house of course.
How to describe this perfume is not easy. It is a compilation of different notes that are not natural easy partners to combine. This perfume is distinctive and also adepts to everyone who wears it.
The opening is a typical Italian based perfume with the the fusion of citric notes. But they are not overwhelming.
The aromatic raisins and nutmeg keep it in balance.
Happily the patchouli is of a good quality so it stays in the background, but gives also balance by its light sweet freshness to the strong fusion of the balsamic amber and spicy nutmeg notes.
This is really a nice perfume for a man who is distinctive but also modest.
When to wear? I guess its a four season perfume:)
Every note reacts different according the season you wear it.
This is a really modern perfume for one who likes class and style in a modest way. It represents in some way the Italian way of life like the Blue mediterraneo series really do.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one's derivative but not really a carbon copy of anything. I get hints of Creed Tabarome, Creed Aberdeen Lavander, Diptyque Eau Duelle, and Rag & Bone Amber. It's basically all of those mixed together, with some neroli or petitgrain sprinkled in

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Best Coca-Cola scent ever.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@RogerM72
Mhyrr is a quite complicated scent and ADP is right to give it a try IMHO.
I agree that something is lacking in the parfume pyramid ... could be honey, or also a special tuberose-evocative amber I smell only on some of the parts of my skin after an hour.
I'll try to investigate !
A great frag nevertheless.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma masters the blending of aromatic scents, and here they've done it again! In Mirra we have the fragrant and sweet myrrh mixed with aromatic nutmeg and neroli on a pleasant amber base. The myrrh notes came out relatively quickly after the initial citrus blast, and gradually became sweeter over the course of the dry down. Just like any other ADP scents all notes are harmoniously blended. No harsh edges.

The performance is at least 7 hours, however the projection can be a bit shy on cooler days.

I like it a lot, and would say this is a good summer myrrh perfume, which is not that easy to come by!

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very noticeable bay leaf note is what characterises this leather perfume. And the official list of notes does not even mention it.
It's complex, smokey, mature, elegant, but unique as well. Most people will not be smelling of smoked spices with leather, and this will definitely invite curiosity with its unusual and mysterious projection.
Though it is prominent, it is not aggressive. This is because of its mature, base note heavy presence.
I love it, and find it to be best for cool/cold evenings.
Nothing skanky but not citrusy either.
Smokey, spicy, and a touch of sweetness....

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful, I like it very much😍🥰😍

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is born like stories woven from the threads of time: the first breaths from a luxurious Italian leather bag, exuding the scent of the ancient craftsman pouring his soul into every thread and stitch.
It is not just a leather scent, but a sensual poem that begins with light and completes in shadow.
From the first spray, the Mediterranean Sea breeze rushes through a wave of Sicilian lemon and Brazilian orange, illuminated by red raspberry as a playful smile at the start of the journey.
The freshness here is not superficial; it is a quick light that gleams before the colors shift toward a warmer and more mysterious depth.
At the heart, a hidden garden blooms: soft rose, wavering honeysuckle, and green bitter orange shining like morning dew, while the sound of red thyme rises like oriental spices whispering warmth.
Here, leather appears for the first time, neither harsh nor loud, but warm and soft like the page of an old notebook wrapped in a leather strap, blended with flowers and herbs in a harmony that amazes.
As for the base, it is the climax of the story: a rich, luxurious note, deep and evocative, blended with smoky guaiacwood and the steadfast Atlas cedar.
It's as if you are wearing a new leather jacket that smells of the remnants of a distant winter's fireplace smoke, or as if you open the door to an old library holding leather-bound books pulsating with memories.
It is a fragrance that combines frankness and softness, featuring luxurious leather that harmoniously blends masculinity and femininity.
Performance: long-lasting for many hours, with moderate to strong projection, making your presence felt even after you leave.
Mood: evokes a sense of quiet strength and dignity mixed with elegance, like someone wearing a dark suit and carrying an Italian leather bag on a refined winter evening.
And if Tom Ford's Tuscan Leather is loud and rebellious, then Acqua di Parma's Leather is the polished, aristocratic, quiet voice that doesn't need to shout to assert its presence.
This perfume is the companion of cold evenings and formal nights, where its deep, leathery features shine most splendidly.
Ideal for high-level business meetings, a luxurious dinner at an elegant restaurant, or as a finishing touch for a man who knows how to balance strength and refinement.
In summer or hot weather, just a few sprays are enough to give it space to breathe without overpowering.
Leather is not just a scent to be smelled, but an experience to be told.
It is a statement of luxury, a personal signature written with leather, citrus, and flowers, leaving an indelible mark.
It teaches you that true luxury does not come with noise, but with a deep calm that remains in memory.

Ahmed Hadi – Baghdad – IRAQ

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Annoying that it’s just leather — they all seem to enjoy diving into this cheap, basic leather variation, banking on the idea that this is exactly what people like. So far, only Ford has done this well with Ombre; the rest of the good ones are primarily proper compositions, not leather lollipops like, I guess, Leather Patchouli or Guerlain’s leather take, etc. As I understand, this is some EDP version of a scent already known in the ADP?

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is NOT a dirty leather.
What it does smell like is a rich leather couch ina gentleman's smoking room.....there is a beautiful smokiness like an expensive cigar or cigarettes, mixed with a bouquet of spices such as black cardamom. Floral trails of oriental bouquets add to the aura of an exclusive gentleman's club with expensive flower arrangements.
I could wish for greater projection, but then again, a gentleman never shouts his presence.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The bottle is beautiful, AdP is renowned, and I honestly bought this fragrance because not only am I currently into leathery/smoky/spicy scents, but because this particular perfume has been discontinued, I figure it'd be a sought-after collector's item one day. Unfortunately, as a fragrance, it's not tops on my list in this genre. The opening is rough and unappealing -- it's a mix of leather, used cigarette butts and a little bit of burnt rubber. The mid is a bit more mellowed out and yet still rough because of the over-prominence of the leather note. At that point, it smells sort of in the vicinity of Maison Crivelli Oud Maracuja, but not as smooth, fruity (not that I consider OM to be that fruity in the first place) or strong in performance. The dry down comes much faster with AdP Leather than with OM, which is the longest-lasting cologne I have ever used. When this fragrance finally smells at its best, it's too late -- by then, it's almost a skin scent. It would have helped if AdP had added a vanilla accord, not to make it gourmand but to tamper down the leather / cigarette ash smell a little. AdP Leather isn't bad per se; it's just not that great as a scent, and its arc doesn't properly align with its lifespan.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Another masterpeice by François Demachy who gave us the most elegant leather of all time; Dior Homme Parfum. ✨👑 (and like the beloved DHP, AdP Leather is also discontinued 🙄)

AdP Leather is a smokey primal brooding dark leather where the Paraguayan Guaiac wood takes center stage and gives you that dark smokey aspect of a leather accord. 🌫️ 🖤 🌫️ 🖤

It's a true leather fragrance where the leather is always present throughout the fragrance's journey with you. The famous AdP citrus is also here to give it that elegant freshness, preparing you for a dark descent into the primal dark journey of the rugged bold leather accord. This is such a well-blended formulation! The cedar gives it that alpha masculine sharpness. 😎

This smells like you had to do some hard decisions in your head. It is a very serious fragrance, which is why it's leaning very formal. 🤵

A video review is also available on my YT ▶️

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is so strong on leather, very high quality perfume.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Early spring in New York, sunny days, the air still feels crisp. The city is calm, like awakening - traveling has you tired and jaded, but this feels uplifting. He stands in front of you, a strong man. But there's a softness and a freshness to him, a comforting sadness. You miss him and look for him; he's nowhere to be found.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of my all time favourites, the strength and intensity is just insane. This is a go to for situations when power is needed. I have found that it can offend some people due to the sheer strength, especially in environments such as busy tubs or trains. The dry down is exquisite and becomes soft and sweet. Oh what a beautiful fragrance, I think hey have stopped making this one now.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
DP Leather (black bottle) is dirty, smoky, sweet leather.
This HAS to macerate for one month otherwise all you will smell is wet cigarettes. Also, give the bottle a small shake before spraying.
The "off" smell people mention when comparing it to the old brown bottle smells like liquorice.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma Leather EdP is a clean, masculine leather fragrance. Regardless of the listed notes, I get immediate leather and essentially nothing else in the opening. The far dry down has a little woody scent appearing in addition to the leather. This is strictly a clean leather. Not a hint of band aid smell and does not come across as strongly animalic. Overall leather scent is smooth, clean and classy. Seems pretty versatile; would work for formal or casual wear, any time of day, and day of the year outside of very hot days. I have not tested any of the Tom Ford leathers, but will be doing so soon. Should be interesting to compare. Longevity good - about 8 hours for me with decent sillage and projection the first hour, becoming a closer scent bubble after that.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: goten moten

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I own both this and Tuscan Leather.
While Tuscan Leather is the new, designer made leather jacket, Colonia Leather is the jacket that went through a few motorcycle crashes with cigars in its inner pocket.

Imagine this: You are at the Italian coast, starting the aperitivo. The girls order an aperol spritz and the boys a negroni. One guy doesn't want either, and orders a whisky and lights up a small cigar. Everyone looks at him weird. He doesn't care and does what he wants.

THIS is how he smells. As you could probably tell from the length of this review, I am very passionate about this fragrance (and Acqua di Parma as a whole). Perhaps I am biased because I am Italian, but there is nothing quite like ADP available. How they go about their perfumery is pure art, and modern designers could learn a lot from them.

To start: I don't think this smells like Tuscan Leather at all, in the same way that a retro leather jacket is very different from a modern one. This one is more masculine, more rough. It's the perfect combo between that classy Acqua di Parma citrus and the animalic notes from the leather, woods and smoke. Like a man riding a sports bike in a suit :)

I'm not saying that this is 'a better fragrance' than Tuscan Leather, but damn, there is just nothing like this on the market. Tuscan Leather has a few alternatives like Godolphin and that one from Rasasi (they are all worse than TL though), but there is not a single fragrance that captures that Italian masculinity like this one. Besides, it is not redundant to own them both. I reach more for Tuscan Leather when the setting is outside/colder and more for Colonia Leather in warmer settings.

Moreover, I do detect a slight difference between the old Colonia Leather and the new black bottle (I have a decant of the new stuff). The new version has a slightly more prominent raspberry note, but I only noticed the difference when I smelled them side by side, and it would be impossible to detect the difference in the air. I am sure it is caused by the fact my old, brown bottle is from 2018 so it has aged a bit, while the decant is from the newest bottle. It is not worth hunting old bottles, unless you connect sentimental values to it.

Lastly, the fact that people think this is "hard to wear" and "too smokey" makes me even love it more. This stuff is Italian confidence in a bottle. 10/10.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes, it is in the Tuscan leather lineage but on the lighter and slightly brighter side with a prominent citrus note
Highly wearable and classy

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The leather note is incredible right from the start; it is probably the strongest and most natural leather note I've ever encountered (even more pronounced than in the Leather Colonia). This note is very animalic in its naturalism but not "dirty," reminding me more of sun-tanned, rustic, and bronzed leather tools than the smell of a sweaty animal and other bodily odors, as in Kouros.

Edit: It seems this version and the Leather Colonia are exactly the same fragrance. I haven't compared them side by side, but one really reminded me of the other, with strong impressions right from the opening.

From the start, there is a quite smoky oud that brings similarities to the house's Oud & Spice and really solidifies for me that, contrary to what I previously thought, Acqua di Parma is not just about fresher, naturalistic, and minimalist (or barber-shop) fragrances but also has some of the best dark and "niche" fragrances on the market.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I truly apreciate this one. Heavy, realistic, and elegant leather. Slightly sweet leathery raspberry rose/floral drydown (leather+rose+raspberry on my skin after 6-7h). It is very strong for the first 30 mins, then it becomes more “wearable” and less strong leather note. Masterpiece, dark, and elegant.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Truly a work of art, few fragrances hit me like this one.
Citrusy in the opening and then soften up into a woody and smoky scent.
Surely unique in its genre, like most of leather fragrances.
I won't rate it a 10 only because it's really challenging to wear.
Other than that ADP made the perfect "elegant and masculine" scent.
9/10

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Probably the best leather & spicy scent there is. For me, this beats TF Ombre Leather by far if you really like to smell like a masculine man in a leather jacket. Goes in the same direction as other ADP fragrances, dolce vita lifestyle in some Italian city, going on business dinners with this perfume.

Sample first before buying! Although as a young guy I like this scent very much I can't see myself wearing it before I turn 40, it is very mature and masculine. For me it is a 9.5/10 leather fragrance.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opens very charred-woody, through the dry-down it does mellow out to a more expected note of Leather, it does make me think of Penhaligons Halfeti Leather somewhat but ADP Leather is more intense, given the fragrances name that is what you'd expect.

I was saying it's probably gonna stand out to fragrance enthusiasts and those who dont conform to the mass-pleasing type fragrances.

Lasts well and stands out. Overall. 8/10.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very realistic and natural leather. Smooth and warm and luxurious.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Simply the best most authentic leather ever released in common mass markets. Period.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this a lot. Very dominant leather note juxtaposed against soft woody and floral notes. Kinda sweet too.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening felt challenging where every note seems to fight and scream against each other but the dry down is where the magic starts to happen. ADP Leather calms down and starts to exude a slightly sweet, Chinese herbal smelling leather. For me, this herbal quality can also be interpreted as medicinal and also smoky.

This perfume is actually more similar to Gucci Guilty Absolute / Kilian Dark Lord in its presentation compared to Tom Ford’s OM/TL. GGA/Dark Lord also has this herbal/medicine note, but they are less sweet and go for a smokier, dryer and even more herbal route. As a result, GGA/Dark Lord can smell flatter with less depth compared to ADP Leather which has more of a body due to the more balanced sweet + herbal.

Personally, I don’t correlate GGA, Dark Lord or ADP Leather to be a “leather” scent. I feel that TF Leathers are more leather-like to my nose.

Regardless, ADP Leather is a good alternative to GGA/Dark Lord with its more balanced profile. Make no mistake - this leather is still not mass pleasing but it is certainly less harsh and aggressive compared to GGA/Dark Lord. If you want mass pleasing, this perfume is not for you.

This perfume is good value as it can be found for good prices at discounters. It’s certainly an acquired taste which I think GGA/Dark Lord enjoyers can appreciate.

Longevity is similar, if not slightly behind GGA and Dark Lord. ADP leather is a long lasting fragrance. It feels like it sits close to your skin but actually the projection and silage performs well.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
***Blind Buy Review*
Well, after reading all these reviews, and ADP being my favourite brand, I had to blind buy this, it was on sale and felt like missing out on the deal would be a crime.

When i first sprayed this onto myself, i felt that its different, but i did not really liked it.
It is deeper then what I usually use in cold:
darker, more agressive, far from my safe (most of the time synthetic) sweet choices

This feels like taking a long walk somewhere on the countryside on an autumn or winter dawn, it’s dark outside and really frosty, the wind is feeezing cold, people are burning wood to keep themselves warm in their houses, you can smell it in the air.

You get home after your mind has been cleared on the “fresh air”.You became calmer and ice cold inside and out, the leather jacket which suits you so well wasnt warm enough for the occasion, you take it off and while you are trying to put it onto the hanger with your frozen hands.

You Catch a smell…….
Fumy and Rigid smelling shiny black leather, smells like you’ve made some hard choices in your head outside, it is okay, thats the reason why you feel sharper and more pleased with yourself, dont worry you deserved this already.

Unique and natural smelling leather at the same time.
Wear it for harder days, or for a special occasion, maybe when it is windy and cold outside.
10/10 scent with great Longevity and an okay sillage, which could be better but you would probably choke someone out.
I recommend it, but dont blind buy if you expect something uplifting.🙂

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Leather note is probably the most realistic leather note I've tried. with a great woody background. Top notes aren't very pronounced to me aside from a bit of citrus zest, so I mostly just get leather and a big of thyme, but it's great if you love leather.
Sad that it's discontinued, but some resellers still carry it, so if you want it, now's your time.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Awesome sweet leather

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: THE LEATHER...realistic, masculine, gasoline-ish in the best way possible :) Leather is one of my favorite notes only if its done right and ADP Leather is one of the tops for me...I dont get the ashtray vibes and I also don't get the rose note on my skin. What i get is a linear, animalic, sweet leather with a touch of citrus and raspberry...great performer too!

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a great fragrance, but I have trouble actually discerning the leather. Everyone says it’s an amazing, realistic leather fragrance, but on my skin, it’s so well blended in with the other notes that I struggle to discern an actual leather note. On the other end, however, I have no trouble sniffing out the rose, raspberry, petit grain, and citrus, as well as some of the thyme towards the back end, and that smack in the face of smoky Guaiac wood which prevails for the first couple hours. Because of how it sits on my skin, I only get about 5 hours of good projection, and it isn’t full bodied enough for it to be a go-to for winter in cold climates, but it’s great above 45*f and under 90*f for me, which makes it pretty versatile. Once you’re safely in the dry down and out of the smoke, I’d say this is office friendly and would definitely distinguish you from your colleagues. It’s mature, sophisticated, and yet still current - it exudes confidence and intellect and it’s just as good on a night out as it is at the mall, in the office, or on a drive through the mountains, so long as you don’t intend to go clubbing

On a side note, this is definitely not a sporty fragrance, I wouldn’t suggest you wear this to the gym, hiking, biking, or even golfing, this is definitely a more dressed up fragrance which requires a well dressed man for it to be at its best

For me, a 7.5-8/10

Edit: I got my flacon in 2021, so I’m not sure if my review is consistent with newer formulations

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very realistic leather. Almost too good. I get very little fruit or rose, mostly just intense smoky leather. Its closer to GGA than Tuscan, not as dry though. Slightly animalic but not off putting at all. Love it. Probably the best leather in my collection second only to Ombre. Performance is very good as well. At a $100 price point you can't go wrong with this.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
UPDATE. It's been reformulated now. Not sure on differences but this latest bottle seems to possibly have birch added to it? Not sure. So far I don't enjoy as much as the original formulation, so I'm returning this bottle and already ordered a 'vintage' version.

Old/Original formula code 08873/A, new one is 16197.

Batch code is 3132Y which comes out to 2022-11-09. So it's been reformulated since -at least- Nov 2022. Shame.

Figured I'd update.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I recently tried out the Leather Eau de Parfum by Acqua di Parma, and it's an absolute delight! I'm wearing it today with Verde by Ajmal, and they work together perfectly! The Leather smells of a luxe, smoky leather scent that is robust yet smooth - it complements the Verde's sweet, light fragrance wonderfully. It's not too strong either, so it doesn't overpower either scent, but rather enhances them both. I can't recommend this combination highly enough - it creates an unforgettable scent that lingers for hours!

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of the most realistic leather notes you will find out there. Do you like the smell of leather? This is for you. The floral and citrus are here on the background as well. I gave this one a thumbs up, but honestly it is not for me, it is well done and strong (projection and longevity are insane). For fans of leather fragrances I can't think of something better.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Leather Eau de Parfum (EDP) by Acqua di Parma is a leathery, floral and woody fragrance.

Unlike the opening of the Leather Cologne Concentree (CC) where the citrus shines and gives it an air of a classic leather cologne, in the EDP version we have a more intense opening in something that seemed to me like a chocolate truffle with one or several fruity notes and leathery tone, almost like shoe polish cream. As time goes by, the rose note increases and comes to the foreground, leaving the leathery aroma as its companion. After more than an hour, a wood base remains with a touch of animalic musk, while the rose and leather remain present.

Leather Eau de Parfum is elegant and formal, perfect for events or special situations and preferably for use between autumn and winter.

Its longevity was good for me, a little more than 8 hours, although the sillage was average.

There are some differences between the EDP and CC versions, mainly in the presence of citrus, which is almost absent in the black bottle version. They are both very good fragrances, but I think I like the Cologne version a little more because it is a little more versatile.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Even though I love Acqua Di Parma, I have to admit, this is so bad. Okay, picture this: You are a kid again and your grandpa is driving you and your buddies to the community pool in his torn-up, faded cigarette scent embedded into his King Ranch while you all are drenched and slipping around in spray-on sunscreen. That is it. That is all this scent is. For those of you who do not have an imagination, it smells like Tom Ford Tuscan Leather mixed with Neroli Portofino by Tom Ford as well. It's disgusting. Do not wear this unless you are a smoker and you want a scent that can sort of mask it naturally.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I used to love this fragrance, but over the years my bottle has become stronger and stronger and more intense. I just need to touch the aromatizer in order to smell all day long.
I love the scent, but my bottle is so strong I cant wear it if im not outside. I just took one spray before going to work and it was the first time i got pulled in to HR department and was told not to use parfume any more 🤣.
Have been using more fresh scents lately and no issue with the HR 😅

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is too good. Love at first sniff. Leather usually tends to become animalic on my skin and here it isnt the case, its smokey and raw and it reminds me of a brown leather. It becomes a tad bit fruity floral in the dry down still with that strong smokey leather, i also think the opening is just divine so good that leather and citrus, i just wished it lasted longer. Very elegant sophisticated and luxurious im definitely getting a full bottle.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's a pleasant, strong leather accord. At least on my skin, that is pretty much it though

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
30 minutes of P.U.
6 hours of brilliance.
I have several leather fragrances but the dry down on this is just divine. At first it is heavy leather and a little wet ashtray but waiting out the first 30 minutes brings a big reward.
Dry down is a masterful blend of leather with citrus and rose. The raspberry adds a perfect touch.
Definitely wear this before buying to experience the dry down.
I rate this as just above Dark Lord then Tuscan Leather then Ombré Leather. It’s just that good and at a much more reasonable price point.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely love this fragrance. It’s powerful - lasts forever - but not in an overpowering way. It has an animalistic tone that is really sexy. I own quite a few fragrances - but this one stands apart as one that makes a real connection with me on an almost emotional level.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have the original version in the brown bottle and it's probably my favourite scent.

When I noticed that the bottles had changed to black, I tried it to make sure it hadn't changed, but unfortunately this is not the Leather I'm used to...

The opening note honestly smells like fish. I've tried it in several different stores in 3 different countries to confirm that it wasn't just a bad batch. Nope. It smells like a fishmonger's leather apron.

Whatever ingredient they've changed, they need to reverse their decision as soon as possible. Once the fishy smell has faded, it does start smelling like the original fragrance - but I'm not sure why anyone would subject themselves to the initial smell.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Heaviest of the batch, oily, fruity faint floral flowing above some brown-ish ‘leather’ as a starter, not animalic at first. Quickly fades into the ‘Tucsan Leather’ category. A distinct flowery but bitter rose note is lingering for long to pull it back from getting a ‘powdery’ impression. Then you can tell there’s a strong core that’s yet fully exposed. Roses step down and only embraces the leather from afar, the lather note, here a thick dense raw leather is projecting even bigger and louder!
Some creamy woodiness lasts to the end.
Great quality, nothing new, in short: brown heavy leather with a floral rose touch till the sandal base.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic leather scent. Just what you would expect from ADP. It has that typical ADP Italian elegance you find in their other offerings like the oud fragrance. Had to spray it on skin to experience it though, so don't trust the tester strip in this instance. The leather accord is similar to that of la yuqawam, but the raspberry note is less prominent, making it less sweet. As the votes will tell you this is a manly frag, no unisex fragrance here (you do you ofc).The performance is good and the projection as well. Love this stuff.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Deep, dark, smoky, rich, dirty, slightly fruity in an overripe way, delicious, daring, wonderful leathery goodness. This is the fragrance Tuscan Leather wants to be when it grows up and gets some hair on its chest!

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
First time I smelled on a mouillette it was very weird. I put it in the car drawer and the day after it was smelling like burned leather. Then I tried on skin and it is totally different. What I pick up after the citrus opening it's a fantastic combo of rose and leather. After few hours it dries down on a creamy leather smoothed with cedar.
I don't find it very similar to TL.
Cold weather and yes, wearing it together with a black leather jacket makes you feel badass with style.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best leather fragrance in market. I had Eau de cologne Concentree when it was released and was sad when they have discontinued that version. EDP version is almost the same. If you like smoky and smooth leather scent you can blind buy this juice. Smells like expensive and luxurious Italian leather jacket.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just because fragrances have the same notes doesn't mean they smell similar or the same. This doesn't smell anything like Tuscan Leather.

This is a smokey dark rough leather fragrance that some might find hard to wear, especially with the opening. However, to me, this is a rich elegant fragrance.

In the opening, you will get a strong but classy smokey dark rough leather with a toned-down raspberry note that doesn't smell sweet or sugary. People that aren't used to rough or strong leather might think the opening smells a bit animalic, but I agree with people that say this smells like a well-conditioned leather seat in a classic sports car.

The scent stays a predominantly leather fragrance through its lifespan but it's tamed down as it develops. To me, you don't get a recognizable rose note but you get the feel of a rose petal. Giving this leather a silky feel, the same as feeling a silky rose pedal.

With the mid and base notes of honeysuckle and cedar along with lingering citrus top notes, this scent dries down to a tame semi-fresh woody leather.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is fire 🔥 I love this fragrance. If you haven't tried it, get a sample first. It lasts at least 6 hours and the leather and fruitiness lingers. This for me is, 10/10!

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I thought I was done with this brand after trying almost 10 fragrances which is my usual bar that sets if the brand is good enough to invest in
But here emerges one of the best made fragrances from this house that I rarely hear about
The statement I have about this scent is that it’s one of the best depictions of rugged dirty dark leather you could ever get your nose on
It’s not the best by a long shot but you can definitely align it with other greats such as Tuscan leather and ombre leather
This is what you call leather
I still can’t understand the old fragrances that supposedly are leather dominant and when you smell them all you get is orange or citrus (looking at you bel ami )
Performance is perfect if you have any appreciation for dark leather it’s a choice you shouldn’t ignore

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Leather EDP is a scent that definitely makes its presence felt! The leather announces itself immediately - a dry, dark, slightly dirty leather that crackles with an undercurrent of smoke. I definitely get some BBQ vibes in the vein of Patchouli 24 which gives it a savoury edge. Not quite animalic to my nose but a little rough round the edges, something that may take a while to get used to.

It starts to soften several minutes in as the layers begin to develop. We get a delicious fruitiness from the raspberry, tartness from the orange and lemon and a soft, floral patina from the rose and honeysuckle. Each of these elements adds colour to the leather experience, imbuing it with depth and richness. One gets hints of scents such as Russian Tea and Godolphin.

Leather is a scent that may initially overwhelm but ultimately charms one over with its tapestry of olfactory textures. Projection and sillage are moderate on me but longevity is decent, things eventually moving to an aromatic woody base. It leans fairly masculine and works best in cooler weather. A solid offering from the house.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I don’t understand how people are getting raspberry and citrus fruits from this. It’s just pure, dark, smoky old leather; and it’s vile.

It’s less intrusive on the dry down but still old and smoky. Not a scent I’ll be associating myself with any time soon.

I prefer Ombré Leather which has the primary cardamom scent with floral notes but the leather is evident. It’s more intriguing.

Edit; 3 days later. I DO get the orange and raspberry scents. The problem I was having was that I was sticking my nose in and smelling it. You need to let this sit and all of the other fragrances come out over time and as it weakens.

Quite nice actually. Still maybe a bit old fashioned for myself, but quite nice.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is divine. I love it as it changes a bad mood to a better one. It smells great and performs amazingly. I have Parfum de Marly's Godolphin, but I would not say that they smell alike.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Imagine the brown broken-in interior of a properly kept luxury car from the 80s polished with leather conditioner, warming under the sunshine and a touch of petitgrain and tart fruitiness entering through the window.

I much prefer this to both Tuscan and even Ombre Leather, because they feel very much like high fashion leather, jet black shiny leather. On the other hand, AdP Leather feels rounder, more complex, and has a certain depth to it, while still screaming ''leather''.
I find this one is best enjoyed when spraying conservatively, because too much of it has an overwhelming effect. Spraying once or twice max. allows the leather to kind of loom around you and reveals a lot of nuance in the mix, tart, spicy, woody, and herbal facets just kind of radiate through the dense leather and it comes off less jarring and aggressive. The leather also flickers between a smoky incense-y almost charred wood like effect which I personally enjoy.

This is one of the few fragrances from AdP that I thoroughly enjoy and this comes from someone who avoids leather fragrances in general. This one is undoubtedly top of the line for me.

p.s. This is pretty much identical to the brown Colonia Leather flanker. You could honestly just see which is cheaper online and just pick that up without any reservation.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Dry smoky leather...hints of raspberry and rose, but overwhelmingly smoky leather. I get the burnt smoke others mention, but I also feel it's pretty smooth, despite the hints of ash. I'm not a leather or dark frag person, so not for me and I'm probably not the best judge of what a leather frag lover would like. It's certainly not for those who are not into smoky leather, but I can see somebody enjoying this...maybe a Harley rider in black biker jacket with a marlboro hanging off his lips. It certainly captures the vibe of stern, Harley riding smoker, but in an upscale way.

Scent: 6.5 / Sillage: 8 / Longevity: 7 (8/8/2022)

UPDATE:
Revisiting my thoughts and it's pretty spot on...dry smoky leather. Hints of Fahrenheit gasoline notes. Still not exactly my style, but pretty great for classy, natural, leather lovers.
(11/30/2023)

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Stick your nose into a half full cigarette ashtray or smell last nights charcoal barbecue grill after a night of rain, that's what this smells like. Horrible. There's some sweet rose and citrus desperately trying to get out but they're smothered by this over riding smokey burnt charcoal smell. Why anyone would want to smell like an old ashtray is beyond me.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ashtray +Petitgrain + Woman's perfume + Leather

terrible on a man or a woman

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The only reason I voted on liked and not loved is its a very specific fragrance, that doesn't suit really anything I could think of. On me- I really love the opening, I smell burnt charcoal that was just poured over with water, leather, and raspberry. However, when it dries it becomes more feminine (to my nose, at least- I saw pretty much nobody agrees with that), which is something I don't like. And- I cant see myself liking this on my girlfriend, so there's that as well.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sampled this and all I got was the smell of an ashtray. I could detect hints of raspberry and orange in the opening that vaguely resemble the leather accord I'm used but after 5 minutes on my skin the smokiness comes in and it's ashtray for the rest of the fragrance life. It's a completely different type of leather from TF Ombre Leather.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: this perfume has high quality ingredients and smells nice, but it is not unique and once I sniffed it I immediately recalled an endless amount of perfumes I smelled or had before. It is linear all the way and boring, sorry ADP but it really is boring. ADP , stick to cologna and citrus stuff. please?

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a very warm, smokey, masculine leather. It is robust, linear - although potentially the hickory smoke dies back a little. There are spice and wood in there too. It lasts 6ish hours with good projection and cillage, 12 hrs as a skin scent, 24hrs as a clothes scent. "Linear" is an insult usually on perfume sites, but not to me.

I wear it any time of day, any time of year. It always works.

To me, TF Hombré Leather smells effete and floral next to this. I like the TF, but... It's got no balls. This has balls.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just a sweeter Tuscan Leather. Can pick up minute traces of rose but it's just that.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Keep coming to this again and again. It seems some fragrances stay somewhere deep in your memory. Same happen with some flavors coming to your tongue from the past. And the main parameter of those is their calm balance of every aspect in their existence. They became to be becamed.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: When I first sprayed this, I thought it was too smoky and that I wouldn't be able to handle it. After about 30 minutes the smoke calms down and you are left with a luxurious leather powerhouse. It still stays somewhat smokey but a sweetness and mild floral quality comes in on top of the leather. The longer it is on your skin, the more you just have an excellent leather smell. If you want to smell like a designer handbag boutique packed full of expensive leather, this is for you.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bought this recently giddy with excitement. On the opening it's nice it's OK. Dry down and it faded on me I can't smell a thing. What am I doing wrong ? I use a none scented shower gel and moisturiser if the brand I'm about to wear don't make any to match my smells and I own a lot !! Any tips to get this really singing would be appreciated. Presuming go hunting for a leather scented deodrant and moisturiser? Almost impossible I've looked and looked. Please help I want to love it but so far Tom ford tuscan leather smells stronger on me and that's just the all over body spray. I like my scent to introduce me not me.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: In the opening I get a very smoky and dark leather with citruses. Later the citruses fade away leaving the leather with berrylike juiciness. The leather smells very expensive. If Tuscan leather is a worn leather jacket on a smoking cocaine addict, this is an immaculate italian black leather bag. Unisex in my opinion, it has some femme fatale vibes.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Im very picky when it comes to leathers. This one I bought after sampling it. Its over powering in the summer but it cooler weather it rocks and very long lasting. I recommend.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Men's leather perfume doesn't smell like Aqua di parma leather edp. Men's leather perfume supposed to be fresh and clean. Farenheit and Aramis by Aramis drydown. Smoky leather is not a masculine at all

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I can understand why people love it.
I can understand why people hate it and i can understand why people find similarities with Tuscan leather.
When i first sprayed it i thought that it was a waste of money since it smelled almost identical to TL...and i felt it was a linear, overwhelming, new leather belt type of scent...tried it again 10 days later,a chilly night...it was absolutely amazing...a fragrance that puts the N to niche..a dry flowery leather scent that goes for hours but not overly loud or heavy projection...its strong but classy.
That being said, everyone has to understand that niche perfumery is about making a statement not so much about smelling overly pleasant and compliments are NOT the primary goal..if you want to get compliments all the time buy dior sauvage...

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Disgusting! I love the old leathers like knize 10 or bel ami, but i can’t stand the modern leathers. They all smell like burnt rubber or wet ashtray, this one especially. I had about 10 people smell my sample and not one of them liked it. I absolutely love the brand but adp should stick with their citrus fresh scents.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow great leather, something very good and rare a real Italian smoky leather.
One of the top leather ever for sure.
My top 3 leather fragrances are (not in order): ADP leather, Tuscan leather intense TF, C Clive Christian.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Spent more time with this. Opening is ROUGH. Barbecued leather and smoke to the 10th power. This will kill you in anything except low temperatures.
Drydown is nice Leather spice and still some smokey leather.

I am a HUGE ADP fan, but I prefer Tuscan Leather and Gucci Guilty Absolute.

4/10

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Genuine leather, reminds of the medieval history museum I used to go to as a child.

After testing some leather scents I found out they're not for me. Still this smells great! Stays very leathery for a long time, at dry down the raspberries and other notes come peeking out of the workshop. And my lord, this stuff is eternal, can still smell it faintly after two days and two showers?! Cra-zy.

Personified: a very manly and muscled blacksmith that also has a leather workshop. Has a tender side as well, after he's finished his leather work.

Bless/pass:
Pass for me, but if you're into leather scents and are confident enough to pull this of: lets fucking get itttttt

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I want this as i seem to be a sucker for leather scents. But i have a decent sized decant of Tuscan Leather as well as a bottle of Ombre Leather and PDM Godolphin.... So is this a must-have??
I think i answered my own question

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The typical Rose and Leather combo. You know, that fruity-ish and floral leather scent.
Great value for money if you compare this one to Tuscan Leather. They smell similar, just as good in terms of how natural they smell and gives off the same luxury leather smell.
Don't waste your money on Tuscan Leather. This is just as good.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Thus far I have limited myself to only reviewing fragrances I've used on my skin, as those are the fragrances I have the most familiar impressions of and can authentically comment on after having used them during different times of day, throughout different seasons, and sometimes across different climates. Today, I have broken this rule.

I came across Leather in my adventure of finding new fragrances for my partner. The notes and the description were pleasantly intriguing enough that this ended up being one out of three fragrances from Acqua Di Parma I decided to smell in-store. And oh how wrong I was, because today, I can finally say there is a fragrance I hate. This went straight to the base notes and was a horrible cacophony of strong hard leather and incense smoke.

In my country, the burning of joss paper (or incense paper, or to the Western world, "hell's banknotes") is a ritual in our ancestor worship. It is not uncommon to see people burning joss paper in metal cannisters on the streets - mostly in residential areas. I was walking back home with not a care in the world, when all of a sudden I started to smell Leather. I was alone on the escalator ascending a footbridge, and was obviously quite confused to be bombarded with this horrible smell. This was also through my K95 mask. As I started walking along the footbridge, in the distance I saw a man burning joss paper. And that is what Leather smells like to me.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: best leather fragrance in the market.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: You know when they say "Barnyard Oud" well this is a Barnyard Leather and it is so dense that I believe Tom Ford takes this then waters it down (a lot) and makes Tuscan Leather out of it, is that dense I'm not kidding. Bottomline Eau de Cologne suits me better but I'm sure a lot of people will find this one is a better choice for them and the longevity, projection, and sillage are HUGE.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just an FYI - SAME formula. This has not been reformulated as far as I can tell. The formula code remains the same from the brown box (that I've owned) to the black presentation (that I currently own). Formula code: 08873/A. Buy with confidence. :). Excellent stuff.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I get much more smoke in here vs tuscan leather, and less fruityness too.

The opening is full on smokey charcoal BBQ leather, but the drydown becomes more bearable. Honestly thought it was supposed to be a cleaner leather, and to some extent it is, but the supporting notes aren't what i'd call clean, and make for a challenging wear imo.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I only have a sample but I will get the full bottle. This smells very expensive. A sharp yet smooth sexy mysterious leather. I usually hate lemon but I’m here it works with the leather so much. It dries down with a sweetness mixed in that’s not sugary at all ..I think it’s a blend of raspberry and rose making that scent. The smokiness in here is very pleasant. This is 100% unisex

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP opens with a moderate to a strong projection of leather, woody, faint fruit, and floral accords. The opening is mature, intense, bold, but not harsh, elegant, and refined. The leather is by far the most noticeable note, a natural leather, polished, with a suede touch, elegant, not pungent or animalic, and without that combustible or gasoline vibe found in leader prominent fragrances. A step behind is the guaiac wood, a woody smoky, and leathery note. Several steps behind are the raspberry, orange, and honeysuckle, adding a very shy sweet fruit, and white floral accord. The rest of the notes are there to provide support but don’t have any significant participation. The fragrance is linear, all featured notes come up as soon as the fragrance is applied and continue into the dry down. One Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP has reached its full dry down, it can be summarized as a moderate to a strong projection, leather, and guaiac wood fragrance with faint fruity, floral and spicy accords. The fragrance feels bold, casual, dense, dry, elegant, exotic, expensive, formal, gentle, high-quality, leathery, masculine, mature, modern, natural, nicely-blended, polished, refined, warm, woody, and very pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2021 (#7109Y).
WOW RATING: 10/10. A very refined, and polished leather fragrance,
DISLIKE RATING: 3/10. The leather is a prominent note, not harsh or animalic, and with a suede touch.
UNIQUENESS: 6/10. Leather fragrances are relatively common.
MASS APPEAL: 8/10. This is a refined leather fragrance; however, in general, leather fragrances are not crowd-pleasers.
PROJECTION: 5/10. Good, about 5 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 5/10. Good, about 5 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 2 atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 8/10. Impressive, about 8 hours, it projects well for over 5 hours.
SEASONS: Winter, fall, colder days, daytime, nighttime, and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, business, casual, holidays, vacations, clubbing. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 7/10. A great and refined leather fragrance, ideal for formal and casual wear.
GENDER: Masculine, the leather, and woody accords lean it to the masculine side.
AGES: 25 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP can be purchased for about $75. It is a very polished, intense, but not harsh, leather fragrance that feels business-ready. This is a great buy.
BLIND-BUY: Yes, but only if you are familiar with its main notes.
SIMILAR: These are examples of fragrances in the same genre. Al Haramain Opulent Saffron EDP is a fantastic, sweet tonka, suede, almond, heliotrope, and amber fragrance; Carolina Herrera CH EDT Men is a great, mild, sweet, leather, suede, woody, and ozonic fragrance; Guerlain L’Homme Ideal EDP features leather, almond, bergamot, and vanilla fragrance; Mancera Gold Prestigium EDP is a superb, sweet, vanilla, orange blossom, leather, and oud fragrance; Paco Rabanne 1 Million EDT Men is a good, sweet ambery, leather, and spicy cinnamon fragrance; Tom Ford Ombre Leather is a fantastic, intense, leather, white floral, spicy, and ambery fragrance; Tom Ford Tuscan Leather EDP is a very good, intense, leather, fruity, and spicy fragrance; Valentino Uomo Intense EDP is a great, mild, leather, sweet tonka, vanilla, and powdery iris fragrance; Montale Aoud Leather EDP is a great, intense, leather, wood, and spicy saffron fragrance; Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP is a fantastic, intense, leather, guaiac wood, raspberry, and orange fragrance.
SUMMARY: A moderate to a strong projection, leather, and guaiac wood fragrance with mild fruity, floral and spicy accords. The fragrance feels bold, casual, dense, dry, elegant, exotic, expensive, formal, gentle, high-quality, leathery, masculine, mature, modern, natural, nicely-blended, polished, refined, warm, woody, and very pleasant.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Extremely strong leather, and lasts practically forever (even 1 spray is more than enough). Hard to love but very unique and stands out. Very much as "wear it for myself" vibe.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had to completely erase my first review cause this perfume actually delivers! The leather you'll find here is raw at the opening but it gets soften by the rose, sweet orange and cedar later on. My only complaint would be the cedar, it takes too much strength.

Its great to layer with other fragances due to its simplicity, but be advise, is not shy, it can actually overpower it. So far I've tried it with D&G the one edp and Versace Oud Noir. Brilliant layerings.

I'd strongly suggest to sample this one before buying.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is insane,
It's truly a beastmode parfume, and the scent is amazing, smoky leather, wood, raspberry and almost like there is a petroleum scent mixed in.
Super masculine.

If you like the old Farenheit from dior, i think you will like this aswell.

Remeber, this is strong, so less is more.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The brown bottle formula was WAY BETTER. they basically ruined this one!. i dont see why they changed it.
now it has kinda unpleasent quality about it.
if you had the brown bottle and thinking about buying the black new on, well dont!

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I dunno. Other than being a leather dominant fragrance, I’m not seeing the comparisons to tom Ford Tuscan leather.

Acqua di Parma Leather is beautifully intense - the Leather note almost comes across as a petroleum type smell - with the most subtle kick of sweetness and tangy-ness buried in the background.

I think Tuscan leather and acqua di Parma leather certainly compare when you consider the fact that they are both “harsh” leathers - but in terms of actual smell similarity...I just don’t see it.

I find this to be one of the more unique leathers I’ve come across - and its oddly satisfying. The opening is distractingly harsh - not a “that smells awful” type harsh - more of a “oh shit - maybe i should’ve spayed it once.”

Within 20 minutes or so, the smack in the face wears off - and you’re left with a pleasant, slightly citrusy leather. I would also clarify, that although rose is listed in the notes, it’s not prominent. Again, I would think of a heavy “petrol” type scent when trying to compare this to others. There was one by histoiries de Parfums called Petroleum that kind of reminds me of this. I sold it a long time ago...it was definitely more rugged and less refined than this - but same ballpark.

If you’re a fan of fairly rugged/masculine heavy leathers, I can see this being appealing. To me it’s a very nice Alternative to the standard “Tuscan leather” type scent. I’m a big fan

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Starts off bitter and green due to Parma's Italian DNA but soon becomes a more enjoyable Ombre Leather. Its drier, smokier, and carries an herbal element that is quite enjoyable. The dry down is all about Leather, smoked warm gaiac wood and hints of raspberry. I don't like Ombre Leather due to its powdery jasmine/sweet dry down, so this could be a great alternative.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
You know how they say "Barnyard Oud"
Well this is a Barnyard Leather

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Arrived yesterday. Heavy on the leather. Don't get much citrus or raspberry in this until the dry down. I became 'nose-blind' to this within about 15 minutes. Was still there the next morning as a skin scent. The dry-down is the best part for me. I much preferred this over TF TL. I have Ombre leather which is much sweeter than this. This is much more wearable than TL, which I find has a resemblance to methelated spirit or varnish. I like it, but I don't think I'll be using enough of it to buy another bottle. Got it at a 30% off deal.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just got this today and love it.It smells very similar to Rasasi La Yuqawam Homme,with that raspberry present in the Leather.This is a well blended fragrance for sure with very good performance.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smooky leather like you are in a Cowshed

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The name says it all: Leather. This smells like leather, pure and simple. Dry, dark, high quality leather. Very dry in fact. If you like leather scents, you will most likely enjoy this. Should be perfect for usage as a leather base in layering.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Tested in 2020 at the store. Femme fatale scent. Very rosy leather on my skin.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tried Colonia Leather first, and was immediately impressed by the blend of the sweet rose with the harsher leathery note. It offered something different to your TFTL, slightly more versatile, not so dark and animalic, but intriguing.

This Leather is darker and thicker, and the rose that added a playful contrast in Colonia Leather is far more distant, while the citrus takes higher precedent.

Overall I think they are both great scents but this Leather is too similar to TFTL. While the leather note itself is excellently represented, it lacks originality, and I think I'll be sticking with the earlier Colonia release.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Andy is correct, the difference is negligible if it even exists at all. The concentration remains the same at 80% alcohol listed, therefore, 20% perfume.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Personalmente preferisco la vecchia versione dove la pelle era molto più liscia e pulita.
Questa nuova versione si appoggia molto di più allo stile di TF tuscan leather, ma preferisco di gran lunga quest'ultimo.
Non è un cattivo profumo, ma prediligo sicuramente la vecchia versione per il momento.
7/10

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The EDP is more leathery and smoky at the begining than Colonia one but they both goes the same way after a while. I like it a lot and I agree that it's more leathery than Tuscan Leather.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Is this any different than the Colonia Leather? I tried it on a strip and it smelled the same to me. The leather accord, more like suede, feels a little synthetic but very elegant

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Unfortunately, I haven't tried the Colonia and can't compare those two.
I think the dry-down of the EDP is very similar to TF's Tuscan Leather (on my skin anyway). Where the AdP is slightly more leathery than TF.

I love that fragrance and will surely try the Colonia too.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This black bottle has much more tarry smoky dark smell whereas the I remember the brown leather bottle smelling more like luxury car new leather seats smell. Therefore the association of where each fragrance takes me is totally different.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Like for Oud and Ambra, this one is exactly identical to Colonia Leather, both in scent and performance. It's just a new packaging, no change in concentration, despite the new EDP label.

Smell is great, but because of the lack of creativity, I dislike this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Words can’t describe this. 9.5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just smelled like a musky bar of soap from your grandparents to me. The citrus and 'freshness' didn't come to play. Slightly spicy musky and not interesting, tried to remove it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm obsessed with this cologne. Sucks that it legit doesn't last AT ALL.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
THREE

I went on a mission this summer to try neroli-forward traditional colognes. I hoped to find something fresh that fits a casual T-shirt vibe for Westside LA. I grabbed 5 ml decants of Neroli Portofino, Mandarino di Amalfi, Colonia Essenza, and Colonia Pura and wore them throughout the heat. Pura ended up my favorite of the bunch. The twist is that the whole “neroli cologne” lane ended up reading formal to me. Pura is less formal, which leaves it in a tricky spot. When I want a dressy cologne, I would reach for Mandarino di Amalfi, and for truly casual, I would go outside the lane. I’m sure I’ll finish off the decant next summer, but won’t re-buy.

TL;DR: Easier-going Essenza energy with an ozonic, airy opening, then a smoother floral-citrus where orange shows more than expected, finishing in a clean woody-musk that sits close. Clean, modern, polite. Casual feel in a traditionally formal genre. It does evolve from opening to heart to drydown; not wildly, but enough to feel like a journey. Probably a good wardrobe piece for someone who likes this scent profile, less so for me.

Rating:

Opening: 3.1/5
Drydown: 2.8/5
Overall: 5.9/10

Opening
Early ozonic hit. Petitgrain pushes a clear soapiness on my skin, stronger than I prefer. I had hoped that skipping neroli would avoid that effect, but petitgrain plus white musks and airy florals creates the same “Cheap McDonalds Soap Dispenser” vibe (how my nose reads heavy neroli). It feels like a softer, friendlier Essenza that stays in the classic cologne mold, just airier. As the soapiness settles inside the first half hour, a gentle orange facet unexpectedly comes forward.

Heart
From about 60 to 120 minutes, it is an easier floral-citrus that is smooth and tidy, with a light herbal thread. The coriander note blends with the florals and reads greener than Essenza. It is pleasant and feels purposefully “traditional cologne” while clearly offering a unique take.

Drydown
By hour 5, you are in a clean woody-musk of cedar, soft patchouli, and white musks. It does not project much, but it has more presence than the airy opening suggests. Quietly masculine and easy to carry into evening. The core trace lingers to about 7 hours, mostly at skin level.

Performance on me
Polite, but strong for the genre. About 1.5 to 2 hours of aura, then close to skin. Roughly 5 to 7 hours total, with the last stretch as a subtle skin scent. I’d catch scents of it through the day if I applied it to my wrists if I was hand talking.

Versatility
High in theory and trickier in practice. The DNA says formal, but it wears casual on me. I would use it for a T-shirt-and-shorts creative meeting, although I still prefer other summer picks for that slot.

Use cases
Office days, client coffees, brunch where you want the first hug to smell clean. School events and travel days, anywhere conservative etiquette helps.

Vibe
White tee, good jeans, fresh haircut. It’s clean and modern, but not “too cool”. This is the well dressed guy who's wearing a white t-shirt tucked into jeans with a crew cut. He looks good, smells good, but doesn't have too much main character energy. The cooler dude with messy hair who may be stealing your girl is probably wearing Neroli Portofino.

Blind-buy safe?
No. I think this whole genre requires testing. Won’t perform well enough for some. Florals won’t land for others. Too mature for yet others. Give it a decant if you want a clean, modern feeling cologne that replaces some of the “Floral!” with ozone and aldehydes.

Comparisons
Colonia Essenza: Sharper, dressier, more neroli-forward snap and more obvious soapiness. Pura is softer and airier, a modernized take.
Tom Ford Neroli Portofino: Louder orange-blossom soap. Next to NP, Pura reads less soapy and more airy and orange-clean. Less floral, more white-musk and ozonic.
Tom Ford Mandarino di Amalfi: Juicier mandarin and grapefruit with *mint, basil, and thyme. More sparkly and aromatic in the heart; less overtly soapy than **Pura. Dries down to light citrus-aromatic over musks and woods, while Pura turns cleaner and more white-musk polished.
Dior Homme Cologne (2020): Brighter “iced-lemonade” citrus and better early projection. Pura trades fizz for tidiness.
Le Labo Bergamote 22: Greener, grapefruit-tinged bergamot with a diffusive *musky-woody* halo and a clearer vetiver and cedar second act. B22 radiates more, while Pura stays closer and cleaner. It still has a three-phase evolution, just subtler.

Conclusion

Colonia Pura threads the needle between classic Italian cologne polish and modern, low-key cleanliness. It was my favorite of the group, yet it is the least “me,” because it lives between dressy and casual. If you want that perfect just-showered aura without orange-blossom drama, this nails it. If you want sparkle, volume, or a signature flourish, reach for Bergamote 22, Dior Homme Cologne, or Mandarino di Amalfi. For hot days when you want to look put together without trying, Pura delivers exactly what it promises.

Context for review: Multiple wears from a 5 ml decant, warm weather, moisturized skin, mostly indoors with brief outdoor breaks.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wear this if you want to smell like your girlfriend.
Those floral notes are so overpowering that I can't even smell any citrus in the opening, maybe just a faint bergamot. I like the smell, but I prefer to smell it on a woman rather than on myself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A light barbershop scent with a hint of mandarin or orange. Doesn’t really make sense. Like a flat Tom Ford Mandarino, or a more intense Lacoste or 4711.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Dont know what the hate about this fragrance, pura open a bright citrus with some hint on sweetness good to refresh your mood then go drydown to citrusy vanilla vibes.regarding to longevity it last me morethan 12hrs specially if you spray it on cloth not that nuclear but you feel it and smell it all around you. The good thing about this fragrance was you are not smell the same with the other lad around but you trying to be different.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Reminds me of a more herbal MFK 724. Poor longevity. You get more longevity out of fragrances that cost much less. The first twenty minutes you’ll feel like an ozonic goddess, after that it’s hard to tell that Colonia Pura is even there. You won’t be reminded of it through sillage. It just… disappears. I assume it is best layered over a scented moisturizer and body oil. Otherwise it is just not worth it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wear this as a basic cologne... I bought it for my brother for christmas... the salesman at the Bloomingdales was a pro... and for some reason I felt the need to buy this....

Long story short, my brother didnt like it... so I kept it... Im trying to use it all cuz Its a little too expensive to gift to a random person... but smells too basic to give to a friend or family member.

So when I do decide to wear it and I want to smell like a basic clean man... I spray the hell out of it, cuz the bottle is so big... over 6oz of this shit I still need to go through...

Acqua di Parma has some amazing scents... this is not one of them... unless you are a white dude who enjoys a warm glass of milk before bed, then go for it... youll smell ok at the next family wedding you get invited to...

This scent aint winning you any physically attractive ladies.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smelling from a paper strip two hours after spraying: Sweet scent, reminds me of a coastal shop that sells summer scarfs, long dresses and straw hats.. I think ozonic and musk notes dominate and are presented in a sweet flowery way.
Quite corny when you think of it. It's OK.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens citrus aromatic, it quickly turns watery and musky, then something fruity like Chinotto di Liguria and musk.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received a sample from a mail-order service. While it's enjoyable, I won't repurchase it. I think it's within the unisex range, but the sweetness is high pitch, so someone taking a cautious first step toward sweet instead of rugged probably should start elsewhere. Like many freshies, Colonia Pura doesn't last. To its credit, it's not a repeat of everything. The fruity mixture moves beyond citrus, so it smells more like an oceanside farmer's market. Thus, the bright open is a bit green, ozonic, and marine. The brief later phases are floral, then ozonic again, and woodsy. In addition to being short, the journey is all over the place, if pleasant and evocative. There are two catches: First, this is sweeter than my favorites, so I wonder if I'd find it cloying after repeated wear. Second, the short jasmine stage was potent, so I'd only wear this when staying in instead of risking trouble for people with allergies. Still, if you're looking for something uplifting, brightly sweet, and slightly romantic that might surprise you, I'd give this a try.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Imagine relaxing in a Private Yatch with family and friends during summer, that was the image that came to mind when smelling this fragrance. To Describe in One word, this Scent is Rejuvenating. Opening with a Bright-sweet-juicy Begamotte-Orange note, accompanied by the ozonic notes which give " Light airy" quality that that gives it a subtle radiance touch, It dries down to this smooth Powdery Floral shower gel scent that further dies down to this woody musky base. In my humid and equitoral(burning hot) climate, Longevity i get 4-5 hrs, projection is Moderate for the first 1 hr, before drying down to somemore intimaite, though i still get wiffs of myself occasionaly around the 2-3hr mark. Extremly versetile spring summer morning scent, Overal 7.75/10.


Personal Thoughts: I recommend spraying this on clothes for better Lonngevity,

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
