review_content: Such a fresh and citrusy fragrance with some floral aspects to it, though not so floral that it leans feminine but also not too masculine in the dry down. Once fully dried down after some hours its a nice musky woody and yet still fresh with a hint of spiciness that still maintains well to the scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Went to a store a few days ago (galeries lafayette) and was surprised to see AdP and even more surprised to see that some of their perfumes were available for testing !

Short story, I've been trying to recreate an amateur homemade version of Colonia Pura for years now without pulling of something good. I have quite a few chemical and essential oils to do so. And by essential oils I mean real ones : bio ones from France and Italy. After years of searching, reading and learning the marketing of AdP about this one.

What a deception.
First : this is a two stages scent, citrus for 1 to 2 hours and then soap at skin scent range.
Second : fake, chemical citrus here. Not bergamote, not orange and definitly not petigrain. Having all of them (really good, pure essential oils quality), the opening of Colonia Pura is none of those. Just a disapointing generic chemical lemon, like candy lemon without the sugar.
Third : marketing bullblabla. There is no narcissus, jasmin (who I recognise immediatly for the real essential oil, very strong and amazing, and expenssive. So just Hedione ?), cedar (not atlas, not virginian, not others, so just Iso e super ?), and definitly not patchouli. I don't say they are not here, just you can't smell of feel them. Just soap.
Final : the dry down, after 1 or 2 hours of chemical lemon, just the soap is remaining. Good or bad it is up to you but on me, just a generic hotel lemon soap. The in between is ok you get the soap through the citrus fast but there is nothing else here. No ozone, no flowers. Soap. And after 4 to 6 hours it is turning bad on my skin, almost yuky.

Happy not to have blind bought this one !

Tldr, what a deception for a cologne at that price and marketed so fresh and with some naturals. Not good and definitly not natural, just lemon soap.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: ADP should be put in the category of those cheap fragrances because they are so bad in terms of longevity and projection and too expensive for their quality, we only pay for the brand name and the presentation of the box, and as for the smell, it's ok, just don't last longer than 10 minutes...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening of this is wonderful, the ozonic note really elevates the citrus, but sadly this pleasant phase lasts maybe 15 minutes. Then nuclear jasmine kicks in, overpowering everything else. Despite having very different body chemistry and preferences, both me and my partner experienced the middle notes as extremely unpleasant and a bit sickening. The jasmine is really persistent and long lasting, I had to wash it off and could still smell hints of it after. I didn't get to experience the drydown. People who have issues with jasmine turning bad on them should stay clear of this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love this scent. It’s summer. It’s classy. As always with ADP bottles it looks the part too.

Observations about longevity are not unfounded, it’s steady, you need to reapply before lunch and mid afternoon if you want to keep the thing alive, and it isn’t going to fill a room, but it will ooze classy and rich summer vibes to those within your sphere, and that’s ok with me. It will always be in my arsenal, I love it, and those in my life do too… and that’s all that matters. You could reach for this after the gym, at the poolside, on a summer night… it’s an all rounder. It would never be mistaken for generic in my view, it’s too classy and sophisticated for that, too expensive smelling, but it’ll never offend and never let you down…

In terms of the profile, it’s citrusy but has an undercurrent of earthiness and jasmine… it’s vibrant and playful in a way, but really elegant. Others have commented that it’s a chinos and yacht kind of vibe, and I whole heartedly agree with that, and who doesn’t want to smell like they’ve just egressed their yacht?!

Overall, a respectable 8/10, if it projected a little more it’d be a 9 or more, but the score is like the scent, decent, worthy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
#803 in my "Tour de Fragrance"

I will never understand why anyone spends more than $35 on a citrus freshie and this scent has not changed my mind. I tried every one of the Blu Mediterraneo line. Performance is always terrible for any citrus freshie but those set a new low. Absolute waste of money every one of them. Performed like an $8 Cuba Paris scent. Hell, the Nautica's, Chrome's, Ferrari's, even Adidas performed better. This scent far outperforms those AdP blues, but it's still just a "me too" among the hundreds of citrus freshies on the market.

Of the scents I've tried this reminds me of MFK's very disappointing and ridiculously overpriced Aqua Universalis Forte (when they have "water" in the name, believe them). You get nothing from this scent you won't get in a bottle of John Varvatos Artisan Blu, a $27 EDT. Projection-wise, by mid-morning coffee break no one will know you're wearing this, though it's a skin scent for 6-7 hours. It's certainly car pool, elevator and office safe, as is every citrus freshie since they're all too mild to offend anyone. But I don't see what you get with this scent that you don't get with a $35 bottle of Chrome Aqua, or a $23 bottle of Armaf Ventana Marine, other than the AdP rep, which based on the nine AdP scents I've tried to date I would to say is undeserved.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is ok
performance is week
if you want the same smell with a much better performance go for Mancera wave musk: almost identical with a much powerful longevity and sillage

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This stuff is divine. For what this fragrance does and how it makes you feel in a tropical climate you really cannot go wrong. I first smelled this at Epcot of all places in the Italy pavilion. If you are familiar with the park, then you would know that several of the countries feature fragrance brands from their respective countries of origin. At first sniff I was in love with this juice. It is not crazy complex but very sexy, alluring, and masculine although generally a unisex smell if that makes sense. The retail price is not terribly out of touch, but the price you can get this at on grey market retailers is insane! I got my 100ML for around $62 and I can't see how that could've been a better deal. This fragrance is very adult though in my opinion. I can't see a teen pulling this off. Im in my early 20s and I still feel a little out of place when I wear this sometimes. It's just so sophisticated and grown rich man smelling. This is like all of the best aspects of sunscreen fresh type fragrances but made a little more well rounded with different accords. As far as when to wear this, I would say anytime spring or summer. There's not really a casual vs. formal scent to this. More of a who are you as the person wearing this type of vibe. This is white linen, suede summer walks, and cream colored pants type of vibes to me. Longevity is great but projection is not. People will need to be close to smell this on you, but they will be able to smell you at least 6 hours after application. Fantastic performance for an Eau De Cologne concentration to me. If you can get this for sub $80 and are into what I described above I would say just grab it. You really can't go wrong with this juice. It might even get you a new love interest if that's what you're looking for ;).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura by Acqua di Parma is a cherished part of my fragrance collection, embodying both elegance and modern sophistication. From the moment I first encountered its vibrant opening, I was captivated. The blend of bergamot, lemon, and orange greets you like a warm embrace, instantly uplifting and refreshingly bright. It’s not your typical citrus scent; it carries a touch of regal freshness, reminiscent of stepping off a yacht into the sun-drenched Mediterranean.

What sets Colonia Pura apart is its seamless evolution. The heart of the fragrance reveals jasmine, dancing gracefully with narcissus and coriander. This floral bouquet adds a layer of complexity, transforming the initial citrus burst into something more refined and harmonious. The jasmine, in particular, stands out, lending a sophisticated charm without overpowering the composition.

As Colonia Pura settles, the base notes of patchouli, cedarwood, and musk come forward, grounding the fragrance with a warm, earthy elegance. This balance between brightness and depth is what makes Colonia Pura truly special. It’s a modern take on the classic Colonia, paying homage to its heritage while introducing a contemporary twist that feels both timeless and current.

In my experience, Colonia Pura is versatile, suitable for any occasion. It’s invigorating enough for daytime wear, yet sophisticated enough for an evening out. I appreciate how it adapts to different settings, always maintaining its elegant presence.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening is much more floral than the others in the line. The narcissus is quite defining, with jasmine providing a slightly powdery yet very fresh background. The aldehydes curiously give me an aquatic sensation, similar to the aquatic flowers in Eau D'Issey, especially the feminine one.

It's probably the furthest from the original Colonia and has the most modern tones. There's something metallic as well, reminiscent of the metallic-aquatic, fresh, and floral side of Hermès H24.

Over time, the white musk appears and reminds me a bit of the dry down of Dior Homme Cologne (one of my favorite scents). It is the most unisex in the line, leaning slightly towards the feminine, and like the entire line, it is delicious.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My impressions after going through a 2ml sample:

The opening smells like spraying Acqua di Sale once and lemon pledge twice in the air. It’s scary how close the cologne dries down like Acqua di Sale and its baby sister Fiore dell’Onda. About 70% there with less of a tangy seaweed note, replaced with a generic citrus scent you’d find on those hand wipes they give you at a fish restaurant.

Pleasant cologne overall. One could say it’s overpriced but considering the overall quality of the juice and lower proportion of aroma chemicals compared to its peers, it’s a well concocted fragrance. Inoffensive, leans feminine but you could totally rock this if you’re an extroverted, happy fellow.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh laundry hanging under a citrus tree, while someone is peeling an orange next to you. Nothing impressive, but No one around you are going to complain about this scent (unless they hate clean cloths and citrus...). Longevity and projection is pretty good on me. 2 sprays are blasting of my skin for 3 solid hours, until i got wet and dried of with a towel. After toweling off, it's 8-10 inches of the skin projection. Enough to leave an ok scent trail. Pretty good for a fragrance like this.

This is Very Italian perfumery. Soapy clean and refreshing, a hint of spice, and loads of citrus, florals, and woods. Perfect when you want to freshen up, dress down and relax, or dress up in style.

Personal score: 8/10. What's not to like? Citrusy, floral, and woody, is one of the oldest and most loved combinations of fragrance. This has a classic style and a classic scent. Exceptional versatility.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got it as a gift for bday.. surprisingly good longevity on my skin (didn’t expect it to last 7-8 hours). Smell is nice, got that Colonia DNA in it, mix of old fashioned and modern smell in a good way. Great for summer days in nature. Not for everyone’s nose imo

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I can't even work up a lengthy review of "Colonia Pura". I certainly don't despise this, and if it were from another house, I'd probably go to the "like" vs "ok" rating, but this is in no way what I expect from AdP. I can't say old fashioned on this, as I am a fan of old fashioned frags. This one just comes off as a bit dated and irrelevant.

My review is as effete and apathetic as the fragrance and I'm not going to get into my personal experience with this. The notes listed on this Fragrantica profile are 80% correct in their depiction save for waxy musk, wet rocks and the slightest tinge of fish.

This has some utility, but sorry, but this is 4/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the weaker AdP releases. A pretty straightforward soapy citrus-green scent. Gets pretty boring on the drydown.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Its nice but it's probably my least favorite from the Colonia line up that I've tried. Opening is an orange blast. Very nice quality citrus which unfortunately doesn't last. The ozonic and florals take over rather quickly. The ozonic notes overpower the citrus. It's ok but I'm not crazy about the ozonic notes. Goes alittle soapy which muddled everything to some extent. Something about how the ozonic motes mix with the florals isn't for me. There's also something slightly sour in here. Acqua di Parma does citrus aromatics like none other. This one unfortunately isn't for me. I much rather prefer Colonia Essenza and Intensa. It's fine but not great. I'll finish off my sample but probably won't get a full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve been wearing this for the last 3/4 years during spring & summer. I liked it because it got away from your typical citrus freshies. The more experience I have with this, the more it moves into one of my favorites.

Opens ozone, slight citrus, and w/the narcissus note (this is the main note on me throughout). Very light and airy. As it continues to dry down the musk note adds depth.

Longevity and projection are average…5/6 hours. I overspray to increase both.

I am never disappointed when I apply this. Certainly one of their best IMHO. Saying that, this is very different than ADP’s fragrances….I certainly would sample and wear for a day or two before going all in with full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The house is among my favorites for a reason. Cannot imagine a summer without one of their colognes. This particular one opens with orange citruses and quickly dries to a white floral scent. Next to it I identify an elegant coriander note that is similar to one I find in my beloved Kouros. The base is light woodsy and somewhat mineralic to my nose.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Original Colonia and Essenza are loves of mine. There's just something harsh about Pura that is cloying to my nose. Don't overspray this like the original or you'll choke yourself out.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Taking into consideration the countless perfumes I have tested, this particular one smells unbelievably amazing. It is a spring to summer scent with a musky along with citrus and rejuvenated flowers. The downside does not last long, around 5-6 hours of moderate projection. I suggest if it doable to find it on counters around 100 euros per 180ml, don’t hesitate to purchase it, would be a nice remarkable add on in your collection.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: When I first wore this fragrance, it reminded me of something else. I quite couldn’t put my finger on it. But as soon as I saw the perfumer, it then hit me: Dior Homme 2020. Pura is a bit more citrusy and less woody. These fragrances don’t smell exactly alike, but share a similar scent profile.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura by Acqua di Parma:
This is a very airy, aromatic and green fragrance centred around an almost powdery and somewhat chalky white floral note. It is by far the “airiest” frag I’ve come across and smells sweet yet clean at the same time. I’d say it’s unisex but leans slightly more masculine. Due to its very airy profile performance isn’t the best but it’s a very pleasant warm weather scent.

Top notes: Ozonic, bergamot, orange, petitgrain
Middle notes: Corriander, jasmine, narcissus
Base notes: Light musk and cedar

4/5

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
More of a chalky-musk rather than powder.. There is a calm & smooth citric sweetness here mixed w/ the musk that makes me think of Pez candy. I think it may be sweet patchouli creating the slightly strange scent.
@Discardedandroid said- ‘fun dip candy’. Yes the chalky simi-sweet white dipping stick!
As much as I absolutely hate Jasmine- the blending, harmony & softness of notes is extremely pleasing. Care-free vibe 🍃.
Spring time banger. Unisex. Casual.
Soft citrus, ozonic, dewy, soapy-sweet florals that doesn’t smell feminine.

Edit: 3/4/24
So I bought a 100ml.. this batch differs slightly from the sample I had.
It’s more green- specifically petitgrain smelling.. because of this, it isn’t as smooth & sweet. It’s more like a herbal citrus soap.
Hell I still absolutely love it though.
My ‘happy’ fragrance. Puts a big ol’ 😊 on my face every time I spray this

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A much fresher version of the original Colonia: "zingy bitter citrus with herbal aromatics, a touch of fresh spice, and a clean soapy undertone." Here the citruses no longer have that bitter tinge to them, a more prominent jasmine further brightens the scent profile, and the base is more of an ozonic musky experience without the soapiness. More modern and more unisex to me. Moderate projection fades over 3-4hr, longevity 8-10hr.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love it, bought a bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
ADP Colonia Pura
Clean gentle classic scent
My favorite from ADP
Fresh citrus clean soapy and floral
👌👌

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Probably the worst Acqua Di Parma I've tried so far. A big pass. 4/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is great. The rest? Not so. A headache-inducing, synthetic, ozonic mess. Test this before you buy it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I think I tried this once and couldn't get past the awful hamster cage/stale hay accord.
Perhaps it was another ADP variant though, it was a while ago but definitely one of the 'Colonia' line not the Blue Med line..

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: At first this almost gives me a “corn tortilla” type of smell that I did not really like. However, on my skin that actually did not stay long. After about 10 minutes it is a very beautiful fresh & clean scent. I will have to give this more wearings this summer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: mildly spicy take on the original. Subtle wood, jasmine and citrus. Floral, and musk, as stated. Pleasant. It's for daytime use, but I prefer it for humid summer evenings, and at bed time- I personally find it relaxing to spray some on. Maybe the light spices and wood make it a bit suitable for evenings, but I really don't know. This is far from an expert review

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's clean, crisp and refreshing. It's a go to summer fragrance for me. I bought it twice now and I'm happy with it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Really like this. I am a fan of the original Colonia and while this isn’t the same, it has a similar “vibe” but modernised.

Really clean and fresh, but not too soapy, a bit of musk but it stays more citrusy floral than musky on me.

I got pretty good longevity and performance from this as well for what it is. It doesn’t project massively, but that’s not what you buy this scent profile for. Longevity though - I was getting wafts a good 6-8 hours later, and can smell it faintly on clothes the next day after respraying around 4pm.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells much more citrusy to me than the original, unfortunately in drydown steers in another direction that Colonia which I don't really like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one is really synthetic once the citruses are gone.. Are all ADPs like these?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I swear acqua di parma is so goated, because I like this despite habitually hating ozonic fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
sugary lemon gum vibe..


Masterpiece!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's very lovely and there's not much to dislike despite it being very weak. On a warm day in a linen shirt it's really quite delightful. You can smell the naturals so clearly: Oranges and bergamot with a lovely subtle sweetness and air of sophistication. It's VERY Italian and conjures up images of walking through a sun dappled path in Amalfi with the sound of the sea in the distance and orange trees either side of me. I can hear the birds singing and the air is warm, yet fresh. I'm on my way to a terrace overlooking the coast to have an early afternoon aperitif and a light lunch with great company. Yes, the longevity is bad but it's a cologne and can be reapplied whenever you fancy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This unique scent takes strengths from Aqua Di Parma's Colonia and makes it fresher, floral, and smoother. This scent reminds me of playing tennis in the summer! It can be overwhelmingly fresh on clothing on first opening, but when you let it rest on your skin it is a marvelous scent that will offer lingering floral, citrus, and herbal notes. This scent will be good to you if you are patient with it :)

I most admire the use of Jasmine, Petitgrain, Orange/ Mandarin that make it sweet and floral

the Patchouli and Coriander offer good balance as well

Try this scent as part of your ADP collection, well worth it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Response to Let_it_be,

I know exactly what you mean about it having some resemblance to Obsession by CK. It’s that aromatic element but I can’t pinpoint what exactly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a nice classy scent, but it's nothing memorable. It's unoffensive and a bit of a bore.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A different take on your usual colognes that may not suit everyone. While I do love my usual cologne, I appreciate ones that take on a different route. This one opens with a blast of citruses, but it is mixed with strong ozonic notes and aldehydes. Soon after, Narcissus comes to play and adds a sweet floral note. The dry-down is mostly musk with some woody aspects and very faint patchouli.

For an EdC, the performance and sillage are so good. Overall, it is a really unique and interesting take on your typical cologne DNA. However, I recommend trying it before purchasing a full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don't think this is as good as the original colonia. There was something sweet or liquorice about it I didn't like

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An ozonic/narcissus flower variation on the OG Colonia ( kind of gave me memories of wearing Givenchy Insensee too ). Very nice...still think Essenza and OG are more my taste but I don't hate them for providing a new flanker. Well-done.
Edit: A reviewer below me compared this to Dior Homme Sport 2021 and yes it has that same steamed and starched white shirt sort of ozonic things going. Worked well in this 70 degree day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It took me a long time to remember what this fragrance reminded me of - Obsession for men!

They don't smell exactly alike, but they shared something similar. Btw I am talking about the original Obsession for men from many years ago, not the current one.

What's that sweet note in it that smells so good?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like dior homme sport 2021 specially the drydown IMHO. Great smell. Smells classy

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a problem with Acqua di Parma, like with most commercial fragrances apparently - but with Colonia Pura I finally understood what's wrong with AdP colonies: my skin is very acid and highlights all the "wrong" notes in every perfume I try. In this case, all the pleasant citrusy and flowery notes quickly disappear and all I'm left with is a very chemical, awful smell that could remind that of a cheap car fragrance.
I had to give up a LOT of fragrances for this reason, and this makes me really sad and frustrated (it happens with very expensive niche Parfums as well!).
Too bad :(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For me this more modern version of Colonia beats the original (and Essenza), a very pleasing iteration that I am very happy to wear and smell on others. It still feels traditional but fresher and less soapy in the dry-down than I find with the original.

Out of all the Aqua Di Parma fragrances I still favour some of the Blu range (particularly Mirto, Chinotto and Bergamotto) as they feel a bit more interesting but Pura offers an excellent classic fragrance. Well worth checking out.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The citrus in here gives off a sour smell off my skin. But I have had the same issue with light blue intense and in a lesser extent with versace pour homme. So if you have already experienced this, maybe you should expect that with colonia pura.
That being said, it is not a bad scent, it's okay even with this "sour" smell, because it is balanced with floral and aquatic notes. If this was mainly citrus, it would have been a problem for me, but it is not the case.

Edit : the sourness issue is fixed after about 20min, now I get a pretty interesting but easy to wear aquatic citrus along with the other notes.
Overall, it is a fresh and clean fragrance, but it is not at all generic, it still smells interesting enough for the fragrance aficionado.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the only aqua di parma fragrance I have tried and it has quickly become my go-to scent for the summer. Wonderful light citruses that can be worn casually but this also has a grown up element to it as well and would be great in the office too without being offensive to anyone. It can be enjoyed in the warm weather by anyone in their mid-20's and up! Very safe fragrance and decent value when purchased from a discounter too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is the most "modern" of the Colonia flankers i have tried (I have not smelled them all). It's very fresh, airy and floral and to my nose 100% unisex. It's always nice when fragrances try a new route and do things in an unexpected way. If I had blind smelled this the first time I tried it I would never have guessed it was a AdP Colonia flanker; there is nothing of the familiar DNA in Pura.

This is a very pleasant and fresh scent for the summer but it took a little while before I could put my finger on why I didn't like to wear it as much as the other Colonias. I then figured out that it's the jasmine that puts me off from wearing Pura. I prefer to smell jasmine on women, not on myself. Pura is to jasmine heavy for my taste. I asked a few female friends to try my sample and they enjoyed Pura a good deal. It's a nice and fresh fragrance for the warm weather, but just not for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Hmm, definitely the weirdest of the Colonia line I've tried yet. The added ozonic notes to the Colonia formula make me think a little bit of some kind of powdered candy from when I was a kid, maybe it was "Fun Dip"? Either way it's surprisingly sweet and the ozonic notes behave the same way violet does in that the fragrance becomes very smooth. It's an interesting twist on the original Colonia but for me the twist doesn't pay off. It's just okay.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The deliciously divisive commentary below is hilarious.

Back in 2008 I wore the original Colonia when it was just creeping back onto the radar, and, to echo @Leftofcenter below also felt like Cary Grant himself when I wore it. Despite not usually being a fan of citrusy fragrances, I've always loved ADP's sharp, lemony opening, but not how it evolved on my skin.

Last summer in Rome, I tried Essenza and nearly bought a bottle, but after trying it once more in my native Paris, found it incongruous. Today, I popped into the Paris boutique and spritzed Essenza on my left arm and Pura Colonia on my right and I have to say that Pura is the more intriguing of the two, at least here. The citrus quickly let the aldehydes and ozonic notes forth and they're fascinatingly blended with the musk, to feel both fresh and salty yet cosy and skin-like all at once.

I could see how this could be too adolescent on men, but on this woman it's a wonderfully different fresh summer scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Summer, Scent: 6,5/10 Opening is citrus, smells like lemon peel. Smells like Turkish kolonya. In the dry down however it gets a bit warmer, perhaps its the cedar. Silage: 3/10 Longevity: 2/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura was my first ever encounter with the Colonia line from Acqua Di Parma and while it was the first that I tried and fell for, it was Colonia Essenza that I first purchased (I'll review that later, it really does deserve a piece), Pura is fresh, cool and has a really unusual metalic/ozonic quality which to me, makes it a bit more interesting.

The opening is brisk, ozonic aldehydes fizz while bergamot, mixed with orange begin to emerge, it sort of reminds me a little bit of cloudy lemonade with ice. The thing is with Pura, the ozonic notes seem to stay throughout wear, the ozone/aldehydes give the florals; jasmine and narcissus, some real pop and along with a small touch of coriander, theres an injection of extra depth. The ozonic florals lace together in the base with white musk and cedar which wraps up the entire composition beautifully, giving a freshly laundered t-shirt/just out of the shower vibe.

The longevity is good for an EdC, I get 6 hours with a moderate silage. I honestly can see this working well on women as well as men, its perfectly unisex and I think if you're looking for a scent for someone that doesn't generally like wearing scents, this could be one to try. It'll work well for the office, casual wear and I really can't wait to try this one out at the beach too. Personally, I feel due to its light nature that Pura is better reserved for the summer months and I do think that while its well made, it could be a little bit more reasonably priced.
I would repurchase, and I'm glad I got a 100ml bottle since Mr Gin also seems to like this one as well.

Contrary to one reviewer, I am not "writing lies" and nor am I affiliated with Acqua Di Parma, I'm just writing out what I smell and what I feel, which we are all entitled to do here.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have the pura dopabarba lotion. It is mild to me, but my wife says it is very strong. She even said; "You smell like a retirement home".
After a shower, I use it as a softener on my beard. Nice for lounging---pretty darn fresh imo.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It smells nice, clean and smooth, but they put too much aldehyde. It gave me a headache.
Agreed with the comment below by thiagovidotto, felt the same way and it sucks.
Aura Maris by Lorenzo will be similar to this but different
I wish they reformulated and tone down the aldehyde.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Well, Colonia Pura is definitely a different take on the AdP barbershop genre. It both corrects some of the things I don't really like about Colonia, and introduces new oddities all its own. The word "Pura" might make you think this is a "back to basics" fragrance. Ha-ha, no, not at all. This is like a "virtual reality" fragrance. Interesting, but definitely not natural.

That soapiness in the original Colonia is replaced with a sort of robotic ozonic quality. It definitely smells clean, but less of a "just showered" clean and more of a "just got my car detailed" clean. There are floral components somewhere in the mix, but they are sort of mystery white floral "accords", as opposed to a more specific lavender scent in the original Colonia.

For me, this is a "like", not "love" fragrance. I think it smells really good, but also rather fake. It seems to tickle my throat and make me cough a bit. Not sure what component is doing that.

It's like the "auto-tune" version of Colonia. It can be fun, but I wouldn't want it every day, just as I wouldn't want auto-tune in every song. Acqua di Parma, feel free to use these synthetics as a tool for effect from time to time. But don't think you can replace the old ways entirely without anyone noticing.

Anyway, it's worth a look if you are into fresh, masculine, citrus, herbal (or robotic) fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have read that people compare this with the original colonia. This however doesn't smell like the original. However this is a modern fresh masterpiece. But if you have the original colonia of essenza (both oldschool) and you would like a new oldschool fragrace, do not get hope.

However as i said, the fragrance by it self is very good and uniqua

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The ozonic note is really offputting to me. I bought a 100ml bottle and enjoyed it at first, but it, unfortunately, became the only fragrance I own that I dislike.

The sweetness + the ozonic note is nausea-inducing. My fiancé also felt nauseous from the scent, which is crazy to me!

I actually thought I had bad juice, but I got it with the body wash and deodorant. Since these 3 products smell the same, I am assuming the juice is not bad.

It would be great if the ozonic note was not there...

Very sad. I will sell my bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the Acqua di Parma Colonia range but there are several different variances of it so it's confusing to know which is which. Each of them are subtly different from one another but all are very nice. One of them is my favourite but I haven't tested it in a store for 3 or 4 years and can't remember which one it is! Maybe this one. Next time I get to test the range I need to make a note of it! Anyway, the one I favour is almost as beloved by me and almost rivals the now, tragically, discontinued Tuscan Soul so at some point I'm going to get myself a bottle! The Colonia range is definitely suitable for men and women, although I'm sure some women may not find them 'sexy' enough for them to wear. I'm a Gemini though so I'm more than happy to wear unisex fragrances and 'different' fragrances and, thank god, don't have a preference for stenchy, nausea inducing stink bombs!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Another "meh" from the Colonia line. The original is a weak skin scent, this is a bit better but not much. Different smell profile, more orange zest I guess, a bit deeper, woodie (prob the cedar) but they are both so weak.. and for $125 USD for 100ml, no way.

This is as strong on my body after an hour as maybe some body-wash would be after just rinsing and getting out of the shower.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful and bright exit. Citrus and airy, bright, energizing and you already perceive that it is not the same as the other colonies in the house. A good modern but classic remake, adaptation of the master Demachy to the demands of a perhaps younger clientele.
I like it a lot because without forgetting its family DNA it is different and balanced, a magnificent fragrance for heat or temperate climates, but even in autumn it can give play.
On my skin it performs better than classic or intense, without forgetting that it is still an eau de cologne.

Bought on sale, 75 $ for 180ml, it's a good deal.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A great everyday wearer for warmer seasons. Very natural smelling if a little lacking in power but this is forgivable in a high quality citrus scent and the use of an atomiser can easily solve this issue.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@Eiland, Toothpaste? Damn, I wish my toothpaste smelt like this stuff. I don't understand that association at all but each to their own.

It quickly turns floral and slightly soapy which I personally really enjoy. Incredibly light and all but disappears after 3 hours on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opening is nice and fresh, but in about 5 minutes some herbally toothpaste smell kicks in and just smells like toothpaste. Yuck, don't know why you'd want to smell like that. There is a nice smell in the background, but the herb stuff overpowers it and it's not nice.

Would not recommend, unless you want to smell like toothpaste.

EDIT:
Ok, that toothpasty smell goes away in about 45 minutes, but then it smells almost the same as Colonia Essenza, but then a bit spicier. Hmm. Then it's just expensive hotel soap, which is nice, but not as a perfume!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I bought it today. I'm fascinated. Reminds me of MOSCHINO FRIENDS, which has not been on the market for more than 10 years. I like this exquisite Italian bitter orange.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very nice (there are better, though) citrus opening that is dragged down by a floral mid and soapy dry down. Too pricey as well. Pass.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I never bothered to try this for 2 reasons.
First, they don't carry it at any stores in my city and second, I heard it compared with Aqua di gio, which I have never liked.
I got a sample with another order and shortly afterwards, I bought a bottle.

Opening is fantastic. Bright realistic citruses and aldehydes. Drydown retains some citrus and adds some semi soapy creaminess with musk.. Excellent versatility. Not a great performer, but not as bad as I was expecting. Smells great on skin and clothes. I got about 4 hours sweating in brutal Texas heat.

This is also very cheap these days! I picked up 100ML tester for 40 dollars.
100% worth checking out; just know that you'll need to carry an atomizer.

Scent 9/10
Performance 7/10

Update: I wear this at least once a week and on clothing I get good longevity. I can smell it on my shirts when I'm doing the laundry. Fantastic job by ADP.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's so light and weak I feel like I'm spraying water on myself, it barely smells of anything.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: On my skin the opening is more zesty and bright than the original, but the drydown is soapier. Too soapy for me...but that opening is excellent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I work at a beach in summers and was looking after the ultimate scent to accompany me. After testing many designers and niche fragrances including creeds, MFKs, Chanels and etc, I found out that this was the best one. I bought it discounted for 100 usd for 180 ml! Great deal!
Considering the allegedly poor longevity of this one, I bought the biggest bottle and was surprised by the lasting power of it. It doesn't stay juicy and fresh as the opening during all of its lifetime, but it's beautiful semi-fresh, semi-floral dry down gives me whiffs even 10 hours after applying on cloths.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic opening is a fresh unisex citrus orange that last all of 5 minutes. Dry down is a floral/ musk that reminds me of grandma's clothes hamper. Hard pass.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's nice, if purchased from discounters. Nowhere near worth retail price. It's the best from all the AdP Colonias, but still, don't overpay, you won't be pleased with the value you're getting.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a really beautiful citrus fragrance. An easy going, inoffensive fragrance that is best worn in warmer weather but, the coolest I'd go is in the Spring time ( Which Is when I am wearing this for the first time myself )

This isn't a powerhouse or beast mode, and I don't think it's intended to be. It's again, enjoyable and pleasing & I'll add, a daytime fragrance.

*Edit* 1 day later * Beginning to love this fragrance. It goes a few hours strong then goes into a skin scent but, damn is it good while it's there.

*Edit 2 Aug 19 2022*
This is definitely for the summer and definitely for hotter weather. While I mentioned that it turns to a skin scent, it doesn't after all when you get warm enough, this fragrance kicks right back in.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wasn’t very attracted to this scent
The floral aspect in it just ruins the experience
I prefer the original colonia over this flanker
After 1 to 2 hours it just disappears

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: For hot, sunny goes at adult life, Colonia Pura is tough to beat. It doesn't smell juicy or even squishy at all to me, it smells dry and firm, unripened, but so beautiful that Colonia Pura would be worthy of buying a nice even number like 4 and leaving them on the sunny part of the counter for a few days to get into later even though they still don't seem ripe, but this Airbnb is only here a few more days and you wouldn't want to get the car all sticky in case the Colonia Puras surprised you with ripeness the second you remove them from the air conditioned accomodation. Whatever, just bite one. It's not ripe enough. Whatever, just get in there and eat it. Then you eat all 4, you remember what that much citric acid does to your esophageal tract but don't feel guilt because you're radiating citrus, granting those nearby +2 antioxidation. Colonia Pura smells like that, mixed with an authoritativeness one might not be able to back up. On me, it smells like I'm the disappointment. I smell like I should be much better-looking and evenly-complected with shorter, tighter sleeves.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Compared to the original cologne this feels cleaner, brighter, smoother and gentler. Its soapiness is different due to the presence of coriander and petitgrain, the aldehydes offer an uplifting airiness that feels very bright and expansive. Fans of the house will likely come to this at some point and of course it will all come down to personal tastes. At the moment I am writing this review I can't stand galbanum, so I'll probably never touch Colonia Club for instance. I really like Pura, I think it's a perfectly approachable, clean summer scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Remind me of Acqua di Gio Essenza Giorgio Armani which I still have.
If you like Acqua di Gio Essenza Giorgio Armani then you will like this one too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens with a natural blast of bergamot and quickly fades into light floral scent. It's definitely a unisex leaning towards feminine side. On my skin, it turns into a skin scent after an hour.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This was my first Acqua Di Parma. I gave it away in the family after I discovered Essenza, the classic Colonia and Intensa. I have however order it again because it is great: a twist to the original formula with more floral making it very pleasant and unisex. Not soapy (like Colonia or to some Essenza) but still retains the classic DNA.

Niche quality fragrance that if you look around is available also at good prices (even major outlets run discounts, I wouldn't trust Ebay or alike).

It is one of the best of the line and the Narcissus flower is just beautiful. If you are looking for something more masculine then Essenza or Intensa would be the best ones but as a man I still enjoy switching to this one from time to time. It has some summer vibes but is a year-around fragrance. It is re-becoming one of my favourites from the line.

10/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: There is something very odd in this fragrance. Probably the sweet aldehyde vibe. Not pleasant at all to my nose. I love the house of Acqua Di Parma in general but to me this scent is mediocre to say the least. 4/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: LOVE IT! One of my absolute favorites, the only slight complaint is that longevity could be a bit longer. This with the longevity of Essenza would be a home run.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Its like Prada Amber Pour Homme made Italian Style. The entire fragrance is elegant fresh soapiness. You really won't offend anyone with this one unless they dislike aldehydes. Overall it just smells like classy expensive soap, Prada would be jealous.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@ Quim

It's definitely the aldehyde note.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’ve always loved fresh scents and I had high expectations for this one. Looking at the notes and the perfumer, I would expect to love this fragrance; however, there’s something very off-putting about this when I spray it. I’m not sure if this terrible smell is an interaction of the ozonic notes and the florals or if it’s something else, but I scrubbed this off my skin within minutes both times I wore it. This is a strong dislike for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A basic, easy-to-wear citrusy cologne for the summer. Despite the aldehydes, which I dislike, this one is relatively tolerable and quite pleasing. Sillage is low, but longevity is high. Although it smells so simple, it preserves an elegant vibe. The sweetened musk makes it unisex-leaning, despite the fact it's labelled (for men) on the official Acqua di Parma website.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Colonia Pura by Acqua di Parma smells classy and refined! Clean shaven, white collar button down shirts, expensive wrist watch, and drives a cool sports car – you know the guy I am talking about, right? This is not another linear citrus cologne scent that has been done 100 times, Colonia Pura really is in a league of its own. A cold, crisp breeze blows through the citrus trees with a whisper-sweet jasmine and a gentle musk warmed up with a cedar/coriander blend. The sparkling citrus top notes remain though out the life of this fragrances but a hint of the patchouli sneaks into the dry down with a woody/floral undertone. I love this fragrance, it is extremely well done and I recommend it to all my gentleman friends!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Vacations and sea vibes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The only one that can follow the original Colonia.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A new addition for me, having previously loved the original Acqua di Parma.

I love this, the citrus tones, the bergamot all appeal to my nose.

It must really suit my skin because the longevity on me is fantastic - 12 hours at least.

Another definite favourite.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Niceish but also quite generic and not super original.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh, bright, positive, citrus, orange, lemon, professional, masculine.
Reminds me of the positive vibe of laying by a swimming pool with a Sprite on a bright sunny afternoon. Disappointed that longevity may be about 3 hours based on small sample bottle. Can smell with most inhales at first, then dies down quickly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: disappointed by the designer vibe of the smell, it´s not interesting smell unfortunately

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Five words:
A day at the beach.

That's what this fragrance embodies. It smells like a mild suntan lotion with a citrus zest;
the smell of the ocean lingering on the horizon.

Almost like a day's temperature at the beach, when this fragrance stays mild it is truly wonderful stuff. However, as the hours pass the scent intensifies and it becomes a little too much, bordering on annoying.

In my opinion, this isn't a blind buy. This is the definition of a unisex fragrance. Once the citrus notes fade away and the floral notes come to the forefront, the scent becomes quite feminine. Definitely try it out first to see if the beach life suits you.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The first time I smelled Colonia Pura I didnt like it much and, probably because I focused on its metallic dimension, I found it quite artificial. However I decided to finish my decant wearing it throughout this past week and I have to say that I have change my mind completely. Obviously the 'metal' feeling was still there but I ended founding it quite comfortable and appealing.

The smell is dominated by aldehydes and floral notes which makes it quite unisex, the citrus notes are nothing like obvious and coriander and patchouli are definitely there though measured out perfectly. The whole is bright and transparent, appropriately named Colonia Pura, and has a surprising tenacity, staying almost the whole day with you.

Disclaimer: personally I dont like colognes with so much longevity, 5-6 hours is enough for me, if I am comfortable with the scent I prefer re-aply it, too much longevity may be sometimes a bit tiresome and this is happening to me with Colonia Pura.

Still, BRAVO Acqua di Parma for offering timeless classics with interesting modern approaches.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is definitely unisex. As a woman, I love this scent for the summer. The orange-bergamot opening is so refreshing (perhaps a bit bitter-but I like it) in warm weather. It’s a light scent, and the projection is light; I don’t think it could cut through cold air well enough to make it a viable winter scent. I’m not sure this would be a standout for me, if I was a man. It does hold some of the generic characteristics of a men’s citrus cologne. However, it is special as a woman because our summer fragrances rarely have this cedar-woody/musky dry down. The patchouli doesn’t really show up for me, which I prefer.

For a man, perhaps good, but not great.

For a woman, a perfect summer scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I may be wrong, but are all of these reviews by men? Well this woman loves it and isn't getting any overtly masculine notes from it at all. It's fresh and elegant; daffodils and jasmine, with a hint of ozonic melon. The creaminess that others mention is definitely there, too. Just a truly wearable, uplifting fragrance that pulls off the trick of being both airy and persistent; one that's not so easily done. More women should give it a go.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Magnificent citrus opening. Dries down to smell like paper. Love it to start with, but ultimately disappoints. Like my relationships. But I will return, just like a moth to a flame.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Great freshie that works for all ages in my opinion. Recieved it as a gift from my girlfriend about 1,5 years ago, been in loved since then. You won't smell like everyone else, and the lasting power is actually quite good on my skin, I get at least 6 hours (even longer if sprayed on clothes ofc) out of it with moderate projection. Really good for being an EDC.

Safe blind buy if you ask me as it will gather you many compliments!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 7/10

Quality: 8/10

Originality: 5/10

Sillage: 6/10

Projection: 6/10

Longevity: 6/10

Price VS Size: 7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura is an aromatic fougere. The opening is lush with aldehydes, brazen on the classic Colonia DNA of barbershop botanicals and musk. An Old World aroma—with its legendary complexity that's so easy to get lost in.

Neroli, orange flower, lavender, and vetiver—laced atop a deep, heady musk which begets the flagbearer of masculinity. Classically this was done so alongside an accord of citruses—which seem entirely missing in this formula.

Odd that the Colonia fragrance is so renowned amongst men, as I personally always had the creeping feeling that the botanical aspects were a bit uncomfortably feminine, and the citrus and musk just attempts to cover this up.

The addition of aldehydes here certainly doesn't do anything constructive for this. It blends with the floral aspects to give the fragrance an immensely greater feminine aura. The musk however is still very prevalent (and anything but feminine), so this is still not something that I could recommend for women.

Something intriguing—I noticed that the aldehydes seem to get quickly cannibalized, and don't retain their standing very long in the formula. In a fresh bottle their presence is almost overbearing throughout, but in just a little time, it's hard to detect them outside of the opening. There's only a noticeable glaze atop the oversoul of the fragrance.

Not sure what difference that makes for the orientation, but I guess that would make this a very high-maintenance fragrance to keep for whoever it might appeal to.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have been debating purchasing a decant of this for a long time. Acqua di Parma is my favorite house, but the reviews below made me hesitant. When I finally pulled the trigger and smelled it for the first time, I was surprised. This is unlike any other Colonia flanker. First, this feels like the first Colonia targeting a younger crowd. I can see anyone between 18 and 30 pulling this off really well. Of course, anyone older than that can also wear it. Secondly, this is their most mainstream, "designer-like" Colonia to date. Thirdly, this somehow retains the Colonia DNA. I can smell the trademark AdP citruses in this that connect it to Essenza and the OG.

It is very pleasant to wear and I think I would love wearing this in the summer heat. It's simple and elegant. Unfortunately, I already have a fragrance, Dior Homme Cologne, in this exact category of fragrances and which accomplishes the same thing. Imo, owning both would be entirely redundant, even though they don't smell the same.

If you are looking for a signature scent for the hot summer months, I highly recommend considering a citrus/musk combination. Compare AdP Colonia Pura and Dior Homme Cologne and see what you think. They're both fantastic.

EDIT: just realized that Francois Demachy is the nose of both AdP Pura and DH Cologne. Go figure.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Jareth,

You should try Colonia Intensa.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Has none of the enjoyable aspects of any of my favourite other ADP Colonia fragrances (original, Essenza, Assoluta). A nice smell. But only nice. It's very well-balanced but doesn't have a focal point. Maybe that's the point?! It reminds me of the drydown of a cheapie acquatic (but better balanced). Possibly only wearable by the water, or if you don't really want to smell of anything. Nonetheless, a definite pass for me as I like fragrances to smell of something.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Airy and fresh. Not overly citrusy or floral like most fresh scents tend to be. No, it goes into it's own direction in this fresh genre with the coriander. I believe it's the coriander that gives this a slight liquorice-smell to it. Quite a unique touch to the fresh genre.
It's an easy wear at designer cost, what's not to like?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the only colonia I have sampled. I get a weak jasmine covered by a sort of metallic ozonic and herbally layer. Almost like a strange fresh sunscreen vibe. This would be something I'd wear when I can't wear perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is nice, but I like Colonia Oud and Colonia Querica a lot more.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is what I had hoped Bvlgari's Aqva Amara or Cartier's Roadster Sport would smell like. It's an orange-driven fragrance with an aquatic, aqueous sort of sheen and a cooling herbal edge which I interpret as mint despite the fact that it's not one of the officially listed notes in the pyramid. There are some light floral qualities and that clean, bitter-soapy citrus embellishment of the petit grain, giving it a slightly formal, "white button down," impression, reminiscent of more classic eau de colognes . But overall, Pura is an easy wear, and something that can be thrown on casually or feel right at home in a more dressy situation. In fact, it seems like something that would be great to wear to a summer wedding, when the the thought of dutifully sweating it out in a tux keeps you from reaching for those heavier, darker fragrances. Performance is solid, with about 5-7 hours of longevity with good projection for 3. What I enjoy about Pura is its focus on orange, which is a nice departure from the more common citrus notes--it conveys the mandarin with a confident, unapologetic presence and in turn gives it distinction. Paired with a cool, green, herbal quality resembling mint, we're left with a fragrance that is both refreshing and relaxing to wear. Thumbs up and worth sampling. For now my rating stands at 8.5/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fresh citrus is covered by a slightly sweet herbal / minty veil. It is gorgeous and very elegant.
But on my skin it has no lasting power at all. After 20-30 minutes it is a skin scent and after 2 hours it‘s gone... What a pitty.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I keep a mini sample in my bag. It's nothing special. I won't buy a bottle.
Clean, fresh, safe, versatile, and contemporary. Citrus, aqua, flora, wood, and soap. Sort of a pop-pop bubbly/fizz/soda thing, but that's subtle. I get about an hour out of this scent. Seems to be hit-or-miss with the crowd.

Description on the sample card:
A radically fresh fragrance, delicate and bold, which embodies the most modern side of Italian lifestyle. The spicy notes of coriander are combined with the classic citrus notes of cologne. In the heart, sambac jasmine and petit-grain meet with the facets of Narciso Absolute. In the base, hints of musk and patchouli characterise the depth of the composition.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nowadays it’s hard to find a stand out citric fresh and elegant scent, well here it is.

But oh man what a fresh and distinct scent , it smells awesome for a summer scent. Slighlty Generic, but done very well. Every one that smells it on me loves it. Even my brother bought him a bottle after the intoxicating super fresh whiff. Most people bashed this one in the reviews. I like this one better than the original and I get more response from people. It’s worth trying or buying

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very ethereal, light, fresh. Slightly sweet. Love the scent but doesn't last. Scent: 8, Performance: 5, Overall: 7

Update: Enjoy the scent, but need to be in the mood for a soft, floral, slightly feminine vibe. Might be better for women.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Assoluta, Pura, Essenza.... Nope! A desperate attempt to capture the maximum value, by putting countless flankers on the market.

If I want colonia, I'll get AdP Colonia (the original). If I want a freshie, aquatic, floral, I'll go to other houses who do it better.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Perfect for Miami. It makes my fat Italian butt feel special. I picture a well groomed fit gentleman sitting in Venice at a cafe' sipping coffee in a suit. He jumps into his Ferrari with the top down, and a beautiful female model jumps in. I'm more of the fat Italian guy sitting there eating pizza wishing I was that guy.The only way I can "go there" is by wearing this cologne. This is a modern light take on the classic. check out my video review of ADP Pura here on youtube.
youtu.be/gGQbgm1kBTo
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tried this on my skin today. It is a clean and mellow scent that overall gives the impression of a pleasant soapy note. I think it's jasmine and petitgrain on a soft base of musk that creates this vibe. It is a nice scent but I feel like I smelled this theme before (e.g. vaguely reminds me of some of the Prada scents).

The longevity and projection are OK. I enjoy the smell but believe that there are better products at this price range out there.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm going to start by saying that I do like this fragrance, although there's nothing revolutionary in it.

It may not smell niche, it may not be unique, I totally agree on that. However, I feel that it's been formulated in an interesting way, as it kind of smells metrosexual to me. I can definitely see it being used by a lady as well, but it's got that feminine note that actually works on a man too. A modern re-formulation of the original Colonia, just like some say.

Love the citrusy/floral notes, of which I'm generally a big fan. It's a spring/summer fragrance only, I would say. Very fresh and clean.

To me, it smells a little spicy on the opening, but it gets very pleasing on the dry down.

8/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Strange this creation.Initially you can smell citrus but something does not square to take over from jasmine and narcissus. Coriandolo and Petitgrain are almost non-existent (in my nose). Acqua di Parma has done better, this fragrance in comparison seems to evoke only a cup of chamomile. NOT FOR ME!
P.s: I also feel the rose

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Different and unusual, also sparkling fresh!

I like this cause is very original scent.
Yes, its fresh but not your regular freshies, this has some depth in the heart and base, from the narcisus.
Definitely you can sense this flower and gives some artificial, unnatural, unusual smell, but very interesting.
Longevity is long lasting and silage is moderate.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nicely done, a Fresh Ozone Pungent scent. I don't get the bad reviews. Yeh its different from the usual ADP fresh, but good. Sometimes you have to branch out and see how the crowd reacts. Its a head turner if that helps.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On my fifth day of Acqua di Parma sampling I tried Colonia Pura. I sprayed it on and immediatly I could tell it was different. There is a strong citrus smell I would expect from a Colonia. Then there was a smell I just could not name. I guess that is the ozonic smell. It kind of makes me think new car. It's not unpleasant but, not really good either. I has a very syntheic almost plasticy kind of hint to it. I'll give it another sample sometime but, this really is the only Acqua di Parma I would recommend avoiding.

I wore it again and its still blah. No thanks.

Update.

Trying it a year later it is not bad. Most of what I said still stands, but I'm a enjoying it more now.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
While sampling Byredos the lady at Neiman Marcus was quick to give me a sample of this new release. I wonder what the commission is? Aldehydes and the Acqua Di Parma citrus; a little musk. I get a hint of white florals, a slight soapy vibe and a metallic touch. Pura smells like a modern take on the classic Acqua di Parma concept

Average projection and sillage; lasted about seven hours before becoming soft. Just fine for work and not really sexy. I'd say it's unisex leaning masculine and for hotter weather. This isn't horrible but it smells like too many designer scents out there; not very creative. The aldehydes are almost headache inducing for me. The quality is decent but I know you could find a similar smelling scent for much cheaper. I want my Acqua di Parmas to smell like they're from the early 20th century not the 21st. This is a pass for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Review of EDC:
As a long time fan of ADP and having sampled practically their entire range over the years (including soaps, shaving foam, shower gels etc.) my initial emotions after trying this were disappointment, followed by sadness and then something bordering on anger.This is a lovely scent, it just doesn't last!
I mean that sincerely, the longevity is very poor and when you consider the price of this, it's actually outrageously awful.
I'd place the original Colonia is my top 10 fragrances, even though I wear it less and less these days, it's still a scent I hold close to my heart and so I was of course, attracted to this new offering and intrigued to try it out.
I remember the days when nobody in my circle had heard of of ADP and I felt like Cary Grant himself when I wore it. Slowly but surely, the range increased and then the rate of productions progressed to the point whereby I can barely keep up (or even care to). What was once an indulgent and gratifying online purchase (i'm in UK not Italy) only to be found on the unobtainable shelves of Harrods and Selfridges suddenly became omnipresent in stores such as John Lewis, overnight ADP was a mainstream scent. So what? Now it was easier to obtain and once i'd overcome my snobbery, I could only see the positives.
Sadly, the quality and innovation seemed to drop off as I made my way through the new issues from this house. I could forgive the Blu Mediterranean range as some of them smelled nice (Mandorlo Di Sicilia for one) but they kind of left me unimpressed with their variations and longevity.Then came Oud, Leather and others in the brown bottle which i cannot recall now and they made me question the price to quality ratio for the first time. The only ADP i've found to have substantial longevity / projection are Colonia (original) Intensa, Essenza, Quercia and perhaps Assoluta, although I never gave that much of a run as i found it too feminine for my tastes and sold it on pretty quickly.
As much as I love this house, I have to admit that I don't hold it in as high regard as I once did.
I sampled Colonia Pura and Quercia at the same time and although I liked both, I loved Quercia and so plumped for that one. Rightly so I feel, as that one at least gets through a day and it a much more complex scent.Still, I couldn't resist the shower gel of Pura when I saw it at a decent price, the writing was already on the wall and I was forced to confront my denial. The shower gels have never been anything but a brief and expensive indulgence, they don't really carry any scent once out of the shower, but at least I know to expect that. Considering the retail price of Pura, i'd expected more and would never plump for a full bottle, despite the fact I like it, simply for the fact that it's not superior to the original Colonia in any way and is one of the worst performing scents from the entire range. The reviews below claiming 9 hours longevity are laughable and extremely suspect. I'm about as far from an ADP hater as could possibly be (I even considered their bathrobe at one point!) but sometimes you just have to say it like it is and put aside personal bias.This is weak..pleasant, but oh so weak.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This Fragrance is very different from the other Colonia variances. It is not as powerful and explicit as the others and more just a fresh summer cologne. That is why it probably will dissatisfy a lot of ADP users.

It is likely yo fade out completely in colder temperatures. The creation itself is very nice and on warm days I can wear this very well to the office. Happy with it, nice scent!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
With each new release, Acqua di Parma is committed to producing products of lower quality each time. With the classic Cologne reformulated and a lot of pitiful launches (for me, Essenza was already pretty bad), now this? Was it really necessary?

This looks more like an Invictus fresh flanker than an AdP. Loose, synthetic, insipid. With a performance that makes the classic colony look like an oriental perfume. Little more I will comment. Yes, the price, well ...

If this is done by Paco Rabanne as flanker of Invictus, he fits perfectly and everyone who is involved in the forums of perfumes, then give him sticks.

It has about 15 initial minutes that can be pleasant, mixing citrus with a sweet / aquatic note, but the perfume dilutes absurdly and after that phase, there is hardly anything interesting, except the typical synthetic and totally generic white musk.

Many thanks to the gentlemen of LVMH and to the master François Demachy, genius perfumer of our time. We really could not live without you, what a great job ...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura is like air, creaminess, and classic eau de cologne had a three-way child. Apart from the beautiful bright citrus opening, this is a slightly creamy, airy, fresh musk skin scent. It lasts quite a while, and is very fresh. Fragrantica lists ozonic notes but I get more of a soft, aldehydic vibe.

Overall, modern and fresh but not worth a bottle for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Classical colonia modernized with aldehydes and creamy notes.

Citrus floral musk but different enough from the masterpiece colonia essenza.

So natural and Pure as the name said. Very refreshing and elegant. Superb quality.

Longevity on skin is not bad but projection could be better.

Beautiful packaging and great sprayer as usual from ADP.

Expensive but worth it if you love this genre.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Are you kidding with that descriptions of that fragrance?

I bought it from Rome, Italy and unfortunately it's one overpriced and expensive soap or washing powder / gel!

After spraying, it smells around the room, like you are in the laundry room!
The longevity is around 30 minutes till 1 hour. After that the fragrance is just gone! The sillage is soft!

I really can't understand how is possible to write here so many lies??? In this website exists a lot of PSEUDOEXPERTS that deceive people with the false and bogus reviews.

Just don't throw your money down the drain for the washing powder put it in this bottle! I lost my 80 euros for 50 ml.

I think that some of the users are just promoters or workers in the companies!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Pura is manifestly modern. A brilliant effervescent take on Colonia.

As expected of an AdP release, Colonia Pura opens with that typically magnificent citrus accord. Here though the citrus is light, lurid and very unlike the original Colonia; the orange and petitgrain are sharp and acidic but transparent as if carried by a cool sea breeze on a scorching day. I suspect there are aldehydes at play here, lending that transparent and slightly metallic edge to the citrus. Coriander too imparts a cool sharpness that carries through to the middle.

In the middle, Pura really comes into its own, omitting any floral/herbal similarity to Colonia. Jasmine sambac and narcissus, both typically heavy and heady, are rendered less potent as petitgrain taints them green. This green floral accord sits atop the still spicy coriander and airy aldehydes of the opening, though the aldehydes are more distinctly metallic now than before. As patchouli and cedarwood begin to form the base, white musk again lifts the composition to airy heights when it might be expected to go the other way.

Very pleasant overall. Colonia Pura manages to be fresh, sharp and natural without ever veering overtly sweet or cloying as some Colonia flankers can. This is sure to be a spring/summer staple in my wardrobe.

Longevity is moderate at 6-8 hours, sillage is moderate also.

7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
DNA of the original colonia, but with less flowers like rose. Pura is salty and the citruses are natural like fresh pressed limes. I also get a minty note in this one, but its not listed. It may be another green note, but the perceived smell to my nose is mint. Reminds me alot of a creation from atelier cologne actually. Or if you have tried Renaissance from Xerjoff, Pura is similar but lighter, especially on the mint note. This is sharp and crisp vs the original plus essenza which are more smooth and round with a little sweetness.

Not much more to say. Very nice sparkling citrus freshy with good quality ingredience. Actually one of the best citruses I have tried.

9/10

Edit:

After several wearings: omg I love this so much. So natural, fresh and addicting. The best of all the colonia flankers imo as its sharp and not too sweet/floery as some of the other can be.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice bottle, that's all I can say.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nothing of new... 2/5

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I admit I am not a huge fan of this line, of at least the ones I have tried. They smell nice but none of them smell good enough, distinctive enough, or high quality enough to drop $150 bones on. As for Pura, its kind of the same old Acqua song and dance. Light citrus mixed with admittedly pretty florals. Nice, transparent and light and ultimately very safe. Maybe the oud or leather offerings are the ones I need to give a fair chance. Light clean citrus scents are a dime a dozen in my mind. I want to be swayed by Acqua Di Parma, it just hasn't happened yet (but I will keep trying).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: @caribbeanblue in your own words you did say that it was a cons that it was not very long lasting. And who is expecting it to fill up an entire room? I just wanted to be able to smell it after 2+ hours without digging my nose on my skin. I have already cited Essenza as an example and yet you choose to conveniently ignore it. If I hurt your feelings being an ADP fanboy then I most certainly did not intended to. Yes, we are all just stating our own opinions here so stop acting like yours should be the only valid ones. It's about the perfume so don't take it too personally.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: @Amen Corner: On my skin I can smell it up to 4hrs, I think it's a standard for an EdC. Do I wish it could last longer? Yes, 'cause i do like it, but it's an EdC with delicate notes, so it's ok. Not a strong sillage, but that's not a cons. Imho it's the person that wear the fragrance that should be perfumed, not the entire room. These are only opinions based on our tastes, skins and experiences that might be different.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: @caribbeanblue Since you said "The only cons is that is not very long-lasting", were you also expecting that it should last longer? Essenza lasts 6 hours on me so it's just fair for me to expect it from Pura as well. And the others I have tested actually projected and lasted longer than Pura. And do you think ADP will be able to sell their EDCs if they will put a disclaimer that they will only last 2.5 hours and that people should not expect anything more than that?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm big fan of this brand. I tried at mall first and first impression wasn't really good. Shop assistant insisted to give me a tester and so i tried it again during last days. Well, I changed my mind, I bought the 100ml and I do love the floral scents (jasmine and narcissus) and bases notes, it's delicate, not invasive, you won't leave scent on other people just greeting and hugging (I hate perfumes like that) and on my skin it smells so good. It's more versatile and enjoyable than classic colonia that is, in my opinion, more serious, for special occasion, not really young.
The only cons is that is not very long-lasting. But it regain strength just wetting a bit the skin with few water drops. But it's a EdC, I'm quite surprised that someone complains about that on their reviews, they should be aware of that.

9/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
